loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 51 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store. Estelita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Estelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and married with one child.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell .

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is married woman with no children . She rents a house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. Her major challenges is seasonality in her business.
With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, aged 29, is married and blessed with two dependent children in school. She resides in Tbaung Khmum province where she supports family through growing cassava and rice; she has been doing this for years. She earns about USD17 per day and can save about USD11 each day. Low cassava is the main challenge to her farming business.

In a group two members, Yorn is the group leader and this is her first time with VisionFund. She will use some of her loan to buy organic fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to support cassava farming business. Some of loan remaining will be used to buy school materials for her school-aged children. She hopes that she can earn more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow cassava and rubber trees and to keep her children in school until graduating.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve crop productivity so as to buy an additional plot of farmland and keep children in school until graduating. .

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years she has owned a food stall business, serving neighbours and town-dwellers. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in numbers of clients; since her goods are perishable, this can lead to losses.

With this 30,000 KSH loan, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business to become a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods such as sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Linda, one of Ruma's agents. Linda lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children.  Together with her husband, Linda owns and manages a small stall that sells stationaries and mobile air time credits for her community. She knows Ruma from the sales executive who came to their stall and explained about Ruma. As a woman, she was interested to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband improving their life, as well as try another business opportunity and takes part in another business sector.

As the business start to run, Linda is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Linda improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Linda is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for the members of her local community

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN DE SEÑORA DE 40 AÑOS QUE SUFRE DE INFECCIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS Y EN LAS PAREDES DE HUESO AL REDEDOR DE SUS PIEZAS DENTALES LO QUE LE ESTA PROVOCANDO DESPRENDIMIENTOS DE ELLAS, DESGRACIADAMENTE POR CUESTIONES ECONÓMICAS NO HA PODIDO ATENDERSE YA QUE ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA
texts.en:
She is a 40 year old woman who suffers from an infection in her gums and the walls of the bone around her teeth. This is causing them to become detached.

Unfortunately, for financial reasons, she has not been able to take care of this because she is the sole support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Zozo Group

texts.en:
Jamal is the featured borrower for Zozo Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Jamal is a 45-year-old married mother of three children who got employed, six years ago, in a company to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to provide her family with descent life.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Jamal is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Zainab is the first lady on the right, and Fatima is the lady sitting in the middle.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old and has five children.  Mary Jane is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, flower pot, plastic and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming flowering plants for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, flower pot, plastic and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mwanamatama

texts.en:
Mwanamatama is a divorced woman and has six children all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Argemiro Miguel

texts.es:
Argemiro es un señor soltero con 41 años de edad, dedicado desde hace tres años a la cría y venta de aves, una actividad que aprendió gracias a un amigo quien se dedicaba a lo mismo y era veterinario.
Con los ingresos que este negocio genera este hombre logra cubrir sus necesidades como lo es alimentación y vestimenta.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, este hombre solicita un préstamo para poder comprar pollos, cerdos, alimento y vacunas para los mismos.
Anhela remodelar su casita, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Argemiro, age 41, is single. He has been raising and selling birds for three years. He learned this business activity thanks to a friend who did the same thing and was a veterinarian. With the earnings that this business generates, this man manages to cover the necessities like food and clothing.

In order to improve his sales and to increase his number of customers and his earnings, this man is requesting a loan. The loan is to be able to buy chickens and pigs and feed and vaccines for them.

He longs to remodel his little house. It is taking a lot of time to build, and its current condition is not the best.

With your support this man will be able to make his dreams come true. Go for it; lend today.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs and feed and vaccines for them.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has one child and operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Paul's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 50,00 Kes. loan to service his motorcycle, and will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Felna

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Felna works hard to support her family. She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 

Felna is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Felna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school.

Cerelina is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cerelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 57 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming coconut in the Philippines. 

Bernandita requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming coconut for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Bernandita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.ru:
Каримберди, мужчина 49 лет. Он отец четверых детей и дедушка нескольких внуков. Каримберди окончив среднею школу хотел поступить в институт, но из -за финансовых трудностей не смог поступить. Но он поступил в технический техникум. Он почти 20 лет работает как бухгалтером в дехканских хозяйствах. Жизнь к нему была несправедлива. в 2010 году его жена умерла от тяжелой болезни. Он долгое время не смог смирится со смертью жены и пал духом.  
Но время всех лечит. С поддержкой своих детей он хочет отремонтировать свой дом и подготовится к зимнему сезону. Так как зима очень холодная. Но заработная плата которую он получает не хватает. Он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он хочет купить строительные материалы для ремонта своего дома. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Karimberdi is a 49-year old man. He has four children and is already a grandfather. After finishing secondary school, he wanted to go to college but it was not possible due to financial circumstances. So he enrolled in a technical college. For over 20 years he has been working as a bookkeeper on community farms. Life has dealt Karimberdi a harsh blow: in 2010 his wife passed away due to a grave illness. For a long time he could not come to terms with her loss and was depressed.

Yet time heals everyone. With his children’s support, he would like to renovate his home and prepare for the winter season since winters can be very cold. However, because his salary is insufficient, he applied to Arvand for a loan. He would like to buy  construction materials for home renovations. Karimberdi thanks Arvand in advance for its support and trust.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es un mujer con 24 años de edad, la adversidad que la ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para esta mujer querer salir adelante y cumplir sus proyectos, lo que se propone lo logra, antes deseaba tener su casa propia y ahora la tiene, en la actualidad lucha por el sueño de montar su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones el cual ubicara en la sala de la casa donde reside. Con este propósito es que solicita el préstamo, con el que comprara máquinas de coser de segunda, y así iniciar con su taller.
Se deseo es continuar con su negocio y en un futuro llegar a generar empleo.
Sueña viendo su casa bonita, mejorar su estabilidad económica y tener una buena calidad de vida.
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old. The adversity that has pursued her has not been an obstacle to this woman wanting to get ahead and complete her projects. She does what she sets out to do. Earlier she wanted to have her own house, and now she has it.

She is currently struggling with the dream of establishing her own business. It will be a sewing shop located in the living room of her house.

With this plan she is requesting the loan to buy second-hand sewing machines. This way she will start her shop. Her wish is to continue with her business, and to generate employment in the future.

She dreams of a beautiful house, improving her financial stability, and having a good quality of life.

With your support this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Go for it; make a loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand sewing machines to start her shop.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is a married man. He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Nicodemus's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.Nicodemus will use the 20,000 Kes. loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, and other vegetables. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans and has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Elizabeth's business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop diseases. She will use the 30,000 Kes. loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 50 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilibeth has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines, where she works hard to support her family. 

Ma. Elena requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Tentulikhunti village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are ten active, self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Gitanjali is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing second from the right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 22 years old and living with her husband.

Her family has been engaged in a tailoring business for the last three years. Through this business, they earn a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Gitanjali planned to improve her business in the course of the loan. She will purchase another sewing machine and a picot machine. She will appoint new staff and expand her business.

The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, grocery shop, tailoring, cloth store, and cosmetics shop. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and a picot machine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline and husband are hard working people from Ruti, in the Rwampara-Mbarara district. She owns a banana plantation and has an additional business of rentals. Her husband works with a road construction company.

She has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to add manure to her banana plantation. She thought of improving her banana plantation as one way of raising money for their children, who are in good boarding schools in Mbarara and Bushenyi. The school fees increase every term, so she and her husband are doing everything possible to be prepared. 

Indeed she is expanding, but she needs to buy more manure so as to improve the production of her banana plantation. She will also hire labour in order to increase outputs, which will increase income for her family.

She appreciates the interest that the Kiva donors have in nurturing the dreams of low income earners.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 61-year-old married woman with eleven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Loreta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 PHP loan, through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Loreta has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, a farmer living in the Bovel district of Battambang province, is 53 years old, and a mother of four dependent children.

She has overcome her family’s financial difficulties for the past 12 years by growing rice. She also works for others in order to get more income. Sokhorn is able to save about 5 USD per day from her income. Her biggest challenge is that she cannot afford fertilizer and pesticides for her crop, so her rice has not grown as well as it might.

This is Sokhorn's sixth micro loan from VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loans. Her family’s living conditions have improved because of the previous loans.

In a group of two, Sokhorn is the leader in applying for the new loan. She will manage her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and purchase more organic pesticides to improve her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her condition, and increase the income from her business.

loans.use: to  buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve her rice farm, in order to increase the yield.

loans.name: Arelis Margoth

texts.es:
Arelis es una mujer con 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo con 6 años de edad y vive con su marido en el municipio de Corozal. Ella desde su casa vende mercancía como lo es ropa y calzado, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica, luego de quedar sin empleo por varios meses y del cual se obtiene muy buenos ingresos.
Arelis se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de más mercancía, ya que se aproxima la temporada de diciembre y sus ventas aumentaran mucho.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pero principalmente poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Arelis is a 23-year-old woman; she has a 6-year-old son and she lives with her husband in the municipality of Corozal. She sells merchandise from her home, such as clothing and shoes, a business she started out of financial necessity after she was unemployed for several months and which generates good income for her.

Arelis is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, as the December season is coming and her sales will increase a lot.

Her greatest dream is to make improvements to her home, but first of all to be able to pay for her children's education, as she worries about their wellbeing.

This is why she is counting on the help of Interactuar and Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Sibani Group

texts.en:
Sibani is a Self-Help Group (SHG) formed in November 2015 by ten rural poor women of Dharamsagar village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing small enterprises. Dharamsagar is a remotely located rural village situated in the foothills.

Hemakanti, the lady sitting at the extreme right with a raised hand in the photograph, is one of the members of the SHG. She is also the leader of the group. She is a very active lady of 35 years and lives with her husband, three sons, and four daughters. Her elder son has migrated to another state in search of employment. One of her daughters has already completed her tenth standard, and due to unavailability of a higher education facility in the nearest area, stopped her study.

Hemakanti, with the help of her husband, has been fish farming for the last four years. She is doing this in the nearest Minor Irrigation Project, which she has taken on lease from the irrigation department for fish farming. She and her husband have been engaged in the work for seven months, from August to March. According to Hemakanti, on average she earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR. But, to maintain her big family, she faces many difficulties.

Therefore she wants to increase her income through improvement of her fishery. So, from the present loan of 16,000 INR, she has planned to purchase lime, vitamins, and urea for the fishery tank, and fishing net for netting of fish.

She hopes that this investment will support her to get a good income. Hemakanti hopes to construct another house and pay for the marriages of her son and daughter in the near future.

Out of the other nine members of the SHG, one member is running a general store, three members are doing stone-chopping work, and five members are doing vegetable cultivation. They also hope to improve their livelihoods through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase lime, vitamins, and urea for the fishery tank, and fishing net for netting of fish.

loans.name: Samaun Group

texts.en: Samaun is a 50-year-old, married grocer with a dependent child. She resides in a village in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been doing her business for over ten years. Her husband is a 56-year-old doctor in the village and her only child is a factory worker. Together, they can make approximately USD 6.5 per day. Samaun is pictured 1st from the right. Samaun is group leader and would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members. She will use her portion to buy groceries to sell and improve her family’s income. In the future, she is going to expand her business, and she wants to add a ground floor room to her house.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell and improve her family’s income

loans.name: Selinah

texts.en: Selinah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells mattresses, clothes, and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of mattresses, clothes, and shoes.This will enable her have more stock to sell, and  hence an increase in profits. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 48 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Hermenia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Hermenia has been in pig fattening for 13 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with thirteen children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seed and other farm supplies.

She supplements the income from farming vegetables with earnings from farming rice and sugarcane and raising chickens.

Lucila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saa

texts.en:
Saa is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Subham Group

texts.en:
This group formed in the year 2015 at Chingermunda village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Bhagyashree is one of them who taken a great role for her development and for her group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 33 years old and living with her husband and three children.

Bhagyashree and her husband have been engaged in a dairy business for the last six years. But through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 6,200 INR. Bhagyashree planned to improve her business in the course of loan. She will purchase two cows. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business. From that, Bhagyashree will make a permanent cattle shed.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different business like vegetable vending, a grocery shop, animal trading, dairy and a betel shop. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en: Savin, 43, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to support three children, one of whom who is in school. She grows rice to earn income for her family and she gets additional income via fishing. Insects made her rice not grow well last year. She has been in the business of rice farming for 20 years. This is her first time appying for a loan with VisionFund. In a group of four, she is the group leader and she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and organic fertilizer for her rice farmland to produce a good yield. She hopes that she can get a higher yield than last year, so she can get a decent income for her living condition and supporting her child’s studying.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer for her farmland so that it can produce good yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ludevin

texts.en:
Ludevin works hard to support her family. Ludevin is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ludevin has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Ludevin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Subhashree Group

texts.en:
This group formed in the year 2015 at Sindhekela village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 10 active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Champa is one of them who taken a great role for her development and for her group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 23 years old and living with her husband and only daughter.

Champa and her husband have been engaged with a grocery business for the last three years. But through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 6,300 INR. Champa planned to improve her business in the course of loan. She will purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business and save money for her future needs.

The other nine members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different business like a cycle shop and cycle repairing, a betel shop, a ready-made clothing store, tailoring and vegetable vending. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Zunilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zunilda tiene 47 años y vive en el municipio de Amagá. Tiene 3 hijos, 2 hijas de 23 y 18 años y un hijo de 15, y ellos son el motor de la vida de esta mujer, que trabaja arduamente por el bienestar de sus hijos. Hace 10 años decidió comenzar su propio negocio, ella cría cerdos y pollos para poder dar sustento a su familia. 

Esta labor que realiza la aprendió sola por el amor que le tiene a trabajar en la granja con animales, lamentablemente el negocio enfrenta algunos problemas ya que los insumos llegan a ser muy costosos y hay mucha competencia en el sector. Aun así, esta mujer lucha incansablemente para que su negocio sea exitoso y pueda ser competitivo, pues quiere que este dure muchos años más.

Zunilda está pidiendo un préstamo para con él poder adecuar la locación de los animales, comprar cemento, tubos y arena para su remodelación, además de pollos y alimento para los mismos. Apoye a esta mujer que espera poder brindarle una excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zunilda is 47 and lives in the municipality of Amagá. She has three children, two daughters who are 23 and 18, and a 15-year-old son, and they are the driving force in this woman's life. She works hard for her children's wellbeing. Ten years ago she decided to start her own business; she raises pigs and chickens to be able to support her family.

She learned the work she does on her own because of her love of working with animals on the farm. Unfortunately her business is facing some problems as her supplies are very expensive and there is a lot of competition in the area. Even so, this woman is working tirelessly so that her business will be successful and competitive, as she wants is to be around for many more years.

Zunilda is requesting a loan so she can refit her animals' living quarters. She will buy cement, pipes, and sand for her remodel, as well as chickens and feed. Support this woman who wants to offer her children an excellent education.

loans.use: to refit her animals' living quarters by buying cement, pipes, and sand for her remodel, as well as chickens and feed.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 28-year-old lady and a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own dry cleaning business for the past 14 years. Shabana's husband needs to purchase different merchandise, e.g., bleach, laundry detergent, and an iron, etc. for his business. But due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the needs of her husband, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for his business. It will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his dry cleaning business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ACHOCALLA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de maderas, venta de mantas, venta de gelatina, venta de muebles, venta de chompas, venta de ropa deportiva.
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga y lo implemento hace más de dieciocho años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ACHOCALLA” communal bank is starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional branch. It is made up of nine members, led by a board of directors with Julia as President. The businesses that the members carry out are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of wood, selling blankets, selling jelly, the sale of furniture, selling sweaters and selling sports clothing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, Julia being one of them. She indicated that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago, joining on the invitation of a friend. She currently has a business selling blankets. She says she learned the business from her friend and started it more than 18 years ago.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying alpaca wool wholesale) that she will acquire at the vendors in the city of El Alto and later after making them, will sell in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that the likes the health and savings services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool wholesale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two children ages seven and one. With her eagerness to help her husband, she successfully started her own business. She sells food in the community of Tubigon, Bohol. Her profit is used for school allowances for her child. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as milk, cream, cooking oil and sugar.

Jocelyn has many dreams, but her biggest dream is to improve her business to be able to give a good education to her children someday so they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy milk, cream, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Taratarini Group

texts.en:
This group formed in the year 2012 at Ghantasunipada village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are nine active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Ranjulata is one of them who taken a great role for her development and for her group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 30 years old and living with her husband, one daughter and one son.

Ranjulata and her husband have been engaged with a grocery business for the last 10 years. But through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 8,800 INR. Ranjulata planned to improve her business in the course of loan.

It will be the third loan cycle for the group. The group has utilized the previous loans for income generation activities and repaid on time.

From this loan, Ranjulata will purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business and save money for her future needs.

The other eight members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different business like a betel shop, a tea & tiffin stall, animal trading, and leaf-plate making and selling. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potatoes, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Wati, one of Ruma's agents. Wati lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only son. Wati decided to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband by increasing their income. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider, as well as the woman who has a friendly personality.

As the business grows, Wati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Wati’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

Wati is the one who is sitting. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore, Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Lubna is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Jane Nena

texts.en:
Jane Nena is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in a town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. She has four sons ages eight, six, four and two years old. Her husband raised them through driving, he is a bus driver.

Jane Nena is a woman with ambition. She is engaged in various businesses to augment their livelihood. She is engaged in selling personal collection (PC) products such as home care, personal care, baby care, health and apparel products. She also does manicure and pedicure services for additional earnings. Hence, she is asking for a loan to buy personal collection products (mentioned earlier). She will also buy manicure and pedicure sets such as nail polish, nail trimmers, nipper and cuticle remover. Jane Nena is also in need for money to buy materials for housing. Currently, she is in the middle of building their new house. She dreams of owning a fully furnished house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy personal collection (PC) products and pedicure sets; buy materials for housing

loans.name: Lirios De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIRIOS DE VILLA ADELA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de manteles y cortinas, venta de frazadas, venta de pan. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de su cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y  posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “LIRIOS DE VILLA ADELA” communal bank will begin their second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of eight members led by a board of directors with Elsa as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: selling shawls, selling food, a neighborhood store, selling vegetables, the sale of clothing, selling tablecloths and curtains, the sale of blankets and selling bread.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small micro-entrepreneurs, Elsa being one of them. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of her sister-in-law who is a member of this institution. At present she owns a neighborhood store. She says that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying canned goods wholesale) which she will acquire at the vendors in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her sales space. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy canned goods wholesale.

loans.name: Vepkhvia

texts.en:
Vepkhvia is 43 years old. He lives in Khashuri district with his wife and 5 children. Vepkhvia works as a physical worker and gets daily salary. He decided to start additional activity in order to feed his large family.

Vepkhvia requested a loan for starting an animal husbandry business.
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a cow and will start his husbandry business. The family will start producing dairy products and will sell the dairy products as well as use them for the family.
Vepkhvia awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
Alban wants to thank all of the lenders for the help obtaining his loan to continue his fast food business. He is still in the same business and very happy with it. He feels very fortunate to be able to have a private business in which to generate in come from for his family.

For the second time he is requesting a loan in order to renovate his fast food restaurant and to purchase materials for it. He hopes again that this loan will help to expand his business and eventually open another fast food shop and hire employees.

loans.use: to renovate his fast food restaurant and to purchase materials for it.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el trigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ascencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de abarrotes, venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, ferretería, venta de calzados, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ascencia es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y lo implemento hace más de cuarenta y dos años.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de fideos y azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tienen un hijo.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y los ahorros que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "Rebirth" communal association is initiating its 36th loan cycle in Pro Mujer, through their Central Office in Villa Adela. The group is composed of eight members and is administered by a board of directors with Mrs. Ascencia as its President. The businesses the members are advancing are varied: among them are selling hose, groceries, condiments, clothing, furniture, hardware, shoes and artifacts.

The loan which Ascencia is presently taking out will augment her capital, allowing her to buy spaghetti and sugar at wholesale. She will acquire these from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and, later, sell them at her market stall. This form of work permits Ascencia to generate resources to aid her family economically, since she is a widow with a son.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, Ascencia responded that she likes the training and the savings account that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase spaghetti and sugar at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rolieta

texts.en:
Maria Rolieta is a 37-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is a single mother of a two-year-old daughter. Raising her daughter alone needs courage and determination. Maria Rolieta also needs to work hard to provide the needs of her child and she therefore sells electronic load for mobile phones as well as selling food. Her profits are important for this woman who needs financial stability to raise her child well. 

Maria Rolieta is requesting a loan to buy electronic load for mobile phones and to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, vegetables, and fruits. In the future, she wishes to augment her livelihood for her child. Maria Rolieta wants to give her daughter a good education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy electronic load for mobile phones and ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn lives a simple life with her family in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 26-year-old woman and mother of a three-year-old boy. Her husband works hard as a fisherman, while Darlyn helps her husband in fishing. They have been doing this since a year after they got married to earn a living.

Darlyn is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets and fishing knots (this is used as a baseline of fishing nets). She will also use the money to buy gasoline for their fishing boat and to pay for boat maintenance as well. In the future, Darlyn wants to augment her business to be able to give her son and future children a good education someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets, fishing knots, and gasoline for the fishing boat, and to pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 31 years old. She is married to Simon who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children between 15 and 10 years old.

Naomi has had a quarrying business for 10 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.She has borrowed KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, after repaying the previous loan successful.She now has started farming as her new business apart from quarrying. 

Naomi will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting. Therefore she  hopes that the anticipated profits will help her buy food for the family, and pay school fees for her children as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established quarry business as well as farming so as to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old. She is married with six children. 

She has had a retail shop business which she has operated for five years and it has been profitable. 

She has requested for a loan which she will be using to purchase additional household goods as new stock.

With the anticipated profits, Judith will be able to repay her loan as well as pay school fees for her children.. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a piece of land and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie is 41 years old; a father of his three children. To earn for a living, he engaged in planting and harvesting crops to be able to support the daily needs of his family. He earn a lot from this activity, he was able to pay his previous loan. Recently, he borrowed loan from GDMPC to buy variety of seedlings and fertilizer such as manure to produce a good quality  vegetables to their local community members.He wants to improved their living condition.

loans.use: to buy variety of seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn has been running her banana plantation business for many years.She was earning more profit on it. She was able to pay her previous loan. She wants to expand and engage in other business activities.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and to pay banana replanting costs in order to produce plenty of bananas for the market. She wants to improve the general living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  and to pay banana replanting cost

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells television, speakers, radio, adapters and other electronics. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of television, adapters, speakers and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of television, adapters, speakers and other items

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and married with four children, one child still in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc .

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza  is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza  is 61 years old and has one child still in school.

Flordeliza  has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dog, bamboo sticks, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Flordeliza  has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dog, bamboo sticks, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old, married and has two children.  

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Agostina

texts.en:
Agostina is a businesswoman who has been running a kiosk for the past year. She started her business with her own working capital of 300 USD and she earns a good income. Agostina is happy to do business because many people like to buy her products. She also has animals such as dogs, pigs, and chickens.

Agostina is requesting an 800 USD loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergent, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snacks, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks to sell. She wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, sugar, cooking oil, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snacks, biscuits, noodles, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Tulasi Group

texts.en:
This group formed in the year 2015 at Belpadar village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 11 active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Nandini is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and her group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from left with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 24 years old and living with her husband and only son.

Nandini and her husband have been engaged with a tea and tiffin (snacks) stall business for the last four years. But through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Nandini planned to improve her business in the course of loan. She will purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove, and rice, wheat, oil, etc. She hopes to get more income through the expansion of her business. From that, Nandini will save more for her future needs.

The other 10 members of her group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different business like vegetable vending, tailoring, animal trading, dairy and a betel shop. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase necessary utensils, four chairs, a gas stove, and rice, wheat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hanunah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Hanunah. Hanunah lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her family.  She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to be an entrepreneur. Her community sees her as an informative mobile provider, as well as a woman who has kind personality.

As the business grows, Hanunah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Hanunah's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Hanunah is the one who is sitting. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community.

loans.name: Alh. Musa

texts.en:
Alh. Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to its support, he is thankful that the days of poor yields are long past. As a Babban Gona member he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Customarily, Alh. Musa would have had to sell his maize at a low price at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain 37% more in profit than the harvest price.

With an opportunity to earn up to 2000 USD per hectare, Alh. Musa now wishes to enlarge his maize business for himself and family members. He has applied for a 56,675 NGN loan through Kiva's field partner Babban Gona to participate in its program and so avoid selling his maize at the low price offered at harvest time. He would like to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to avoid having to sell his maize at a minimal price through Babban Gona's program.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina works as a tailor who sews women’s clothes. She has managed to repay her first loan.

Paulina is requesting a loan to buy a sewing or tailoring machine to expand her business. She plans to use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her child. Paulina will repay her “social interest” loan with her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering at school.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine to tailor clothes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a single woman. She has 2 children. She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for 1 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will open other business outlets. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working woman who earns a living through selling fruits and vegetables.  She has a stall located inside the market in her place.  She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life. 
She is married with four children, two of them are still attending school.

Marilyn  had her own home for 30  years, and so she is happy to have her own, welcoming place in which to live. 
She is  asking for a loan from CEVI to have additional capital to support her  fruits and vegetable business.  She would like to purchased variety of fruits, vegetables and spices.  In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. She could pay her obligation and manages her earnings wisely. 

With her previous loan, Marilyn managed to invest in fruit and vegetable vending  to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to purchased variety of fruits, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 43-year-old man and lives with his family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. He buys and sells fish to earn a living and be able to provide the needs of his family. He has been doing this since he started his married life.

He is a father of three young boys aged nine, eight and two years. Thus, Edwin is asking for a larger loan amount for additional capital to buy more fish to sell. He wanted to enhance the business' profitability for the sake of his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Visitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop. Visitacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Rialyn is 23 years old and is the youngest of six children in the family. Her mother, Norma, supports the family with her general store business in the Philippines.

Rialyn studies bookkeeping and is currently in the first year of this two-year course. Norma is borrowing 16,500 PHP to pay the tuition fees for Rialyn's first semester of the 2015-16 school year.

When she graduates, Rialyn plans to be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Eriolita

texts.en:
Eriolita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,500 loan through NWTF buy more stocks of household goods to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eriolita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jonilyn

texts.en:
Jonilyn is 31 years old and married with one child. Jonilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc .

Jonilyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jonilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 55 years old and has two children are still in school.

Myrna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Myrna has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 36 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Alona works very hard to provide for them.

Alona has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alona has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Alona would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Lai is a 55-year-old woman who is married with five children. She and her family are living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province. Her main source of income is from rice grown on two-hectare areas. Moreover, she can earn supplemental income by working as a laborer for others. Her rice did not grow well because it has been destroyed by insects, and this is her main challenge. She has been involved in farming for years, and she can save from her income about 11 USD per day.

This is her second micro-loan with VisionFund, and she fully paid back her past loan. She leads a group of three in seeking this new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more rice seed and organic fertilizer to improve her rice farm's yields. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her living conditions and expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy more rice seed and organic fertilizer to improve crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 43 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Chokhatauri district.

Badri works as a driver and gets a monthly salary. He decided to start his own business and requested a loan for a business start up.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Microfinance Organization Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 5,800.

With the received credit, Badri will purchase a car and will place gas containers on the car. In his district, gas is not installed in the houses, so Badri will fill up the big containers and help his villagers to charge their small gas balloons, which are mainly used for cooking. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business.

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and place gas containers on the car in order to charge gas balloons, mainly used for cooking.

loans.name: Ahmad Sofyan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ahmad, one of Ruma’s agents. He lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ahmad lives there with his wife and two children. He owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He knows Ruma from a sales executive who came to him and explained about Ruma’s core and purpose. Ahmad is interested in joining Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business as well as contribute to his community. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Kiva to get working capital that he will use to buy more mobile airtime credits for his business and community. Knowing about the importance of his work, your loan will be very useful to help him improve his business and, accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. Ahmad is shown in this photo standing in front of his own stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to get working capital to buy mobile airtime credits for his community

loans.name: Ananiah

texts.en:
Ananaia is a hardworking man aged 50, a resident from kikatsi- Kiruhura district. He is an experienced farmer in goat rearing and cattle fattening. He has been borrowing from ugafode for more than four years and is a principle farmer in the village, but has always come to ugafode for loans to buy more goats and cows for fattening and labor to work on the plantations.

He is requesting for a loan of ugx.4,000,000/= purposely for buying goats that he will rear and sell at a profit.
He appreciates the support rendered to him.

loans.use: to buy goats for selling.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Fancisco is a 53 year-old married Father of six children who works hard to support his family. He is on the staff of government and his wife is housewife. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their son’s education.

This loan of $ 1000 will allow Fancisco to help his son Jose will continue his study in university. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school materials. In the future, Francisco hopes that his son is all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition, textbooks and university materials.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chicken. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more chicken and other farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of hair weaves, hair chemicals for salon use. Her business goal is to open other business outlets within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of hair weaves, hair chemicals for salon use

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Gemma has been raising ducks for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending. Gemma is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

loans.name: Regalada

texts.en:
Regalada is 65 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Regalada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, sugar, detergent soap, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, detergent soap, soft-drinks, coffee, etc.

Regalada would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, sugar, detergent soap, soft-drinks, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 57 years old and married with six children. For the past 22 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Corazon is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and additional equipment for her food stall.

loans.name: Badru

texts.en: Badru was appraised as an individual client from Mpigi district in butambala the client is aged 30 years and is married with three children. He is an agriculturist besides which he has a retail shop at a rural trading centre as an income supplement. He works six days a week and twelve hours per day he has a challenge of price fluctuations for both business items and agro out puts. The client is therefore looking forward to acquire a loan of one million seven hundred thousand shillings only to increase on his working capital such that he can buy stock of home produce use items for sell.

loans.use: to boost his retail trade by buying more stock.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Regil

texts.en:
Regil is a hard working woman with four children.  She earns a living by engaging in buy and sell business. She buys at the same time sold humay (newly harvest rice).
She is 32-year-old married woman. Her oldest child is 13 while the youngest is 3. 
She lives in the rural area of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. 
Her husband has an income that could that help her sustain the family's daily needs.


She has requested a loan to buy more stocks of  rice.  With these, her purchasing power will improve and enables her to improve her income.  In this way she would be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of  rice

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk and manure. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 27 years old and has four children.  Dina is married and has four children who are in school.

Dina is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Dina requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Dina has been  for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 41 years old and married with six children. All of her children are enrolled in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a married mother of four children. She lives int her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling clothes. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.
