With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 40 years old and a mother of four children. She lives in Kampong Cham province, She supports three dependent children, two in school.

She has sold grocery items as her main source of income for 20 years. Touch also works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

Touch can save from her daily income about $7 (USD) per day. This is her first micro loan with VisionFund and she is leading a group of three to apply for this loan.

As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items to expand her business. She hopes that her business can increase her income to support her living conditions and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to get more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ines Esmelda

texts.es:
La psicología es una de las carreras que analiza el comportamiento de las personas, de forma que esto permita solucionar algunas etapas donde hubo tropiezos. Esto le permitió a Ines sentirse muy identificada en la licenciatura, llevándola a cursar ya el quinto año todos los sábados. A sus 25 años de edad, ella es docente y tiene el apoyo de su tía, su madre y de su padre, quienes son comerciantes.
Ya estar a punto de concluir con esta etapa de gran importancia para Ines, le trae orgullo, pues ha trabajado fuerte para ello. De manera que ella no quiere tener obstáculos para finalizar la carrera, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y su graduación. Esto le permitirá obtener su título como psicóloga y optar por mejores trabajos. En sus planes está conseguir un trabajo acorde a lo estudiado y seguir ayudándole a las personas de su iglesia con charlas.
texts.en:
Psychology is an area of study that analyzes human behavior in order to allow one to correct some stages where there have been setbacks.  Ines feels that she identifies with this aspect of the discipline.  She has been studying it for 5 years every Saturday.  At 25 years old, she is a teacher and has the support of her aunt and her mother and father, who are merchants.

Ines is about to complete a stage in her life that is very important to her.  It gives her pride, since she has worked hard for it.  Since she doesn't want to face any obstacles finishing her degree, she is requesting a loan to pay for her degree course and graduation.  This will allow her to become a licensed psychologist and be able to opt for a better job.  Her plan is to get a job fitting of her degree and continue helping the people in her church by giving talks.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course and graduation.

loans.name: Benadeta Elikana

texts.en:
Benadeta volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, both helping students understand their well-being and teaching them life skills.

Benadeta has managed to repay her first loan which she used for her grocery business. She is now requesting a second Kiva loan to expand her grocery business by increasing the commodities she sells.

Benadeta plans to use the profit she will earn to pay for her children's school fees and provide them with decent meals and health care.

loans.use: to purchase products in bulk, which will increase her profit margin.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Oecusse, She has been in business since 2012 starting with her own working capital of $350.

She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy stock for her store including coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, beverages, eggs, pens, notebooks and other things to sell.

Domingas has a small kiosk and uses a push cart walk around. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, beverages, eggs, pens, notebooks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 20-year-old lady who is married and blessed with one child. She sells secondhand and new shoes, a business she has been in for the last year. It has been bringing in returns.

This is Aisha's first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase both secondhand and new shoes to resell at a profit.

With her anticipated profits, Aisha will be able to repay her loan. She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase both secondhand and new shoes to resell.

loans.name: Cristhian Ruben

texts.es:
La disciplina de Christian, lo han llevado a que sus 22 años de edad este estudiando la licenciatura en Farmacias, donde además también ha tenido la oportunidad de poner en práctica sus conocimientos como auxiliar de farmacia. Él cuenta con ela poyo incondicional de su padre, que es ebanista y de su madre, quien es comerciante.
La curiosidad de los medicamentos, más los conocimientos adquiridos para mejorar la salud de las personas, llamaron la atención de Christian, quien cursa ya el quinto año de la carrera. Ahora que está punto de concluir su licenciatura, solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación, de manera que le permitirá obtener la licencia que tanto necesita para trabajar y emprender. En sus planes está tener su propia farmacia con los ahorros que tendrá mientras trabaje.
texts.en:
Christian's discipline has brought him to the point where, at 22, he is studying to get his degree in pharmacology.  He has also had the opportunity to put his knowledge into practice as a assistant in a pharmacy.  He is able to count on the unconditional support of his father,a carpenter, and his mother, a merchant.

Christian is curios about medicine and interested in obtaining the necessary knowledge to improve people's health. He is in his 5th year at university.  Now that he is on the verge of completing his degree, he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree course, which will allow him to get the degree that he needs so much to get a job and go through with his plans.  His plans are to use the money that he saves from working to start his own pharmacy.

loans.use: to pay for his degree course.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 23 years old, single and lives in Iringa district with her parents. Christina is a Camfed core trainer who works with learner guides in secondary school. She teaches them the importance of education and how they can help children improve their learning performance.

Christina runs a stationery business selling exercise books, pens, flip charts, file folders, and reams of paper. She also provides such services as printing, typing, photocopying and laminating.

Christina is requesting a Kiva loan to buy materials such as reams of paper and to employ one person to help her with the business. Christina plans to use the profit to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to buy materials like reams of paper and to employ one person.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
For 21 years, Andresa, aged 46, has been nurturing hogs in back of her house located in Polomolok, South Cotabato. It’s been a helpful source of additional income that supports her children. 2 of her children are already working, while the youngest is in college. Her 48-year-old husband, Alfredo, is a farmer who concentrates on growing corn and vegetables. Their farm is located near their house, just adjacent to their pigpen.

Andresa takes care of a boar and sow. When the sow gets pregnant and gives birth to several piglets, she sells them after weaning. This is the way she earns her income. Therefore she aims to have several sows that can give birth to more piglets. But for now she needs to buy feed for her boar and sow plus fertilizer for her vegetable farm. She trusts your kind heart for financial assistance worth 20,000 PHP.

Andresa is not worried about the repayment because she can harvest matured corn soon. She prays for good health and sustaining grace from God. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her boar and sow and fertilizer for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La pulpería de Rosa cada vez va colorida, pues en sus estantes existe una variedad de productos que le ha permitido llegar hasta donde está. A sus 55 años de ella, ella quiere agradecer a las personas que le han ayuda en el préstamo anterior, pues con él pudo comprar granos básicos, leche, papel higiénico, entre otros productos que le permitieron tener buenos ingresos en el periodo pasado.
Ahora Rosa desea volver a invertir en su negocio de más de ocho años, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, jabón, salsas, fósforos, entre productos que no tiene en estos momentos y que sabe que le permite tener excelentes ingresos. Es sus planes está mejorar el negocio de las piñatas, para ampliar también sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa's neighborhood shop is more colorful all the time, as on her shelves are a variety of products that have allowed her to reach the point where she is. At 55 years old, she wants to thank the people who helped her with the previous loan, with which she was able to purchase staple grains, milk, toilet paper, and other products that allowed her to have a good income in the last period.

Now, Rosa would like to invest once again in this business that she has had for more than eight years, so she is requesting another loan to buy rice, beans, ham, sauces, matches, and other products that she does not currently have. She knows these products will bring in excellent income. She also plans to improve her piñata business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, ham, sauces, matches, and other products.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hard-working man who operates a retail shop in the central market. He is 39 years old and a resident of Mbarara. Stephen supports four children and one other dependent from his late sister, who died a year ago.

All the children are in good schools and depend on Stephen for their survival. To support such a large family with its many responsibilities, he started a business renting houses.

Stephen wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy construction materials for renovating his rental houses. This will allow him to increase the rental fees and thus obtain more income. Stephen is resilient and dreams of a successful life with your support.

loans.use: to renovate the rental units..

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

Lanie has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosario

texts.es:
Francisca es una docente de 62 años de edad, que no se cansa enseñar todos sus conocimientos desde hace 36 años. Ella ha sido una mujer de admirar, pues además de servir como transmisora de conocimientos hacia adolescentes, ha sido madre soltera, lo que ha afinado su instinto maternal y educativo durante tantos años. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, pues se vuelve incondicional en todo momento. 
Si bien ella trabaja como maestra, no se cansa de aprender, por lo que todos los domingos estudia un Doctorado en educación. Continuar sus estudios superiores es lo que más le ha gustado hacer, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su doctorado en educación y así seguir creciendo profesionalmente. En sus planes está estudiar más y dejar una huella poniendo una escuela para adultos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 62-year-old teacher who never tires of teaching all that she knows.  She has been teaching for 36 years.  She is an admirable woman, since in addition to serving as a conduit of knowledge to adolescents, she has been a single mother, which has fine-tuned her maternal and educational instinct over many years.  She has the support of her daughter, which is unconditional and constant.  

Even though she works as a teacher, she never tires of learning, which is why she spends every Sunday studying to get PhD in education.  Continuing her education has been what she has enjoyed the most, which is why she is requesting a loan to pay for her degree in education and therefore continue growing professionally.  Her plans are to study more and leave her mark by establishing a school for adults.

loans.use: to pay for her doctorate degree in education.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando continua con sus estudios de administración rural, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior de kiva pudo pagar sus estudios, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda, este es su tercer préstamo que quiere invertirlo de vuelta en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
Armando es una persona muy dedicada, es por ello que invierte en sus estudios, quiere ser un profesional útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás.
texts.en:
Armando is continuing his studies in Rural Management. He says that his previous Kiva loan was used to pay for his studies, which was a great help. This is his third loan that he has requested and he will invest it in the payment of his degree fees.

Armando is a very dedicated individual who wants to invest in his studies. He would like to become a useful professional, not only for himself, but also to others.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like spices, canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like spices, canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and buy farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her rice dealer.

Gloria dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es: Diana es una habitante de Bogotá que anteriormente residía en una región del país en la que se vio afectada por el conflicto armado y tuvo que salir desplazada, en vista de esta situación inició su propio negocio con el legado de su familia, ella es una excelente cocinera que maneja una variada gama de platos típicos Colombianos y no tuvo dudas de que su restauran iba a ser todo un éxito.  Esta idea de negocio la inició hace nueve años y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre en el negocio, diariamente apertura a las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 4  p.m. un horario propicio para la venta de desayunos y almuerzos.  Generalmente sus clientes son habitantes del sector y en gran medida sus ventas se realizan de contado, así como sus compras de víveres las realiza de contado en la central de abastos de la localidad. En la actualidad ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para incrementar su inventario de víveres y poder elaborar más cantidad de comida en pro de aumentar sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar la capacidad de su negocio y poder adquirir su vivienda en la capital del país.
texts.en:
Diana is an inhabitant of Bogotá who previously lived in a region of the country that was affected by the armed conflict and had to leave. In view of this situation she started her own business when her family arrived.

She is an excellent cook who can manage a varied range of traditional Colombian dishes. She had no doubt that her restaurant would be a success. This idea for a business started nine years ago and she has the help of her mother in the business. She opens daily at 6 am and closes at 4pm; a suitable timetable to sell breakfast and lunch. In general her clients are inhabitants of the area and most of her sales are in cash, as are her purchases of food that she makes at the local wholesalers.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Kiva processed by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase her inventory of food and be able to make a greater quantity of food and increase her sales. Her goal for the future is to increase the capacity of her business and be able to acquire a house in the capital of the country.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 43 years old, and she is married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Merly runs a business making and selling charcoal from coconut shells in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more coconut shells for making her charcoal.

Merly has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her coconut shell charcoal business for 10 years, though she also earns some income from motorcycle transport.

Merly aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Macarina

texts.en:
Macarina is 38 years old and married with ten children. Nine of her children are enrolled in school.

Macarina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Macarina has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Macarina aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
El espíritu inspirador de Marlene, han llevado a esta emprendedora de 49 años de edad a estar donde está actualmente. Teniendo por más de quince años la pulpería, pero iniciando con la venta de tortillas y luego cuajadas, fue el impulso para establecer su negocio actual. 
Marlene cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos, quienes siempre están a sol y sombra para ayudar en todo. Ella sueña con hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar la infraestructura, pero antes debe obtener mayores ingresos. Por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, pan, leche, entre otros productos que a diario piden sus clientes y que le ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos para cumplir con el sueño de mejorar y extender su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene's inspiring spirit has carried this enterprising 49-year-old woman to the point where she currently is. She has had her small neighborhood store for more than 15 years, but the impetus to establish her current business came when she started selling tortillas and "cuajadas" [soft fresh balls of cheese made from raw milk].

Marlene has the support of her husband and her children, who are always ready to help with everything rain or shine. She dreams of making her business grow and improving the infrastructure, but first she must obtain better revenues. That's why she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, and milk, among other products that her customers ask for on a daily basis. These will help her to improve her revenues in order to fulfill her dream of improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soft drinks, bread, and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in markets

loans.name: Domoh Alwared Group

texts.en:
Maryam is the featured borrower for Domoh Alwared Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Maryam is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. Five years ago, she started working in clothes designing to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children.

Maryam is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is very creative and has professional skills in this domain. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to buy necessary materials (satin textiles, crochet materials, strass, etc.) to design occasion dresses.

Maryam is the first lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Mariam is the lady standing in the middle, and Amena is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials (satin textiles, crochet materials, strass, etc.) to design occasion dresses.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
61-year old Severa runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She is married with 10 grown children. For almost 6 years now, she has been selling commodities such as powdered milk, energy drinks, sugar, cooking oil, powdered soap, noodles, soft drinks, and toiletries. She caters mostly to neighbors in her place.

Severa needs this loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, and condiments in order to raise her sales and make more profits. In this way, she will be able to boost her income and cater to her customers' needs.

For the future, Severa hopes to expand her project by maintaining her inventory of merchandise so she can meet customer demand and become sustainable.

Severa thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, and condiments.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia has been running her piggery business for many years. She is determined enough in sustaining her business and she's workng very hard in order to support their daily needs. She's earning from this activity, In fact, she was able to send her children in school and able to pay their school fees. She want to earn more profit and decided to avail a new loan to buy feeds so that she will be able to produce plenty of meats in the market. She wants to improve the living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets.

location.town: LA ESPERANZA, RIZAL, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe became an entrepreneur five years ago. She currently handles a direct-selling business. She started with only a small amount of capital to buy her first products. Because of her steadfast determination, she has now earned the trust of her customers. Although there are times that she struggles when there are delayed payments, she still works hard because she believes that such situations are inevitable part of handling a business.

She is 59 years old and has three kids. She sells different kinds of products, mostly, personal products like clothing items, undergarments, shoes and other footwear selections. The profit she gets from the business becomes a great help to her family in terms of their daily expenses.

Fe is a typical mother with a typical dream for her children. There is nothing more that she hopes aside from her children to gain a better quality of education and then receive a college degree.

This is the reason why she wants to further improve her resources. She wants to ask for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more products to sell. With this, she can surely gain more income. Part of what she will gain she will save for future investments and part will be used for their everyday living.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness.

Fe meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell like clothing items, undergarments, shoes and other footwear selections.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a business doing direct-selling of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional beauty products to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store .

Irene dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to sell for her business

loans.name: Isabel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La sonrisa que se dibuja en los labios de Isabel, muestra lo feliz y orgullosa que se siente de estar a punto de concluir tu carrera de Administración de Empresas, pues tras varios sacrificios, teniendo a su madre viva, quien desea la mirara graduarse, para ella es lo mejor. A sus 26 años de edad, estudia todos los sábados el cuarto año de la carrera, estudios pagados gracias al apoyo de su madre, quien posee una pulpería en su casa y de su ardua labor limpiando casas desde hace tres años. 
Isabel no contiene su felicidad al contar de sus metas, pues ya quiere conseguir un trabajo acorde a lo estudiado, sin embargo, antes debe concluir esta etapa, por lo que solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación y así obtener su título y abrir muchas puertas a mejores empleos.
texts.en:
The smile that appears on Isabel's face shows that she is happy and proud that she is about to finish her degree in business administration.  For Isabel, knowing that her mother is alive to see her graduate after their many sacrifices is the best feeling ever. At 26, she is in the 4th year at university,  studying every Saturday. Her studies are paid for thanks to the support of her mother who has a grocery store in her home and has worked arduously cleaning houses for the past three years.

Isabel is not able to contain her happiness at the completion of her goals, since she wants to get a job befitting of her studies.  However, before being able to conclude this stage, she needs a loan to pay for her degree course and therefore obtain her degree and open many doors to better employment.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

May has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from gasoline retailing.

May has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Argentina

texts.es:
El año pasado, Sandra sufrió una crisis económica, porque los clientes no pagaban, lo que la desmotivó por unos momentos, pero que también sirvieron de experiencia para cambiar su forma de trabajar en invertir más, de manera que solicitó un préstamo con el cual pudo levantarse en su negocio de venta de cosméticos y pulpería. Por esta razón, ella agradece a todas las personas que ayudaron en ese crédito. 
Actualmente, esta emprendedora de 63 años de edad, desea volver a invertir, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar perfumes, cremas, aceites, panes, maquillaje, granos básicos, entre otros productos de alta demanda en su negocio variado. En sus planes está poner una funeraria y volverse más independiente.
texts.en:
Last year Sandra experienced an economic crisis because her customers quit paying. This discouraged her for a bit, but also served as experience, motivating her to change her form of business by investing more. In that vein she sought a loan from which she could start her business as a corner store and selling cosmetics. In that regard, she is grateful to all the people who helped with that loan.

Currently, this 63 year old entrepreneur wants to return to invest again, so she seeks a loan to buy perfumes, creams, oils, breads, makeup, and staple grains, among other products of high demand in her varied business. She has plans to start a funeral home and become more independent.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, oils, breads, makeup, and staple grains among other products.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred appreciates that Kiva lenders funded his previous loan. He is a married man and lives in a rural area with his wife. They have two kids who are still young.

Fred works in agriculture, specifically growing passion fruit and vegetables. He also supplements his family income with money from a motor cycle which he rents out on a daily basis. He works six days a week and 10 hours each day. He started his business with the aim of earning a living since he never attended school.

He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers for his passion fruit plantation.

Fred's clients are traders from surrounding towns, and his dream is to grow passion fruit on a commercial scale. His biggest challenges are lack of enough capital, unpredictable weather changes, and unstable prices for agricultural products.

He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a widowed woman aged 49 years with eight children and three of whom still attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She lives in a rural area and deals in the bar business and she has been doing it for fifteen years. She supplements her family income with agriculture.

She started this business with the aim of getting money to increase the family income. She has acquired this loan facility in order to restock her bar. Her clients are fellow residents from around her area and her dream is to expand her business but her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital and delay of payments by her customers. She is appreciative of the kiva partnership and support.

loans.use: to buy stock of local brews to sell.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan is a 41-year-old married rice farmer who resides in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia with 3 children in her care. 2 of her children attend school.

Nan is pictured in the photo first from the right and has been cultivating rice since 1991. Her husband is a 37-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can make approximately 4 USD per day.

Nan is a group leader who would like to request a loan as a group of 4 members. She is requesting her loan portion to buy fertilizer for rice farming. This loan will help her to have enough fertilizer for rice cultivation, so she will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family.

In the future, Nan is going to save money to expand her business and support her children so they can earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Julia works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Julia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Julia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is 48 years old lady and a responsible mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running his own shuttering manufacturing business for past 10 years. Qamar's son needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g iron rods, welding rods, and soldering rods etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these merchandises. To fulfill the need of her son Qamar has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her son to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Qamar is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her son wanted to increase his shuttering manufacturing business

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La gente habla de lo positivo de los ahorros, Juana puede comprobar que con este pudo establecer su propia pulpería, con la que puede sustentar su hogar, con un esposo que la apoyo desde el momento de hacer el negocio realidad hasta en la actualidad, y con sus tres hijos menores de trece años, quienes siempre están dispuestos a dar lo mejor en el colegio y ayudar en algunos tiempos libres a su madre en la pulpería. 
A sus 35 años de edad, Juana se mira con muchas de sus metas realizadas, entre ellas, poseer un negocio con más de siete años estable. Lo que la motiva en invertir en todo momento por este gran sueño, de manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar leche en polvo, salsas, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, entre otros productos necesarios en la vida diaria de las personas y que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos. En sus planes está mejorar su nivel de vida y el local de la pulpería.
texts.en:
People speak of the benefits of saving. Juana can attest that with savings she was able to start her corner store, with which she supports her household. Her husband has helped her from the moment the business became a reality until the present. They have three children under age 13, who are always ready to do their best at school, and to help their mother at her corner store in their free time.

At 35 years old, Juana sees many of her goals accomplished, among them, owning her own business for seven stable years. This motivates her to invest at all times, for her great dream. She now seeks a loan to buy powdered milk, salsas, sugar, beans and soap, among other products needed for people's daily lives, which will increase her earnings. Her plans include improving her quality of life and improving the locale of her corner store.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, salsas, sugar, beans, and soap, among other products.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, proviene de una familia muy humilde que con sacrificio y lucha está pudiendo salir adelante, sus padres son su mayor fortaleza y quienes siempre han estado con ella.
Esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería y por medio de ello quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, y también ayudar a las personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Vidalia is from the city of Villarrica.  She comes from a very humble family who, with sacrifice and tenacity, is managing to get ahead.  Her parents are her main strength, and they have always been with her.

She is studying for a nursing degree.  Through her education, she wants to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.  She also wants to help people.

Vidalia is requesting this loan to pay for her educational expenses.  This way she can continue to study as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 53 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional school supplies.

Elda has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to buy more farm land for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Marites is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to to buy her own fishing boat and save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old and married with one child who is in school. Irene works very hard to provide for her family.

Irene has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Irene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 52 years old and married with eight children.

Emelda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store, sugarcane farming, and clothes selling businesses in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, canned good, noodles and other groceries.

Emelda has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna is 47 years old and married with five children, with one child still in school. Genna works very hard to provide for them.

Genna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

Genna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is a married woman, 54 years old with three children. She is a veryhard working entrepreneur.

Joana has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines. Joana requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Joana has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing retail.

Emma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Meri Joy

texts.en:
Meri Joy is 37 years old and is married with 2 children. With both children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Meri Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Meri Joy has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Meri Joy would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Imara

texts.en:
Imara is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Cori Canastita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORI CANASTITA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rossemary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, venta de pan, venta de muebles, venta de repuestos para movilidades, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio, servicio de taller mecánica. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rossemary es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y salchicha por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. Cori Canastita group is in its sixth cycle at Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal Santiago II.  It is made up of eleven members and led by a board of directors, where Rossemary serves as president.  The members of this communal association are involved in various kinds of businesses, among them: potato and potato starch sales, salchipapas (a sausage and French fry dish) sales, clothing sales, bread sales, furniture sales, vehicle apart part sales, detergent sales, a neighborhood store, and a mechanic's workshop. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro enterprises where Rossemary is a member.  She points out that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 5 years.  She was invited to join by her sister-in-law, who is a client of the institution.  Presently, she has a business selling salchipapas.  She learned the trade from her mother several years ago.  

The loan that she will take out now will go towards increasing capital (buying potatoes and sausage wholesale), that she will get from vendors in the city of El Alto.  Afterwards, she will make them into salchipapas and sell them from her stall.  This kind of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, since she is the single mother of a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training and the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and sausage wholesale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been operating her transportation service for many years. She is still single and is a woman, but she is the one who does the driving and renders safe and secure transportation services to her local community members. With her business she is able to support her family's daily expenditures.

Marilyn lives with her parents, and in order to help her family in supporting the needs of her niece in paying her school fees, she needs to expand and improve her motorcycle business by renewing her licenses and registration so that she would be able to render a better service to her customers. She wants to improve the general living condition of her entire family.

loans.use: to renew her licenses and registration.

location.town: Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with three children, two of her children are in school.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Dioscora requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Dioscora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang, 37, is a mother blessed with two schoolchildren, living in Kampong Cham province. For her family’s living, she has sold grocery items and rice crops for seven years. The lack of customers is the main challenge for her selling business. In a group of three members, she is the leader of the group seeking this loan and this is her first loan with VisionFund. Neang will use her entire loan portion to purchase more grocery items to support her selling to get more customers than before. She wishes for her business to run smoothly and earn her more income to support her children’s studying as well.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to support her selling to get more income for her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is married and operates a retail business selling shoes, which he has been doing for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

Erick requested his third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 21,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of shoes. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes

loans.name: Victor Abel

texts.es:
Victor es un joven hombre de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia gastronomía.
Él es inteligente, soñador apasionado por lograr sus metas. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituto privado de gastronomía situado en el centro de la ciudad.
Victor es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y baja estatura. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Él estudia gastronomía, cuenta con experiencia en la cocina porque su mamá le enseñó algunas comidas fáciles de preparar para luego incursionar en ese campo, “me gusta la cocina porque comer es un placer…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabaja como costurero, arregla prendas, y confecciona pantalones. La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar la matrícula de gastronomía. Su sueño es poder crecer en ambos negocios, el desea pagar los gastos de matriculación para poder estudiar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que trabaja como costurero.
Es por esos motivos que Victor solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos de matriculación y poder estudiar gastronomía.
texts.en:
Victor is a young, 21 year old. He is single, with no children, and studies gastronomy. He is intelligent and a passionate dreamer of achieving his goals. He is studying in a private institute of gastronomy, situated in the center of the city. Victor has brown skin, short black hair, and is short. He lives with his parents who work. They live in a home they own, made of brick, that has basic services. He studies gastronomy. He has experience in the kitchen because his mother taught him some easy dishes to prepare, which led him to this field. "I like to cook because to eat is a pleasure," he says.

While he studies he works as a tailor. He mends clothes and makes pants. The advantage of his activities is that they don't interfere with each other. The disadvantage is the lack of money to pay the registration for gastronomy school. His dream is to be able to grow both businesses. He wants to pay his registration costs in order to be able to study. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 3 years he has worked as a tailor. For these reasons Victor seeks a loan to pay the costs of registration and to be able to study gastronomy.

loans.use: to pay registration costs to be able to study gastronomy.

loans.name: Doni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Doni. Doni lives in South Bogor, West Java, located about an hour from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his son.

Doni owns a stall where he provides mobile payment services and sells mobile airtime credits. He knows about Ruma from a sales executive who came to his own stall and explained about Ruma’s core and purpose. He is interested to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to improve his business, as well as contribute to his community.

As the business starts to run, Doni needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services and mobile airtime credits for his community. Doni knows about the importance of your loan, which will be very useful to help him improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Doni is the one who is sitting in the stall. He will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, which needs communication access.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old and married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

Helen has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Roselle supports her family by raising and selling hogs. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life, so she wants to begin farming. At the moment, hog raising sales are on the rise.

Roselle is married, with four children, ages ranging from one to 16 years old. Together with her husband, she lives in the town of Dagohoy, Bohol.

Roselle has been engaged in hog-raising for 13 years now. She wants to start farming, but she also wants to keep raising hogs. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and food for the family. In this way, she hopes to improve her financial income.

With her previous loan, Roselle managed to invest in hog-raising, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various garments to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and others.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as transport. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal to other retailers within five years. She hopes to educate her children in the future. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en: Lidya is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, soda, bread, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of flour, soda, sugar, maize, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, soda, sugar, maize, and other items.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. Jasmin is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new fishing net. Jasmin has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle repair shop. Nelia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy more pants, school uniforms, footwear, and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more pants, school uniforms, footwear, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells children's clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Belinda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Belinda is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Girasoles De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Girasoles de Magdalena 
Este grupo está formado por Rosa Maribel ella se dedica a la venta de consumo Diario, como azúcar, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, harinas, pastas, detergente en polvo jabón de bola, aceite, huevos, en su domicilio ubicado en Magdalena Milpas Altas desde ya hace varios años, ella está solicitando el crédito para surtir su negocio como compra de Consumo diario(productos comestibles) en general para surtir su negocio, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
"Girasoles de Magdalena" ["Sunflowers of Magdalena"] Solidarity Group

This group includes Rosa Maribel. She works selling everyday consumables such as sugar, snacks, soft drinks, flour, pasta, powdered detergent, bar soap, oil, and eggs, from her home located in Magdalena Milpas Altas. She has done this work for several years. She is requesting the loan to stock her business by purchasing everyday consumables (food products) in general to stock her store. She hopes that [Kiva lenders] can help her with the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy everyday food products to sell.

loans.name: Ourocaal Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt huit décembre 2011. Ce groupe est composé de quatre femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Clémentine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente quatre ans et mère de deux garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de tissus wax depuis une année. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité vingt trois pièces de douze mètres de wax. Elle n'est pas la seule qui mène cette activité dans la localité, mais elle a une clientèle potentielle pour l’écoulement de ses marchandises.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on December 28, 2011. The group is composed of four women who are have small businesses, support each other in solidarity, and take out loans that they reimburse on time.

Madame Clémentine who is on the right-hand side of the photo, raising her hand, is the group representative. She is married, aged 34, and the mother of two sons. She has been selling lengths of wax (high quality) African print cloth for one year. She is going to use the loan to buy 23 lengths of 12 meters each of cloth. She is not the only one who is engaged in this business in her locality, but she has a potential clientele to buy her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy lengths of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old, and she is married with 3 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a frozen food products business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional stocks of frozen products to sell.

Jocelyn has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen food products to sell.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
Гулноза доброжелательная и молодая девушка, ей 28 лет. Она еще не замужем. Гулноза  живет вместе с родителями в городе Истаравшан, она работает на фабрике. Она работает швеёй. Она помогает родителям по хозяйству. Скоро у неё должна состоятся свадьба. Она мечтает купить себе приданое. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств.
 Она обратилась в ООО МДО Арванд за кредитом. Она очень благодарна ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и доверие оказанную ей.
texts.en: Gulnoza is a friendly and young woman. She is 28 years old. She is not yet married. Gulnoza lives with her parents in the city of Istaravshan. She works in a factory. She works as a seamstress. She helps her parents with the housework. Soon she will get married. She dreams of buying a dowry for herself, but she does not have enough of her own funds. She has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. She is very grateful to MDO Arvand for the support and trust provided to her.

loans.use: to buy a dowry.

loans.name: Ourocaal Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré en décembre 2011. Ce groupe est composé de dix femmes qui exercent le commerce, prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps et sont très solidaire. Madame Catherine qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de soixante deux ans et  mère de enfant dont une fille. Elle s'active dans la transformation de savon local. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité vingt litres de l'huile de palme, de la soude, du colorant et du parfum. Elle a une forte clientèle dans sa localité. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated in December 2011. The group is composed of 10 women who are engaged in business, take out loans that they reimburse on time, and are very supportive of each other.

Madame Catherine, on the right in the photo, is the group representative. She is married, aged 62, and the mother of children, one of whom is a girl. She works at making local soap.

Madame Catherine intends to use the requested loan to buy 20 liters of palm oil, caustic soda, coloring, and perfume. She has a very good clientele in her locality. The profits will be used to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to transform into local soap.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as being honest.

Eunice operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. This will enable her increase sales and, hence, increase profits. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en:
Victorino is a resident of the town of Carmen, Bohol. He is a hardworking, married man with four children. His oldest child is 15, while the youngest is seven .


For the past 10 years, he has raised and sold hogs as his means of living. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins. In this way, he can improve his earnings. He would be able to raise quality pigs, and slowly settle his obligations.

Victorino has successfully paid back his previous loan, and he is now requesting a new loan to further rebuild his business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ourocaal Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt huit décembre 2011. Ce groupe est composé de vingt trois femmes qui exercent le commerce et se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Jeanne Marie qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de cinquante trois ans et mère de deux garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de l'huile de palme et du jus de citron depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter cinq bidons de vingt litres d'huile de palme et cinq bidons de vingt litres de jus de citron. Elle est confrontée à une concurrence qui parfois fait des lenteurs dans l’écoulement des  produits. Les vont servir à prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on December 28, 2011. This group is made up of 23 businesswomen who support one another and get loans that they pay back on time.

Jeanne Marie, who is standing on the right side of the photo with her arm raised, is the group's representative. She is a single, 53-year-old woman and the mother of two sons.

She has been selling palm oil and lemon juice for many years. She will buy five 20-liter containers of palm oil and five 20-liter containers of lemon juice.

She is confronted with competition that sometimes slows down her product sales. They will help her to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon juice.

loans.name: Ma. Lucia

texts.en:
Ma. Lucia is 29 years old, and has two children. Ma. Lucia is married, and her two children are in school.

Ma. Lucia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Lucia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Ma. Lucia has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ma. Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is the mother of nine children, six of whom are already grown and living in their ‎own homes. She learned to sew from her mother and has worked doing tailoring and ‎seamstress services for several years. She has a steady flow of clients, both neighbors ‎and people from surrounding neighborhoods. Nazira does her tailoring professionally and ‎on time and her customers are pleased.‎

She needed this loan for materials and an additional sewing machine.‎

Nazira is proud of her children and wants to make sure she can help her younger ones ‎continue and learn.‎

loans.use: to buy materials and an additional sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lorena Del Carme

texts.es: Lorena de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelente, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por quintales y cal para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Lorena, 38 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. For the past seven years she has been making and selling tortillas and 'pupusas,' the most popular Salvadoran snack. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers.

With the money she earns from sales, Lorena has managed to get ahead. Now, she is soliciting a loan to purchase corn by the hundred-weight plus powdered lime, in order to continue her work and, thus, to enjoy a better economic income.

loans.use: purchase corn by the hundred-weight and, also, powdered lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has 10 children. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years.

His business is located in an area with lots of competition, and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a matatu within five years.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.ru:
Лутфи  женщина  53 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Лутфи мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Лутфи выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома, Лутфи никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Лутфи вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Лутфи выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Лутфи получает хороший доход. Муж Лутфи также работает на стройке и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Лутфи с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Лутфи заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Lutfi is a woman of the age of 53 years. She is married and has two children. She lives in a small rural village.

Since her childhood, Lutfi dreamed of becoming a teacher, but the circumstance were such that she was not able to get higher education due to her family's insufficient finances. Soon after finishing high school, Lutfi got married and became a housewife. But even if she stays at home, Lutfi is never idle. She and her husband strives to provide their children with all necessary things.

In order to have a stable income for food, Lutfi and her husband started a business. They work with livestock breeding. Lutfi breeds livestock and then sells the meat and milk. She gets a good income from this business. Lutfi's husband also works with construction and his work brings the family an additional income. Their combined income is enough for middle class living conditions. However they currently don't have enough money to cover all their needs.

Currently Lutfi and her husband would like to purchase another few heads of livestock to breed. Therefore she turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase livestock. Lutfi thanks Arvand for the support, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon is 49 years old, and grows rice and cassava as the main sources of her income to support the family. The current businesses earn her about 11 USD per day.

Originally from the province of Kampong Cham, she is a married mother of two children. The main challenge that she faces in her business is that her cassava has been destroyed by insects.

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle, and this is her second cycle of her micro loan. She fully paid her past loan completely, and her family’s life is getting better than before because of her past loan. Now, she is seeking a loan with VisionFund, and she is leader of a group consisting of two members.

Yon will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to input on her cassava farm to improve yields, and she will also use a part of her loan to buy seed to support her rice farm in order to get good yields.

She wishes to earn a decent income from her businesses so as to upgrade her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feritlizer for her cassava farm, and to buy more seed to support on her rice farm in order to get a good yield.

loans.name: Sunbula

texts.ru: Сунбула хорошая девушка в возрасте 21 года, не замужем. Так как Сунбула деревенская девушка и живёт в деревне, летом вместе с отцом она занимается дехканством ,потому что у них много земли  и они там выращивают разные овощи,также в свободное время она подрабатывает швеёй. А когда начинается учёба,в сентябре она идёт в город чтобы учится и получить высшее образование. Её отец настаивал, чтобы она училась. Он очень хочет, чтобы она училась на учителя и была образованной девушкой. Сейчас Сунбула учится на третьем курсе.Её отец доволен и очень гордится ею. Ведь в селе мало людей которые позволяют чтобы их дети учились. Сунбула очень благодарно своему отцу,ведь благодаря ему она расширила свои знания,узнала новую жизнь,у неё появились много друзей,у неё появился другой взгляд на жизнь и всё благодаря отцу. Но к сожалению в этот году она не смогла оплатить за учёбу. Так как сейчас трудные времена её отец тоже не смог помочь ей. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Sunbula is a good girl of the age of 21 years. She is not married. As Sunbula is a country girl and lives in a rural area, she works with farming during the summer, together with her father. They have a lot of land on which to grow different vegetables. In her free time she works as a seamstress.

When she started her studies in September, she went to the city in order to study and get higher education. Her father insisted that she should get an education. He would very much like her to study be a teacher and become an educated girl.

Currently Sunbula is in her third year. Her father is happy and very proud of her. After all there are few people in their village who allow their children to study. Sunbula is very thankful to her father as it is thanks to him that she can expand her knowledge and get to know a new life. She has gotten many friends and a different view of life, and all thanks to her father.

Unfortunately this year she was not able to pay her tuition. As the times are difficult, her father was not able to help her. Therefore she turned to Arvand for a loan. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This marks Halima's fourth time borrowing to add fresh stock of fish to sell following the expected rains of Elnino. Her business is doing well, and she hopes to make good profits out of the stock.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life.

loans.use: to add fresh stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya  is a married woman and staying together with her husband and one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food .

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a business of selling firewood that earns her another source of income.
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman and she has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has electricity, but no piped water.

Biasha has operated a fish-selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 40,000 loan, Biasha wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a tailoring business, where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод доброжелательный  мужчина 28 лет. Он женат и  имеет двое детей. Он с раннего возраста был приучен к труду. Дилшод устроился на работу на ферму, чтобы помогать родителям.  У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Дилшода является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Дилшоду хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Дилшод обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Дилшод заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilshod is a friendly man of the age of 28. He is married and has two children. He has been working since an early age. Dilshod worked on the farm, in order to help his parents. He has a very friendly family. They live in a rural area.

In order for his family to have an income, all family members are trying to earn money in some way. Each one works any way they can. Dilshod's main and most stable business is livestock breeding. He breeds and sells livestock. His wife helps him with the business. She looks after the livestock and also sells the milk.

The livestock breeding business brings Dilshod a good and stable income. Therefore he would like to expand this business. He needs to purchase some heads of livestock for breeding and then selling. To do this, Dilshod turned to Arvand and wanted to get a loan for purchasing livestock. He hopes that his business expansion will be successful, and bring in a higher income in order to cover his family's needs. Dilshod thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth, who is 47 years old, is married and has six children. Two of her three dependent children are in school. She grows cassava and rice to make a living. About USD10 is earned every day from agribusiness and Reth manage to save about USD6 each day. Obstacle to cassava growing business is to get lower outputs. 
Having been with VisionFund for three cycle loans already, Reth has been supporting family’s living better. As the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to support agribusiness. She hopes that she can increase more income to rent farmland for expanding business purpose and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity and to keep her children in school. .

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 24-year-old married woman who started five years ago working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. 

She has professional skills in this domain and is well-known among her region. She is working hard to develop her business, so today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty tools to facilitate her business and satisfy her customers' needs. 

Batoul hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty tools to facilitate her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
