Elizabeth is 33 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc. Elizabeth has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 20 février 2001. ce groupe est composé de femmes qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 39 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de draps, de tissus et de chaussures. Elle va acheter une balle de draps, une demi balle de tissus et des chaussures. Elle a une très bonne clientèle qui lui permet d'écouler rapidement ses marchandises. Les bénéfices vont servir à acheter un terrain et à aider son mari dans la dépenses quotidienne.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on February 20, 2001. This group is made up of businesswomen. Awa, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a married, 39-year-old woman and the mother of four children, one of whom is a girl.

She sells sheets, fabric, and shoes. She will buy a bale of sheets, a half bale of fabric, and shoes. She has a very good customer base that will allow her to sell her merchandise quickly. The profits will help her to buy a plot of land and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fabric, curtains, sheets, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Colita

texts.en:
Colita is a married woman and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Colita is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Colita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en: Saroeun, 36, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kratie province. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school (the other is too young). She grows rice and works for others for a fee to get income to support her family. She has been with her family’s business for 10 years and she can save about $7 USD per day. This is Saroeun’s third cycle with VisionFund and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her living conditions have improved gradually with good income from her previous loans. In her group of four members, she is the group leader. She will use her portion of the loan to buy organic pesticide and to hire labor to help improve her yield. She hopes that she can earn more income for her family and support her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide for farmland.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, age 34 years, lives in the district of Iringa. She is married and a mother of four children.

Mariam is a Camfed Learner Guide, who volunteers to work with students in her ward secondary school. She teaches them life and problem solving skills to help them improve their learning performance.

Mariam plans to open a mobile device based money transaction business. She is requesting a Kiva loan to start her transfer service using M-Pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel Money.

Mariam will use the profit she will earn to supply herself and her family with basic domestic needs such as food, clothing and education.

loans.use: to start a mobile device based money transfer business using M-Pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel Money.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de regalos.
Él es emprendedor, autodidacta y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘14 de septiembre’ área caracterizada por la producción manufacturera y el comercio en todas las áreas.
Luis es de físico delgado y tez morena. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de regalos, durante la semana trabaja como empleado y los fines de semana trabaja en su tienda de regalos que se encuentra ubicada al lado de un salón de fiestas por lo que sus ventas son buenas, “quiero mejorar mi tienda para variar los productos a la venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que por el sector existen muchos salones de fiestas que son sus clientes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar nuevos regalos diversos. Su sueño es abrir una agencia de regalos, él desea comprar mercadería en regalos para varias los productos a la venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para comprar regalos para variar la oferta de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a young 22 year old man, single, childless, and his business is gift sales. He's enterprising, self-taught and very hardworking. He works on his business in the "14 de Septiembre" area, known for its manufacturing and commerce in all kinds of sectors.

Luis is of slender build and dark complexion. He lives in his mother's house, a brick house that belongs to them and has all of the basic amenities. His business is gift sales, which he does on the weekends in his store located next to a banquet hall, so his sales are good. During the week he works as an employee. He states that "I want to improve my store and increase the variety of products...". 

The advantage his business has is that there are lots of banquet halls that are his clients, the disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase new and varied gifts. His dream is to open a gift agency, and he wants to purchase gift merchandise to increase the variety of the products on sale. This is the first set of loans with this institution in the 2 years that he has been in this line of work.

Those are the reasons why Luis is applying for a loan to purchase gifts to increase the variety of merchandise in his business.

loans.use: To buy gifts to increase the variety of merchandise in his business

loans.name: Jorge Willinton

texts.es: Jorge es un microempresario habitante en una urbanización de Bogotá y reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hija, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tintos y bebidas aromáticas en un sector muy comercial del municipio en donde logró encontrar una oportunidad laborar en almacenes y con la experiencia adquirida emprendió su propio negocio.  Él aperturó un almacén en el que ofrece prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios, y los comercializa en un local de un centro comercial muy concurrido por visitantes que les agrada realizar sus comprar en este lugar.  En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para aprovisionarse de un nuevo surtido de ropa, calzado y accesorios, puesto que se avecina la temporada de ventas más alta del año y es muy importante contar con las nuevas tendencias.  Su meta a futuro es convertirse en un comerciante mayorista del sector, así como lograr adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a micro-entrepreneur, inhabitant of a residential area in Bogotá. He lives with his spouse and daughter.

Previously, he worked selling coffee and aromatised drinks in a commercial sector of the municipality, where he was able to find work in grocery stores. With the acquired experience, he started his own business. He opened a store in which he offers articles of clothing, footwear and accessories. He sells them in a store in a commercial center crowded by visitors who like shopping there.

Currently, he is applying for his first CrediKiva which he is negotiating with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to supply himself with a new selection of clothes, footwear, and accessories, as the the highest sales period is approaching and it is very important to have new trends.

His goal for the future is to make himself into a wholesaler of the sector, as well as to achieve purchasing his own house.

loans.use: to supply himself with a new selection of clothes, footwear and accessories.

loans.name: Somnang's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the province of Kampong Cham, Somnang is 36 years old and married. She has one child, who is too young for school.

Nowadays, she earns income for her family’s living via cassava planting on one hectare, and growing rice to earn extra income. Having been in these businesses for 15 years, she can save from her daily income about 7 USD per day. Her cassava was destroyed by insects, so she can only sell it for a low price.

For Somnang, this is her third cycle with VisionFund, and she fully repaid her past loans. Because of the previous loans, she can earn a decent income to improve her family’s living standard with household supplies.

She leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to input on her farm and to pay labor fees to support her farm to produce more yields. She hopes that she can earn more income than before to upgrade her living and expand her farmland more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to support  her cassava and rice farm to produce good yields for her family.

loans.name: Jacinter

texts.en:
Jacinter is a widowed woman. She has two children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a tailoring school within five years. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 20 años, posee una pequeña lancha y algunas redes con las que trabaja, gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante en su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de paños, hilo, redes, entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and their children in their own home.
He has worked as a fisherman for 20 years. He owns a small boat and a few nets that he uses for work. Thanks to his work he has been able to provide for his home.
He is requesting a loan to buy cloth, string, and nets, among other things and in this way be able to continue working, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy cloth, string, and nets, among other things.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, tomatoes, onions. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cereals. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cereals.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is the rain season, which affects business.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 38 years old and married with four children, two of whom in school, Laila works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, can goods, egg, etc.

Laila has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Laila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Josefina Miguelina

texts.es: Josefina es una mujer trabajadora de 56 años de edad, vive en la localidad rural de Pampacolca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación, que está constituida sobre todo por alfalfa orgánica que ella misma cultiva, Josefina además se dedica al cultivo de papa orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno agrícola donde planea sembrarla. En el futuro Josefina desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Josefina is a hardworking 56-year-old woman. She lives in the rural area of Pampacolca, which is located in Arequipa. She makes a living from multiple jobs, such as agricultural day work and raising organic cattle, paying a lot of attention to their care and food, which above all consists of organic alfalfa that she grows herself. Josefina also grows organic potatoes, so she is asking for the loan to be able to buy organic potato seeds and organic fertilizer to be able to prepare the farmland where she plans to plant them. In the future, Josefina wants to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to plant organic potatoes

loans.name: Seangly's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Seangly is 39 years old. She is a mother of two children and one of whom is still in high school. To earn income for her family’s living; she grows rice and sells the grocery items to earn extra income. She has been involved in farming for 21 years and she can save from her daily income about 5 USD per day.

For Seangly, this is her first time with VisionFund for a loan. She leads a group of two members to seeking this loan. As the leader of group, she will use her entire loan portion to buy organic fertilizer and to purchase more organic pesticide to improve her farming business, to get a good yield. She wishes that she can earn more income from her farming business to upgrade family’s living and keeps her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve crop yields, so as to support her child's education,.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a 25-year-old lives with her parent and she is a mother of one child in Bagamoyo district . Neema is an entrepreneur young woman, requesting a loan in order to launch her retail shop.

She works as a Camfed core trainer supporting learner guides to deliver sessions in secondary school. She plans to use the profit earned to help her family and to support her child with school fees.

loans.use: to launch her retail shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

She has rental houses and also supplies water to members from her community businesses she has run for 3 years.

Angelina has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using to repair her water tank which was damaged and has become inefficient.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to and hopes this will help her to add more rental houses.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are buy another plot and build rental houses."

loans.use: to repair her water tank which was damaged and has become inefficient

loans.name: Mae Gede

texts.en:
Mae Gede is 23 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mae Gede has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Mae Gede requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Mae Gede has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mae Gede would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 35 years old and married with one child.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Daisy has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Daisy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married woman and staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one kid living in Kampong Cham province, On is 31 years old. She can earn income to support her family’s condition via rice cropping on one hectare area of farmland and working as a labor for others to get extra income. She did not get good yield from her rice farm because it has been destroyed by insects. On has been with her business for 11 years and she can save from her daily income about 11 USD per day.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan. Moreover, her family’s business has improved gradually with her previous loan. In a group of two, she is the leader of group. She will manage her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer and rice seed to support on her farming business in order to get more yields than last years. She wishes that her rice produce her with good yield and earns her with a decent income for her family condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and rice seed to boost crop productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is a farmer from Bagamoyo, She is requesting a loan in order to expand her tomato business. Her work involves selling vegetable and tomatoes in her village. Also volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide by giving time each week to mentor younger students in well being and life skills.

She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business . Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Shani 's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to expand her tomato business

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt février 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de huit femmes qui évoluent dans le commerce. Madame Diarietou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main  est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente neuf ans et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon. Elle s'active dans la couture depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte  acheter avec le prêt sollicité  trois rouleaux de tissus  wax  pour coudre et les revendre. Elle n'est pas la seule dans sa localité mais parvient à vendre ses marchandises sans difficultés. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise  en charge de la  famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was inaugurated on February 20, 2001. This group is comprised of eight women who work in commerce. Ms. Diarietou, at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother of three children, including a boy. She has been active in sewing for several years.

With the loan requested, she intends to purchase three rolls of Wax cloth for sewing items to sell. She is not the only one in her town but manages to sell her merchandise without difficulty. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.es: Don Cristobalina trabaja en su propia finca en la cual se desarrolla la actividad de pollos de engorde y ademas se desarrolla la ganadería. Ella solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), dinero que usará para invertir en la actividad de ganado, por medio de la siembra de pasto mejorado y reparaciones necesarias en las cercas de la finca. De esta forma mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cristobalina works on her own farm where she carries out the business of raising broilers (chickens) and she also raises livestock. She is requesting a loan of two thousand one hundred dollars ($2,100). She will invest the money to invest in her cattle business by planting improved grass seed and make needed repairs on the fences on her farm. In this way she will improve her income and her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy improved grass seed and to repair fences.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is married and works hard to support her family. She has a dried-fish "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Saintimene

texts.fr: Saintimène, 45 ans, est mariée. Elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle vit avec son mari dans la ville de Delmas. Elle a mis sur pied depuis tantôt 15 ans une petite activité de revente de produits pour la lessive. La situation lui  était très difficile au début, mais grâce au crédit elle a pu tenir l’activité en vie. Aujourd’hui elle fait des progrès. Elle continue à prendre du crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Saintimène, aged 45, is married. She has no children. She lives with her husband in the town of Delmas. Saintimène set up a small business selling laundry products about 15 years ago. Her situation was difficult at first, but thanks to a loan, she was able to keep her business alive. Today, she is making progress. She continues to take out loans to augment her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase cases of laundry soap

loans.name: Olesse

texts.fr: Olesse a 62 ans. Il est père de huit enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et les enfants dans la vile de Delmas. Entrepreneur débrouillard, il a ouvert, il y a 12 ans de cela, une petite entreprise de revente matériaux de construction. L’activité marche très bien, mais il souhaite maximiser ses chiffres d’affaires. Il sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de bois et d’étais.
texts.en: Olesse is 62 years old and the father of eight. He lives with his wife and children in the town of Delmas. A problem-solving entrepreneur, he opened a small enterprise reselling construction supplies and materials about twelve years ago. The business is doing very well, but his wish is to maximize his sales. Olesse is requesting a micro-loan to increase his stock of lumber and struts.

loans.use: to purchase lumber and struts

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 58 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nelia has been raising pigs for two years and also earns income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Omaima

texts.en:
Omaima is a 41-year-old single lady and a Palestinian refugee who opened a clothing shop six years ago to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent and ambitious lady who has a good reputation in her region.

Omaima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business though increasing her merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers in the upcoming winter season.

Omaima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes to satisfy her customers in the winter season.

loans.name: Poncilia

texts.fr: Poncilia est âgée de 58 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a cinq enfants. Elle tient une petite boutique à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, etc. Son rêve est de faire progresser cette activité afin d’augmenter ses revenus. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter des articles cosmétiques tel que lotions pour peau, déodorants, savons, etc.
texts.en: Poncilia is 58 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and she has five children.  She has a small shop at home where she sells food products, cosmetics, sodas, etc.  Her dream is to grow her business in order to increase her income.  She is looking for a loan to buy cosmetics such as skin lotions, deodorants, soaps, etc.

loans.use: to buy skin lotions, deodorants and soaps.

loans.name: Jesus Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jesús Elizabeth poco a poco ha logrado establecer su negocio de venta de comida con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos. Jesús Elizabeth tiene muchos deseos de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos todo esto lo puede lograr con la venta de comida ya que es muy demandada por sus clientes. 
Para seguir creciendo en sus ventas Jesús Elizabeth solicita un crédito para abastecerse de la materia prima para la elaboración de la comida, de esta manera podrá comprar granos básicos, carnes y verduras. Con esto podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Little by little, with the help of her husband and her children, Jesus Elizabeth has succeeded in establishing her business of selling food. Jesus Elizabeth has a great desire for self-improvement and to move her children forward. All of this she can achieve with the sale of food since it is in great demand by her customers.

In order to continue growing her sales, Jesus Elizabeth is asking for a loan in order to stock up on raw materials to make the food. In this way, she will be able to buy basic staple foods, meat and vegetables and she will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic staple foods, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Yolande a 37 ans. Elle vit en union libre. Mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous régulièrement scolarisés, elle travaille durement pour offrir à ses enfants une bonne condition de vie. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Elle gagne ainsi de quoi prendre soin de sa famille. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock. Elle espère gagner assez de revenus pour économiser un peu d’argent pour envoyer ses enfants à l’université.
texts.en:
Yolande is 37 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage and she has four children who all regularly attend school.  She works very hard to ensure a good quality of life to her children.  

Yolande buys and sells food products and, thanks to this activity, she earns enough to take care of her family.  She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goods.  She is hoping to have sufficient earnings to save some money in order to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie is a 48-year-old married man with five children. Two of his children are currently in school.

Willie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Specifically, he fattens pigs. He explains that he has been in this business for 12 years.

Willie is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise his pigs. He notes that he borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business operations. In the future, Willie would like to save enough money so that he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise his pigs.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman, who works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, Mercedita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 20 years now.

Mercedita is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables for her food production business. Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her food production business by purchasing additional ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merilyn has been in this business for 15 years. Merilyn earns additional income from pre-paid mobile products.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business. She explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional fishing nets and gasoline.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 39-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband is the main provider for the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.

Nagina has been running her own beauty salon for the past year; she contributes her income to her husband to help manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics -- e.g., creams, hair brush, and other accessories -- for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business; therefore Nagina has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Nagina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Vania

texts.fr: Vania a 25 ans. Elle est célibataire et vie encore chez ses parents. Ne pouvant pas continuer ses études, faute de moyens économiques de ses parents, elle a choisi de monter une petite activité de revente de produits divers( boissons gazeuses, eau, boissons alcoolisées, etc). Cette activité lui permet de gagner des revenus pour couvrir ses besoins personnels et donner un coup de main à ses parents. Elle utilise les microcrédits pour augmenter ses stocks et faire progresser son commerce petit à petit.
texts.en: Vania is 25, single, and she still lives with her parents.  Because of her family's difficult economic circumstances, she was not able to  pursue her studies, so she chose to open a small business.  She now resells various goods such as sodas, water, alcoholic drinks, etc.  Thanks to this activity, she makes some money which allows her to cover her personal needs and to help her parents.  She uses micro-finance loans to increase her stocks of goods and to gradually grow her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Las Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tienen muchas expectativas para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia a través del trabajo unido de este grupo.
La Señora Fabiola es una señora muy humilde ella realiza trabajo de costura, ayuda a su marido de esa forma para la mantener  hogar. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su lucha diaria y sus esfuerzos está saliendo adelante. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called "Las Emprendedoras" is in its first cycle with the "Programa de Comite de Mujeres." It is a new group. The members have great expectations to be able to improve their living conditions and that of their families through working in a united way in this group.

Senora Fabiola is a very modest woman. Her work is dressmaking, and in this way she helps her husband to maintain their home. Through her efforts, continual work and through daily determination, she is moving forward.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products. In this way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products

loans.name: Maria Chuna

texts.en:
Fishing is the main source of income for Maria Chuna and her husband. They live in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. They have been earning a living like this for five years.

Maria Chuna is a 28-year-old woman and has one son. She and her husband want to provide the best for their son, which is why they work hard. Aside from fishing, Maria Chuna sells roasted meat.

She is in need of a loan to buy a new fishing boat and fishing net to enhance their catch. She will also need the money to buy roasted meat to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business so it will sustain her.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing net, and to buy roasted meat to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gracia

texts.en:
Ma. Gracia is a 68-year-old woman with four adult children. She works alone, being the father and mother to her children. This is not an easy responsibility for her, as she faces many obstacles. But her obstacles do not make her want to give up; instead, life gives her the courage to continue.

As for her livelihood, she does various businesses to sustain their day-to-day living. She sells mobile electronic reloading and is engaged in selling RTW (ready to wear) and dry goods such as slippers, bags, sandals, shirts, utensils, flashlights, etc. Ma. Gracia is determined to improve her business in the future. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy mobile electronic reloads and the RTW and dry goods items mentioned earlier to augment her livelihood and prosper.

loans.use: to buy mobile electronic reloads, RTW (ready to wear) and dry good items such as slippers, bags, sandals, shirts, utensils, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school. Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, like shampoo, coffee, sugar, can goods, eggs, etc.

Mylene has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, can goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 34 years old, married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria auxiliadora está en su ciclo No. 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Liz, quien tiene una heladería, en la que todos los días trabaja, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada que se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Liz pide este préstamo para poder comprar helados variados, y de esa forma pdoer seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y también cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called "Maria Auxiliadora" is in their second loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. They are very hard-working and fighters who are striving to be able to get ahead and help their loved ones.

One of the members of the group is Liz. She has an ice-cream shop where she works every day. She is a very hard-working and demanding person who makes an effort to give her family all they need for a dignified life without hardship.

Liz is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of ice-cream. In this way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing and also fill the demand from her clients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ice-cream for sale.

loans.name: Dúo Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
DUO FLORES DE SUMPANGO
Este dúo está integrado por Maria Paula ella es originaria de Sumpango, es casada y madre de familia, Anteriormente Paula se dedicaba a tejer y vender verduras, pero la competencia aumento mucho, por lo que cambio de negocio ahora se dedica a la siembra de variedades de verduras como tomate, maíz, frijol etc. juntó a su esposo va al campo a sembrar y luego a cuidar las plantas, cuando ya es tiempo de cosechar, Paula se dedica a venderlos en la capital, por lo que necesita de otro crédito para poder abonar lo que actualmente ha sembrado ella está contenta y a la vez agradecida con kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado, ya que ha podido realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
One member of this pair is Maria Paula. She is originally from Sumpango. She is married and is a mother.
Previously, Paula worked sewing and selling vegetables but the competition grew too much and so she changed her business. Now she grows a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, corn and beans, etc.
Together with her husband she goes to the countryside to plant and care for the plants and harvest them when it is time. Paula works selling the vegetables in the capital.
She needs another loan to be able to fertilize what she has currently planted. She is happy and grateful to Kiva for the help that they have given her. She has been able to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are enrolled in school.

She earns a living with poultry in the Philippines. Julita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

Julita has been in the poultry business for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling salt.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province and a mother of three children. She grows rice to earn income to support her living condition for 15 years. Moreover, she can earn extra income via working as a labor for others. Her rice did not grow well because it has destroyed by insects and it is her main challenge.

For Sarin, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she has fully paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan, her family’s living has improved than before. With this new loan, she is a leader of group with two members and she will spend her loan portion to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to support on her rice farm and she will use a part of her loan to pay for plowing fee to improve her farmland to get good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition better in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and rice seed to support on her rice farm and she will use a part of her loan to pay for plowing fee to improve her farmland to get good yield.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Cristina es una mujer trabajadora a pesar de su edad, lleva 17 años dedicándose a la elaboración de diversas prendas de vestir ella es costurera. Su hijo es su principal apoyo ya que le ayuda a levantar los pedidos y hacer la entrega de los mismos juntos se apoyan para mejorar su estabilidad económica.
Para seguir ampliando su negocio Doña Cristina solicita un crédito que le ayude a abastecerse de mas mercadería y comprar: telas, hilos, botones entre otros, de esta manera podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y podrá obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Cristina is a hardworking woman despite her age. She has been working for 17 years making different clothing items: she is a seamstress. Her son is her main support, because he helps her to get orders and deliver them. Together they support each other to improve their financial stability. In order to continue expanding her business, Cristina is requesting a loan to help her stock up more merchandise and to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, among other things. This way she will be able to fulfill her customers' demands and get more income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, among other things.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es: Gudelia 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también vende tortillas, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas de aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Gudelia, 47 years old, lives in her own house with her family. For 5 years now, she has been making and selling traditional snacks, like french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc., which she sells as a street vendor near her home. In addition to this, she sells tortillas.

Gudelia is requesting a new loan in order to purchase more oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all other ingredients for her production. This is so she can continue with her work, since it is her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all other ingredients.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El crédito anterior lo empleo comprando mesas y sillas, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio funciona de lunes a lunes sin descanso, “la cocina diaria tiene el problema de conseguir verduras y carnes frescas todos los días…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a diario, la desventaja es la falta de un frízer para conservar los alimentos frescos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante amplio, ella desea comprar un frízer para mantener la carne y otros alimentos frescos. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para comprar un frízer para conservar la carne fresca.
texts.en: Silvia continues with her business selling regional food. She used the previous loan to buy tables and chairs. She made her loan payments on time. Currently, her business runs from Monday to Monday without a break. "Daily cooking has the problem of keeping vegetables and meats fresh every day...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that her sales are every day. The disadvantage is the lack of a freezer to keep the food fresh. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She wants to buy a freezer to keep the meat and other food items fresh. This is her 5th loan cycle with the institution in the two years she has been working in this business. These are the reasons why Silvia is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to keep the meat fresh.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to keep fresh meat.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 53 years old. She is married to Paul who is a business man and they are blessed with five children.

She has had a retail business for 15 years and she will be using the loan to purchase goods such as sugar, bread, cooking oil and rice for sell and get more income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profits to buy food for the family, pay school fees, expand the current business and repay her loan too. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established retail business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as sugar, bread, cooking oil and rice for sell and get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells utensils. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo is a farmer who living in Battambang province, she is 27 years old and a mother of one schoolchild. She can earn income to support her living condition via rice cropping. Beside this, she can get more income via pigs and cow-raising. Her pigs got ill and this is her main challenge in her business.

She has involved in her business for 7 years and she can save from her daily income about 5 USD per day. Sambo leads a group of two to seeking a new loan and this is her first micro loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to purchase pig feed to support her pigs-raising in order to feed her pigs to get good health. She wishes that she can get more income from her business to upgrade her living condition and support her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, in order to keep her pigs in good health.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Living in Battambang province, Ly is 56-year-old and a mother of four dependent children. Because of her living condition, she can earn income via pigs and cows-raising for ten years. Moreover, she earns more income via working as a labor for others. Her pigs became ill and this was her main challenge for her business.

This is her second micro loan with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan completely. With the previous loan, her family’s living has improved than before. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her portion of loan to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pigs-raising. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her business to improve her family conditions to get better than last year.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pigs-raising to gain her income for her family's living..

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Battambang province, Khen is a mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. She covers her daily cost of living via rice cropping, pigs-raising and working as a labor for others. Moreover, she can get extra income via chickens and duck-raising. The drought made her rice grow not well, this is her main challenge. She can save her income about 3.5 USD per day which she has been with her businesses for 10 years. In a group of two, she is the leader of group to seeking this first loan with VisionFund. Khen will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide to support on her rice farm and a part of her loan she will use it to pay for plowing fee to improve on farmland to produce good yield. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to expand her rice farmland bigger than last year and to support on her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide to support on her rice farm and a part of her loan she will use it to pay for plowing fee to improve on farmland to produce good yield.

loans.name: Myaza

texts.en:
Myaza is a 30 year old mother of five who sells cashew nuts at Kilifi Kenya. 

For the last six years she has been in this business with a good income and the spouse provide her with additional income.

This marks her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying the previous ones, she will use the money to  purchase cashew nuts 

With the anticipated profit to repay her loan and expand her business.

She hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria wants to thank all of the lenders who are continually participating in the Kiva program, since the amount they provided really became a medium for the business to have a sales increase. Without your support, she wouldn’t know how to refill products for her variety store since she lacks supplementary capital needed for its maintenance. Indeed, if you have faith in God, He will use people to answer your prayers. Once again, she wants to thank you all dear lenders.

Gloria aims to have a bigger store someday where she can offer complete products to customers and at the same time, have her children finish college. She's also selling mattresses as an additional source of income. That's why she applied for another loan of Php 38,000 to purchase more grocery items and mattresses. She believes that this will be the start to have her prayers answered. She wants to thank all of the lenders who will consider her story.

Gloria believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and mattresses.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng, 52, is a resident living in Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with five children, one of whom is in school. To make a living, she is growing corns and sesame to earn her main source of income. She has been doing this for 33 years. Working as paid worker is the secondary business which earns her additional income. Both businesses earn her about USD13 per day and she can save about USD6 each day. Drought is the main obstacle to her agribusiness.

She leads a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund, which will be the fourth cycle loan for her. Past loans have helped her improve living condition and send her child to school. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan to buy corn and sesame seeds, pay for plowing fee and to buy other subsidiary tools for her farming business. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade the standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy corn and sesame seeds to grow so as to send her children to school. .

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Julius is a 42year old and a good farmer in masha Isingiro. He lives with his family of six children. He had passion of going to school but by then his parents were poor and they could not afford school fees but he was ready to learn new things but unfortunately all failed because of poverty. He therefore resorted to banana planting and selling.

He now wants to add organic manure to the plantation in order to increase the yieldsand income in the long run. He appreciates the continuous support from Kiva funders and UGAFODE Microfinance which has given him enough money to cater for the family and dependents. He is ranked among the best farmers in the whole area.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 41-year-old married mother of five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Two years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is well-known among her region for her tasty and delicious "Mouneh".

Today, Rana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary food stuff to increase her "Mouneh" production for the upcoming winter season.
Rana hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary food stuff to increase her "Mouneh"  (traditional Lebanese pickles) production for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Mererani 'a' Group

texts.en:
Stela is in her early 40s and is married with three grown up children.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 04pm to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Thia will be Stela's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on mamalishe stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.  She dreams of expanding her business.

Stela will share this loan with her loan group Mererani 'A' which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 37-year-old green grocer in Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married father of three who has been in this business for the last eleven years and is doing well.

This is his third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale and the anticipated profit to expand his grocery shop. He hopes to have educated children and a successful family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, cabbages. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, cabbages

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Pelagia has been in this business for 6 years. Pelagia earns more income from raising pigs.

Pelagia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices fish, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as; noodles, cooking oil, sugar, wheat, butter, etc.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a 34 year old mother of three whose spouse provides additional income for the family.

Prudence sells plastics, a business she has done for the last nine years and it has been doing well.

This is her fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase assorted plastic shoes, slippers, buckets and basins.

With the anticipated profits, she will be bale to educate her children as well as repay her loan. 

She hopes stabilize and educate her children without issues.

loans.use: to purchase assorted plastic shoes, slippers, buckets and basins

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is still a Camfed learner guide who volunteers working with children in secondary school, she teaches them on the importance of education and how they can help each other’s learning to improve their learning performance. Elizabeth managed to repay back her loan and she is requesting second loan from Kiva to expand her business. Elizabeth plans to use the profit she will earn to support her parents with everyday needs such as food, clothing and health care.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her shop.

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en: Kahaso is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a food stall where she cooks mandazi. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil for preparing mandazi. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil for preparing mandazi

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: An old woman, Ret is 62 years old and the widowed mother of six children, living in Kampong Cham province. Selling grocery items has been her single main source of income for 10 years and she can save from her income about 7 USD per day with this business. The main challenge that she faces with her business is lacking customers to buy her grocery items. She is seeking a new loan with VisionFund as her first loan with her group members of four. She will manage her loan portion to buy more grocery items in order to get more income. She hopes that her family’s living will be better than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale in order to get more income to support her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Seesomxay Group

texts.en:
Dee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Dee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Dee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Dee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Dee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dúo Paraná Group

texts.es: Bethzaida de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y asisten a la escuela. El negocio al cual se dedica es la venta de zapatos y tiene el negocio en casa, allí sus clientes la buscan pues ya tiene varios años de tener dicho negocio. Agradece a la fundación el apoyo que se le ha brindado pues ya es el 3 crédito culminado. Nuevamente esta solicitando un crédito para invertir en la compra de más zapatos. El sueño de bethzaida es darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bethzaida, 37 years old, is a single mother of three children who are minors and school students. She is in the business of shoe sales, and runs her business out of her home. Her clients seek her out there because she has been in this business for several years now.

Bethzaida is grateful to the foundation for the support it has provided, considering that she has already completed three loans.

Once again, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more shoes. Bethzaida's dream is to give her children a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, creams, colors, nail polish, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is grateful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) granted her previous loan request of Php 10,000 and she considered it as God’s blessing. The loan that was granted previously became a medium for her to buy feeds for the business on a daily basis.

Since it’s her bread and butter, she’s persistent to be successful on her chosen industry. She wants to save money to invest for their own house and lot someday and continually praying that God will bless the business as she also dreams of having an additional source of income to earn more each day.

Not all of the profits are being used for the business. Basically some are spent for their daily expenditures. That’s why she applied again for another Php 10,000 loan. She needs to have additional fund to buy more feeds and other necessities for her piggery.

Lourdes is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en: An old mother with five children living in Banteay Meanchey province, Chen is 65 years old. Nowadays, she needs to support on three dependent children. She earns income to improve her living condition via growing rice and grocery items selling. Because of the lacking customer, her selling business did not run smoothly. She can save from her daily income about 2 USD per day which she has been with her business for 15 years. Chen leads a group of two to seeking this first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of group, she will use her loan portion to buy more fertilizer to input her rice farmland in order to get good yield and she will spend a part of her loan to buy more grocery items to expand her selling business to get more customers. She hopes that her business earns her more income to upgrade her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to input her rice farmland in order to get good yield and she will spend a part of her loan to buy more grocery items to expand her selling business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a  house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Esther operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 



With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Yaú

texts.en:
Yaú is maize farmer from Yanoko village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yaú is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yaú would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yaú can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Yaú is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
La Srta. Nadia tiene 22 años, es soltera sin hijos, dueña de una Hamburguesería en la ciudad de Chaco, es bastante buena por lo que ya cuenta con una clientela formada, cuenta con el negocio desde el 2012, sus principales productos para el consumo son: Hamburguesa, Lomitos, Superpanchos, Gaseosas y otros.
 Solicita el préstamo para compra de Hamburguesa, Lomitos, Superpanchos, Gaseosas y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas, ya que la demanda que tiene es bastante buena.
texts.en:
Nadia is 22 years old. She is single and does not have any children. She is the owner of a hamburger store in the city of Chaco. She is doing very well, and has an established customer base and has had her business since 2012.
Her main products are hamburgers, sandwiches, jumbo hotdogs, soda and others.
She is requesting a loan to buy hamburgers, sandwiches, jumbo hotdogs, soda and other products to be able to continue with her sales, as the demand is already very good.

loans.use: to buy hamburgers, sandwiches, jumbo hotdogs, soda and other products.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a married man. He has four children.

He operates a retail business where he offers photocopying , typesetting, printing, and internet browsing services. He also owns a petrol station.He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy a bigger photocopying machine and renovate his petrol station. His business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock of stationery.

loans.use: to buy a bigger photocopying machine and renovate his petrol station.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de calzado (sandalias) y tambien posee un molino nixtamal, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelente con los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas sandalias por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 39 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and three children. He sells shoes (sandals) for a living, and also owns a mill for nixtamales. His business is located in his home, and he has many clients. With what he earns from his work, Francisco successfully forges ahead with his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more sandals wholesale in order to continue with his sales, and to have better economic income.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de desayuno.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora y buena madre. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por albergar a los damnificados del desborde del río años atrás, hoy convertida en un brazo pujante de producción manufacturera.
Viviana es de tez morena, cabello negro y físico delgado, su vida la comparte con su hijo que está iniciando la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno ambulante, ella prepara sus termos con café, leche, té y lo acompaña con empanadas tradicionales, sanwiches y otros, “realizo mi actividad a diario dejando comida a mis clientes en sus puestos de trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y a clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de una heladera dónde conservar los alimentos que utiliza. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande, ella desea comprar una heladera para conservar los alimentos de su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Viviana solicita un préstamo para comprar una heladera para conservar los desayunos frescos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 26-year-old, single woman. She has a 5-year-old son, and her business is traveling breakfast sales.

She is independent, enterprising, and a good mother. She carries out her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood. It was known as home of those displaced by the river flooding years ago, but today has become a booming area of manufacturing production.

Viviana is tan, with dark hair and slim build. She shares her life with her son, who is just starting school. They live in a rented room built of brick, which has all of the basic utilities. Her business is traveling breakfast sales.

She prepares her Thermoses with coffee, milk, and tea, and accompanies it with traditional empanadas, sandwiches, and other items. "I work every day, leaving my customers food at their places of work," she says.

The positive about her job is that her sales are daily and she has loyal customers. The disadvantage is her lack of a freezer to store the food that she uses. Her dream is to have a large business. She wants to buy a freezer to keep her business' foods fresh. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 6 years she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Viviana is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer to keep her breakfast foods fresh.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to keep breakfast foods fresh

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to build  a business stall.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman. She has eight children.

She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortage.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another water tank to store more water to sell. She also runs another business of selling fish.

Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another water tank to store more water to sell.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy, 53, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and a mother of five children. She sells clothes as her single main source of her income to support her family’s living for 10 years. The lacking customer is the main challenge for her family’s business. This is second cycle for Vy with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan. Her living condition has improved than before with her past loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more clothes to support on her selling to get more customers. She wishes that her family’s business improve than before and earns her with a decent income to upgrade her living in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to help her attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Suleiman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Suleiman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Suleiman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Suleiman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre con 21 años de edad, desde hace 1 año monto su primer negocio, una pequeña tienda, la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside. Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Debido a la competencia en el sector y principalmente al poco surtido con el que cuenta, sus ventas han bajado mucho, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, para poder abastecer su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar, de aseo personas y carnes frías.
Sueña con tener su propia casa, brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia y mejor calidad de vida.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores y prestamistas del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 21 year old man. One year ago he launched his first business, a small shop, which is located in the entry room of the house where he lives. With this he has had great progress, and obtains the income necessary to cover the basic needs of his home.

Due to the competition in this sector and principally to the little selection that he has, his sales have fallen sharply. This is why he is asking for a loan: to supply his business with staple grocery items, personal care products, and cold cuts.

He dreams of having his own house, and of providing his family with better economic stability and a better quality of life.

He knows that with the help of Interactuar, and the Kiva staff and lenders, his dreams will be realized.

loans.use: to supply his business with staple grocery items, personal care products, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Bella Vista” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carolina, quien es una persona que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y también de prendas variadas. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre van hasta ella en busca de lo que vende. 
Carolina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans y otros, y también para la compra de frutas para poder vender. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida
texts.en:
The group called "Bella Vista" is in its first cycle of the women's group program. All of them are part of the poverty elimination program, working to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Carolina, who is a person who works to improve her and her family's living conditions. She works selling fruit and also various clothing items. She says that she has very good clientele, who always come to her looking for what she sells.

Caroline is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of all types of clothing, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and other items, and also to buy fruit to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve her life.
