loans.use: to buy clothes such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and other items, and to buy fruit

loans.name: Sanabel

texts.en:
Sanabel's business is growing nicely. Her salon is located in her home, allowing her to balance between her business and raising her kids.

With her first loan, Sanabel created a separate entrance to the salon, giving privacy to customers. The business is located in a central area and comfortable for customers.

Sanabel has developed a good percentage of returning customers and new walk ins. She is expanding her business and needs this loan to help with the upgrades and new materials.

She needs this loan for a new hair styling chair, false nail materials and equipment, a large mirror, signage, and lighting, as well as creams and cosmetic supplies to sell.

Sanabel wants to see her business continue and grow, helping her ensure a good future for her children and family. She wants to one day build a nice unique salon outside of her home.

loans.use: to buy a new hair styling chair, false nail materials and equipment, a large mirror, signage, and lighting, as well as creams and cosmetic supplies to sell.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin is a farmer from Battambang province, 46 years old and a mother of five children. To support her family’s living, she grows rice and works as labor for others. Beside this, she can earn extra income for her family via pigs and cows-raising.

The drought has destroyed her rice; this is her challenge for her farming. She has been with her business for ten years and she can save her daily income around 9 USD per day.

Chin is the group leader of two members to seeking this first loan with VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm and she will use a part of her loan to pay the plowing fee to improve her farmland to produce more yields.

She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her living condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and rice seed for her rice farmland and she will also spend a part of her loan to pay the plowing fee to improve her farmland to produce a good yield.

loans.name: Gabriela Alejandra

texts.es:
Gabriela continúa con su negocio de confección de tejidos. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando lana por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio funciona correctamente, su producción fue mayor por lo que las ventas mejoraron, “aumenté el volumen de producción y mis ventas mejoraron…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas están en constante crecimiento, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar lana y continuar con la producción. Su sueño es contratar operarios para mejorar la variedad de prendas, ella desea comprar lana por mayor para continuar produciendo tejidos. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para comprar lana por mayor para continuar produciendo mayor cantidad de tejidos.
texts.en:
Gabriela continues with her business of making knitted goods. The loan that she received was invested in buying wool wholesale. She made her payments punctually.
Currently, her business is functioning well, her production was better and so her sales have improved. She comments, "I increased the volume of my production and my sales have improved." The advantage of the business is that the sales are regularly increasing. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy wool and continue with production.
Her dream is to hire workers to improve the variety of her garments.
She wants to buy wool wholesale to continue producing knitted goods. This is the third loan she has received from the institution in 2 years for doing this activity.
For these reasons Gabriela is requesting a loan to buy wool wholesale to continue producing a larger quantity of knitted goods.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale to continue producing a greater quantity of knitted goods.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a native of the town of Carmen, Bohol. He is married and has two children. He owns a house together with his wife. His income goes for food and school expenses.

For the past 10 years, he has engaged in the raising and selling of hogs. He caters mostly to neighbors and town dwellers.

He needs capital to finance his hog raising business. Victor decided to avail loans and boost his business. With the amount of 7,000 PHP, he wants to buy pig feed. In this way, he could now have an adequate supply of feed necessary for the improvement of his business.

In the future, Victor is looking forward to raising more pigs to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anne Marie Jeanette

texts.fr: Jeannette, 65 ans, habite à Cité Soleil. Elle est couturière. Depuis cinq ans, elle a démarré un petit commerce de tissus: les clients qui souhaitent se confectionner des vêtements peuvent acheter sur place les tissus de leur choix. Elle vend aussi d’autres articles utilisés dans la couture et approvisionne d’autres couturières dans la zone. Malgré les conditions difficiles, elle parvient même à se faire une belle clientèle. Voulant multiplier les entrées de son activité, elle sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de tissus.
texts.en:
Jeannette is 65 years old and lives in Cité Soleil. She is a seamstress. Five years ago, she launched a small business selling fabric: her customers who wish to have clothing made can select and buy fabric on the spot. Jeanette also sells sewing supplies, stocking up from other seamstresses locally. In spite of all difficulties, she manages to have a good customer following. 

Wishing to increase her revenues, she is requesting a microloan to expand her fabric stock.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jai Sri Ram Group

texts.en:
Jai Sri Ram Group formed in the year 2010 at M. Rampur village, of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are four active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own profession and business.

Damayanti is one of them who taken a vast role in her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. She is standing second from the left with raised hand in the photo. She is about 25 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and one daughter and one son.

Damayanti has been engaged in a grocery shop with the support of her husband for the last five years. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month.

She planned to improve her business in the course of loan. It will be the fourth cycle loan of the group. The past record of repayment is very good with 100% on time repayment. With the loan, Damayanti will purchase rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, biscuits, snacks, detergent, soap, dry fruits, coconut, turmeric, onion, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of a house.

The other three members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different businesses like a grocery shop, a medical store, and a saloon, and with this loan, hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, biscuits, snacks, detergent, soap, dry fruits, coconut, turmeric, onion, etc.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Group formed in the year 2008 at M.Rampur village, of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are four active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Bijayalaxmi is one of them who taken a vast role in her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. She is standing second from right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 50 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and one daughter and one son.

Bijayalaxmi has been engaged in a grocery shop with the support of her husband for the last 24 years. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 12,000 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month.

She planned to improve her business in the course of a loan. It will be the sixth cycle loan of the group. The past record of repayment is very good with 100% on time repayment.

From the loan Bijayalaxmi will purchase rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, biscuits, snacks, detergent, soap, dry fruits, coconut, turmeric, onion, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for re-construction of a house.

The other three members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different businesses like a grocery shop, a bicycle store, and a laundry, and with this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, biscuits, snacks, detergent, soap, dry fruits, coconut, turmeric, onion, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: Gloria es una confeccionista de 47 años, oriunda de Medellín un municipio de Antioquia llamado la capital de la moda en Colombia, lugar donde aprendió el oficio y años más tarde se trasladó a Cartagena de Indias e inició su taller con el apoyo de su cónyuge.  Hoy en día cuenta con diez años confeccionando prendas de vestir, cortinas y decoración para el hogar, así mismo alterna esta actividad con ventas por catálogos especializados que entrega a sus clientes para que escojan los productos de su preferencia y los cancelen en cuotas.  En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas y elaborar prendas de vestir y cortinas, así como encargos de productos del catálogo. Gloria es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad y su meta hacer que su negocio sea más grande y que con sus utilidades le permita costearles los estudios profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 47-year-old dressmaker. She is a native of Medellín, a city in Antioquia that is called the fashion capital of Colombia. That is where she learned her trade, and years later, she moved to Cartagena de Indias and started her shop with the support of her husband.

Today, she has 10 years of experience making clothing, curtains, and home decor. She alternates this job with sales from a special catalog that she gives to customers, so they can choose their preferred products, and she collects payments over time.

Right now she is applying for her first CrediKiva, which she is currently processing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will buy supplies to make clothes and curtains, as well as orders from the catalog.

Gloria is the mother of two adult children. Her goal is to make her business bigger, and that with her profits she will be able pay for her children's professional studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies and make clothing

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself to be outgoing.

Jonathan is a chef. He has been involved in this business for 22 years. He describes his challenge to be inadequate capital.

Jonathan will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stock of groceries to enable him to start a grocery store. His goal is to be senior chef within five years.

This is Jonathan's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to enable him to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Lan is a 31-year-old married mother of a son who is in school. She and her husband support the family through working as fishers and working for others for a fee. They earn about USD 8 per day and can manage to save about USD 6 each day.

Leading a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund, Lan is in her second cycle. The past loan, which was fully repaid, has helped her improve family’s living condition.

She is going to use her loan to buy fishing net to support her business. She hopes she will increase more income to upgrade the standard of living and keep her son in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fishing net to support her fishing business so as to keep her son in school until graduation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gajalaxmi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010 four self dependent women of M. Rampur of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group named Gajalaxmi. Their main objective is to expand their existing business and develop their social employment by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Radhika is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a self help group. The outstanding lady is aged about 50 years, standing second from right hand side with raised hand in the photo. She is a joyful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two sons and two daughters.

For the last 27 years, Radhika’ husband has been engaged in a cloth store, doing a good business. He earns about 12, 000 INR per month from the business. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses. So Radhika decided to raise her income by expansion of the business through a loan. It will be the fourth cycle loan of the group. The past record of repayment is very good with 100% on time repayment.

Radhika will purchase a huge quantity of different types of dress materials, sarees, and other cloths as per the demand of customers. As the festival season is coming, Radhika hopes that this investment in business will definitely generate a handsome of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and re-construction of a good house.

The other three members of the group have also engaged themselves with different small businesses like a grocery shop, a hotel, and a cosmetics and daily needs shop.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of different types of dress materials, sarees, and other cloths.

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
A mother blessed with four children living in Battambang province, Roeung is 56. She does rice and works as a labor to earn income to support her living condition. Moreover, she can get extra income via fishing and pigs-raising. She has been involved in these businesses for 10 years and she can save from her daily income about 7.50 USD per day.

The main challenge for her business is that her pigs got ill. She leads a group of two to seeking this loan and this is her first loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will manage her loan to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pig-raising business. She hopes that she can get more income from her business to upgrade her living condition better in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and pig feed to improve her pigs-raising to get a decent support for her living condition.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Group was formed in the year 2008 at M. Rampur village, of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are four active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing business as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Sarojini is one of them who taken a vast role fin her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. She is standing at extreme right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 53 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two sons.

Sarojini’s husband has been running a hotel for the last 20 years. At present the monthly household income is 12,000 INR. Sarojini’s husband wants to change the interior decoration of the hotel.

It will be the sixth cycle loan of the group. The past record of repayment is very good with 100% on time repayment. With the loan they will purchase some modern furniture and utensils. With the loan, Sarojini wants to fulfill the desire of her husband.

The other three members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different businesses like a grocery shop and a cosmetics and daily needs shop, and, with this loan, hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase some modern furniture and utensils.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is a 23-year-old motorcycle transporter from Kilifi, Kenya.

He is a single man who has been in this business for the last one year earning a good income.

This is his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to service his motorcycle and the anticipated profit to repay his loan.

He hopes to own several motorcycles in future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Dúo Efecios Group

texts.es: Dúo Efecios La señora Ruth Maribel, es casada tiene tres hijos y al lado de su esposo le da muchas gracias a Dios por el negocio que les ha prestado.  Su venta está ubicada en el mercado del pueblo y vende de todo tipo de pañal desechable por mayor y menor, jabón de ropa y baño en general, cosméticos en general, champo, cremas, papel higiénico en general desde hace 6 años.   Su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener otros puestos en el mercado para heredárselos a sus hijos.  Le hacen falta varias cosas en su negocio como los paquetes de pañal desechable que es lo que vende muchísimo todos los días y necesita comprar más, pero el dinero no le alcanza y por eso desea hacer un préstamo.  Ella les desea muchas bendiciones y les agradece su confianza a pesar de la distancia.
texts.en:
"Dúo Efecios"

Ruth Maribel is married with three children. With her husband at her side, she thanks God for the business He has given them. Her stall is located in the town market and she has sold all types of disposable diapers (both wholesale and retail), laundry and bathing soap, general cosmetics, shampoo, lotions, and toilet paper for six years.

Her dream is to continue growing and to have other stalls in the market so that her children may inherit them. She does not have enough of various things in her business, such as disposable diaper packets that she sells nearly every day. She needs to buy more, but she does not have enough money. Because of that, she wants to take out a loan.

She wants many blessings for you and she is thankful to you for your trust, in spite of the distance.

loans.use: to buy everyday products.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, cabbages, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, and cabbages. Her business goal is to open other outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock .

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes, and cabbages.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with four children who says she is an optimist. For the past ten years she has sold linens such as bed sheets and pillowcases to her clientele.

Hellen took out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. She is now applying for a 80,000 KES loan to buy more bedsheets, towels and pillowcases to sell.

Hellen is working towards opening another linens outlet within the next five years. She hopes that her work will lead to ever better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets, towels and pillowcases to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, caps, and vests. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have more variety of products to sell within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 36 years old.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, cooking oil, salt, spices, meat, etc., for her food production business.

Juliet has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, cooking oil, salt, spices, meat, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 35 years old and married. With one child in school, Sharon works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Sharon has been in this business for six years. In the future she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Bovel district of Battambang province, Sothy, 48, is a mother of five children and two of whom are too young.

Growing rice is the main business for her family to get income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working as a labor for others. She lacks the capital to buy fertilizer for her rice farming; this is her main challenge. She can save from her income about 7 USD per day and she has been with her business for 10 years.

For Sothy, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund and she successfully paid back her past loans as well. From the past loans, she got more income from her business to improve her living condition. She leads a group of two to seeking this loan.

As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support on her rice farming to get a good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income for her family’s living and keeps her children on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her rice farming to get a good yield.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is married and has a child. For the past ten years he has sold beans and maize from a busy location to regular customers of his. Fluctuations in prices are his biggest business challenge.

Kennedy previously took out and successfully repaid a loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. He has now applied for a 50,000 loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. His goal is to use his profits to open another branch of his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Eladia Francisca

texts.es: Eladia habita en compañía de sus hijos en Suba una localidad al noroccidente de Bogotá en donde inició su negocio de comidas rápidas aprovechando que una conocida le cedió un puesto donde comercializaba otro tipo de alimentos, de este modo Eladia adquirió la indumentaria necesaria para su proyecto de negocio y en el año 2013 empezó a funcionar.  Hoy en día sus clientes la visitan diariamente y degustan de sus delicias entre ellas papas rellenas, chorizos y salchipapas, en su gran mayoría estos pertenecen al gremio de conductores de la ciudad  a quienes les favorece el horario que maneja Eladia a partir de las 9 p.m. hasta las 2 a.m.  Eladia es madre soltera y no cuenta con el apoyo del cónyuge por lo tanto su negocio es su única fuente de sustento para su familia.  En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizarle mantenimiento a su carrito de comidas y comprar materias primas para ampliar su producción. Su meta a futuro es poder tener un local para garantizar más ventas y de este modo lograr que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus carreras profesionales.
texts.en:
Eladia lives with her kids in Suba, a town northwest of Bogotá, where she started her business of fast foods. Taking advantage that an acquaintance handed a stand over to her where she sold other types of food, this is how Eladia obtained the necessary tools for her business project and in the year 2013 began to operate. Currently, her customers visit her daily and savor her delicacies, among them stuffed potatoes, chorizos and fried sausages with french fries. The vast majority of her customers belong to the drivers’ labour union who benefit from the schedule which Eladia works on from 9 PM to 2 AM. 

Eladia is a single mother and does not count on the support of a spouse, so her business is her only source of sustenance for her family. She is currently applying for her first credikiva [Kiva loan] which she currently is processing with the the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] to carry out maintenance on her food cart and to buy staple items to expand her production. Her long term goal is to be able to have an establishment to guarantee more sales and achieve through this that her kids continue with their professional careers.

loans.use: to maintain her food cart and buy staple items

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has offered bags and a variety of footwear since 2005. She is married with one child.

Maribel aims to obtain greater income and provide quality service to all her customers. To make it possible, she is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use this amount of loan in buying stock of bags, slippers and shoes.

She hopes and prays that she could improve and encourage more customers to buy from her stall through her new displays of shoes, slippers and bags.

Maribel is looking forward for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy stock of bags, slippers and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rebelima

texts.en:
Rebelima is already 65 years old, but even at her age she continues to work hard to earn a living. In the municipality of Bien Unido where she lives, she runs a sari-sari store business where she sells candies, chocolate, medicines, canned food, toiletries, condiments and seasonings. She also farms rice for additional income.

She is asking for a loan to buy spices, soy sauce, canned food, noodles, seasonings, shampoo, medicines and eggs. Rebelima is hoping that through the income that she is getting from her businesses, she can support her husband, who is a fisherman, so they can save for when they are older. Her income will be for food, savings, reinvestment in the same business and to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy spices, soy sauce, canned food, noodles, seasonings, shampoo, medicines and eggs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Kakiika Dembe Group

texts.en:
Kakiika-Dembe Twimukye group is a repeat group located in Kakiika, Mbarara district. They are engaged in retail businesses, and they have managed to live comfortable lives via working together. These people have been in business for over five years, and they purchase their stock in Mbarara town and sell it to the Mbarara community.

They have applied for a loan, and their prime target is to expand their businesses so as to earn more.

Previously they were limited by capital and funds to enable them to achieve their targets and compete with other people in the area who have similar business. They came to know about Ugafode Microfinance Ltd ., which has been on their side to help them achieve their dreams. They are so grateful for the services rendered to them.

Jane will use her loan to boost her grocery business by buying stock of groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia, is a sixty-one-year-old married woman who lives in the rural town of Sagbayan, Bohol. She has two children ages 17 and 24 years old respectively. She raises pigs, and it serves as her main source of income. She also owns a rice paddy and has grown rice for more than 30 years.

Sergia needs the loan to buy fertilizers and pig feed. With these, she would be able to improve the yield of her farm and also raise quality pigs.Thus, she would be able to provide her family with healthy meals and be able to continue financing the schooling of her youngest child.

Her business faces two challenges. The first is the capital needed to expand and the second is the season of her livestock trade. Sergia hopes to expand her earnings by increasing the number of pigs.

She is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en: Living in a local area of Kampong Cham province, Dany is 24 years old and not yet married. To support her living conditions, she has grown rice as her main source of income for six years and works as labor for others to supplement her income. Because insects destroyed her rice they made it grow not well. This is first time for Dany and her group members of four to seek this loan with VisionFund. She will manage her entire portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds to improve her rice farm to produce more yield. She hopes that her rice grows well and earns her more income than before to upgrade her family’s living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and seeds to input on her rice farm to produce more yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sharmimu

texts.en:
Sharmimu is a 38-year-old lady who is a married mother of one.

She is a motorcycle transporter, a business she has done for the last 12 years and she has employed one youth.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya, to service her motorcycle and buy spare parts.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to own several motorcycles in the near future.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Ado can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, he has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

Ado is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Nura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nura would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Nura can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Nura will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Nura is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gwendolyne

texts.en:
Gwendolyne offers home-service manicures and pedicures within her local community. She is happily married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. The couple would like to have a better standard of living and provide their only child with a higher level of education; that's why they are doing their best to achieve it.

Gwendolyne would like to buy a variety nail polishes, nippers and nail cleaning sets for home-service manicure and pedicure, but she doesn't have enough capital. With regards to her condition, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000. Gwendolyne will be thankful if her requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy a variety of nail polishes, nippers and nail cleaning sets for her home-service manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a good cook, especially with snack food like rice cake, locally known as "bingka". She has been selling rice cake and farming rice for eleven years now. She sells her snacks in the community of Trinidad in Bohol province.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fertilizer, rice, sugar, sticky rice and coconut. She hopes to continue her business and make expansions so she can save in her old age. Her income will also be used to buy food and reinvest in the same business. Anastacia is 59 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice,  sugar, sticky rice and coconut

loans.name: Wo Fee Ekome 2 Group

texts.en:
Wo Fee Ekome 2 is a group of four people who live in Chorkor, Accra-Ghana. Most of these members, who are between 25 and 37 years of age, were unable to study and now have children of their own in primary and secondary school. The Wo Fee Ekome 2 members run a variety of businesses in the city of Accra, selling lubricants, second-hand clothing, ladieswear, and foodstuffs.

Geoffrey, a 37-year-old member of the group, was able to study to secondary school level. As a young and married man, he is responsible for supporting his family. Geoffrey´s business is in trade, buying and selling second-hand clothing at the market. On the weekends, his work doesn't stop; Geoffrey continues to sell at the market. With this loan from Kiva, this sharp businessman will buy more second-hand clothing which he will sell to customers.

Geoffrey has a family of his own, with his wife, and thanks to his efforts in improving his business, he has been able to provide his two children with the opportunity to go to school. The members of this group are very happy to be a part of ID-Ghana, with bi-weekly meetings that give them the tools to save money in their businesses and use their investments wisely.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing which he will sell to customers.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie has been selling a variety vegetables for one year. She is married and has two children who are currently studying.

She would like to keep her business profitable, so she's seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 5,000. She will use this loan to buy more stocks of vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, green peppers and tomatoes to sell.

Winnie hopes for the continuous growth of her business involvement, to sustain her family, buy basic commodities, and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, green peppers and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is a 61-year-old rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for many years now. She learned this business in order to support her children when they were still young, and now they are all adults.

Buenaventurada is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides, and pay for labor. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. Her business also helps the farmers in her community to earn an income from her field.

In the future, Buenaventurada dreams of making her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer and pesticides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Humberto José

texts.es: Humberto es un joven comerciante de 20 años que reside con sus padres en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias y  heredó de su madre esta actividad, él comercializa a sus conocidos, amigos y vecinos un amplia gama de productos de uso personal los cuales exhibe en una vitrina al interior de su vivienda y también se apoya de catálogos especializados.  Humberto encontró en esta actividad una oportunidad de generar ingresos puesto que sus intentos por ubicarse laboralmente con empresas no han sido exitosas, sin embargo este emprendedor no se da por vencido y considera que con su propio negocio puede llegar a tener calidad de vida y a futuro formalizar un hogar. En la actualidad ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar mercancías varias; desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, gafas, gorras, con la finalidad de mantenerlo surtido y dinamizar las ventas.
texts.en:
Humberto, 20, is are young storekeeper who lives with his parents in Cartagena de Indias. He is following in his mother's footsteps in this line of work. He sells his products to his friends, acquaintances and neighbors. He has his wide variety of products on display in his home and he also orders from specialized catalogues.

He has found that this business is a good way to generate an income, especially since he hasn't been able to find work elsewhere. This enterprising young man has never given up and he believes that having his own business can lead to a better quality of life and give him a base for his own home in the future.

Now he is applying for his first loan with the 'Mario Santo Domingo' foundation which he will use to buy a variety of merchandise; deodorants, perfumes, creams, glasses and hats. This will keep his business well-stocked and boost his sales.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ana Lonny

texts.es:
Ana continúa con su negocio de confección de ropa de niña. El crédito anterior lo utilizó comprando lana por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque las ventas fueron buenas. Actualmente su negocio funciona correctamente, los clientes encargan ropa y hacen pedidos, “mi negocio mejoró porque las ventas son buenas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son buenas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tela por rollo. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea compra tela por rollo para confeccionar vestidos de niña. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para confeccionar vestidos de niña.
texts.en:
Ana is still running her children's clothes business. She used her last loan to buy wool wholesale. She was able to pay off the loan on time because her sales were good.

Currently the business is going well and her customers are making lots of orders. She tells us that she is successful because of her high level of sales. However she lacks money to buy fabric in rolls.

This is the second sequence of loans in the four years that she has been with this institution. She will use the money to buy fabric in rolls so she can make girls dresses.

In the future, she dreams of opening her own clothes store.

loans.use: to buy a roll of fabric so she can make dresses for girls.

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es:
Hace 10 años que Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de deliciosos quesillos, primero comenzó a vender caramelos, galletas, quesillos y otras golosinas pero con el tiempo vio más demanda en los quesillos y por esta razón solo decidió vender este delicioso alimento como es el quesillo, su principal apoyo son sus hijos. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante y ha mejorado su salud.
Para seguir vendiendo y supliendo la demanda de sus clientes Doña Rosa solicita un crédito para comprar queso, crema, cebolla entre otros, Doña Rosa desea continuar con el negocio y que se vuelva un negocio productivo donde se involucren todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa has been selling cheese for 10 years. She first started by selling sweets, cookies, cheese and other sweet snacks, but as time went on, she noticed that most of the demand was for her cheese. Therefore, she decided to concentrate solely on selling this delicious product.

Her main support comes from her children. Little by little, she has been able to make the business a success and her health has improved as a result.

To continue selling and meeting her customer demand, Rosa is asking for a loan to buy cheese, cream and onions, amongst other things.

She would like to continue in business and she hopes to see it grow so her children can also be involved.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream and onions, amongst other things.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: Maria Tomasa se ha dedicado desde hace más de 10 años a la crianza de marranos. Tiene dos hijos por los cuales lucha a diario ya que por problemas con su esposo se separaron ahora ella está al frente de su familia, y gracias al apoyo que Fape y Kiva Le han brindado Esta sacando adelante a sus hijos. Tomasa desea que sus hijos de gradúen y así tengan más oportunidades en la vida. Solicita el crédito para la compra de marranos, concentrado y vitaminas.
texts.en:
Maria Tomasa has been raising pigs for more than 10 years. She strives to get along every day in order to support her two children. She is now the head of the household as she separated from her husband due to problems in their relationship.

Thanks to the support she has received from Fape and Kiva, she is able to raise her two children. She would like her children to graduate from school and have more opportunities in life.

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs, animal feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.name: San Alfredo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Alfredo” está en su primer ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar cada tía.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maximina, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que poco a poco quiere abrirse camino para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que tiene las expectativas puestas para poder mejorar su emprendimiento y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas, como ser: remeras, camisas, jeans, blusas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The 'San Alfredo' group is in its first cycle. It is a new group whose members strive everyday to improve their quality of life, both for themselves and their loved ones. They form part of the Poverty Stoplight Program, looking to improve their situation every day.

One of the members of this group is Maximina. She is a very enterprising woman who sells clothes. Little by little, she is starting to develop her business so she can help her family. She hopes to continue growing so her loved ones have a better future.

She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of clothes such as T-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses and things like that. This will allow her to continue with her sales.

She is grateful for the opportunity to continue in business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with a child. He sells food in a local market and does farming as a side income project. With these he is able to provide for his family.

John is, however, faced with the challenge of business competition and lack of a preservative machine to keep his products from going bad. He wants to manage this by adding a variety of foods to his stock which his clients ask for. He requests credit to buy potatoes, fresh beans, and other vegetables for selling to attract more customers and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, fresh beans and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Jenie is a 44-year-old man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a father to two children aged 11 and 14. To provide for their needs, he makes charcoal out of empty coconut shells. This has a high demand in the big town and city in the province of Bohol. Aside from making charcoal, he also farms rice for an income. He is asking a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more empty coconut shells and fertilizer for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Jenie hopes to make his business successful and to be more stable so he can have his own capital and enough funds for more expansion.

loans.use: to buy more empty coconut shells and fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42 year old married man with children; six are currently attending school. He lives in a rural setting with his family. He deals in agriculture, mostly the growing of bananas, to support his family, and he supplements his income by renting out a motor cycle. He works six days a week on his gardens and each day he works for eight hours.

He started his business with the aim of getting money to support his family, as its demands were becoming endless. He is taking out this loan in order to buy fertilizers, coffee and passionfruit plants.

John's clients are traders from the capital city, and his dream is to accumulate wealth for his children's education. His biggest challenges are lack of enough capital, pests and diseases, climatic and price changes for agricultural products which are not stable. He describes himself as a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he grows maize, tomatoes, kales. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi  is a married mother of four children, all of   whom do not attend  school because they are grown-ups. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ntimama

texts.en:
Ntimama is 20 years old. He is not married with no children. 

He has had a farming business for 4 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase livestock.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to purchase more goats for sale. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, noodles, etc.

Nila has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ashotik

texts.en:
Ashotik lives in Karmir village with his wife and their 23-years old son. As a hardworking breadwinner of his family, Ashotik has been doing everything to gather income for his family. He is running a farm and works as a locksmith in Gavar town, as a part time worker. 
Ashotik's main business activity is the maintenance of interiors, upholstery and sound isolation in the cars. He has been doing this works in the rented garage, since late 1990 and over years became very profesional and demanded among his clients in the region.  
Ashotik requested this loan to be able to pay for renovation costs in the garage. He plans to expand the working space in garage, so he is able to receive more than one car at a time. 
Ashotik plans to see his business grow in the near future and hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to cover the renovation costs of garage to expand the working space and be able to have more effective work and higher income

loans.name: Feleneki

texts.en: Feleneki aged 24 years old lives with her parents in Kilolo district. She is a mother of one children. She volunteers as a Camfed Leaner Guide teaches students life skills sessions. She is requesting Kiva Loans to launch her small retail shop where she will sells groceries, including salt, cooking oil and onions. She plans to use the profit earned from the Loan to buy home expenses like food, clothes, decent meals and increase products in her shop.

loans.use: to launch her small retail shop

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, aged 45, is a married farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she has two dependent children, one of whom is in school. Growing rice is the main business of family. She sometimes works as paid worker to get additional income. She has been involved in farming business for 25 years. Daily income of family is around USD19 per day and she can save approximately about USD11 per day. 
This is the first cycle for her with VisionFund. Leading a group of three, Chantha is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes that she will earn more income to improve her farmland and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields to keep her child in school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Wo Fee Ekome Group

texts.en:
wo fee ekome is a group of four persons who live in Chorkor, Accra-Ghana. Most of these women, who are between 25 and 40 years of age, were unable to study and now have children of their own in primary and secondary school. The wo fee ekome members run a variety of businesses in the city of Accra, selling lubricants, traditional ladies bags, slippers, also some provide services like sewing and tailoring.

Emelia, a 29-year-old member of the group, was able to study to secondary school level. As a young and married ladies, she had to help her family with chores and bringing in income. Emelia´s business is in trade, buying and selling slippers and traditional ladies bags form house to house. On the weekends, her work doesn't stop; Emelia continues to sell from her home.

With this loan from Kiva, this sharp businesswoman will buy more slippers and traditional ladies bags which she will sell to customers. Emelia has a family of her own, with her husband, and thanks to her efforts in improving her business, she has been able to provide her three children with the opportunity to go to school. The members of this group are very happy to be a part of ID-Ghana, with bi-weekly meeting that give them the tools to save money in their businesses and use their investments wisely.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and traditional ladies bags which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 48-year-old married father of three children. He is a Palestinian Refugee who lives in  a Palestinian refugees camp, and works hard to develop his family's living.
He has been working in construction business, specialized in pasting tiles for twenty five years. Mohamad's income is going on fine, but not good enough to cover the increasing unexpected living needs.
Since his children education is his main aim, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his daughter's requested university tuition fees.
He hopes that he can stay capable of supporting his family and reply to their living needs.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's requested university tuition fees.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
NASSORO is in his early 40s and is married with four children. Three of them are at school and one is still small. He has been selling chips for seven years now. He works from 09am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be NASSORO's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy sacks of Irish potatoes and buckets of cooking oil and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, build his house, a TV set, a radio, sofa set, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking the chips. He dreams of expanding his business.

Nassoro will share this loan with his loan group Mt Usambara which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking the chips.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa lived in Concepcion Iloilo where most of the community earns a living through fishing. She and her husband, a fisherman has been also doing this fishing business for five years. They work together to give the best to their children. They have five young children to raised ages 13, 11, 9, 3 and 1-year-old. Thus, Ma. Teresa is asking for a bigger amount of loans to buy fishing net and for boat repair in order to enhance their livelihood. She wants to have additional fishing boat in the future to have a sustainable means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and for boat repair

loans.name: Lubelyn

texts.en: Lubelyn is 26 years of age and married to a farmer.She runs her farming and junk shop business.Lubelyn would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP5,000. She will invest her request loan in her buy and sell of recycled materials. She has been doing this kind of business to support her husband in generating income for their daily consumption.Lubelyn will use the amount of loan in buying more empty bottles,iron and aluminum.She knows that she could keep it profitable.

loans.use: to be use in buy and sell of recycled materials such as empty bottles,iron and aluminum for her junk shop business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking woman, still involved in a buy and sell business of personal and home products. She’s thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved her previous loan of Php 18,000 which made a vast impact on the business. The amount was used to buy necessities for her business.

Ofelia is grateful for having the business as it became her source to sustain their daily needs. She works hard to make the business flourish which is one of her dream. This year, Ofelia wants to apply for another loan of Php 20,000 to have additional product to put on her display cabinet. Availability of the products should be considered in this type of business since customers do not want to wait too long just to have the products. She’s anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a big help for the business.

Ofelia regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase personal and home products to put on her display cabinet.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a farm where he keeps goats, sheep. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more goats, sheep. He hopes that in the future, he will have a thriving business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats, sheep.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is thankful that she was granted an amount of Php 20,000 which was added to her business capital and enabled her buy products for her the business. This amount made a great impact on the business since it made costumers choose wide range of fresh vegetables, dressed chicken and pork. 

Dina aims to expand the business and attract new customers, as she dreams of adding products to sell, since this became their primary source of income and help support their children’s education and daily needs. She also dreams to invest for their own house and lot someday. To make the business grow, she decided to apply for another loan of Php 20,000 this year as an added capital for her to buy more fresh vegetables, chicken meat and pork for her buy and sell business.

Dina believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell

loans.name: Cristiana

texts.en: Cristiana is a 55 year old; she is married mother of seven children. Who works hard to support his Family, She is a Teacher. Although the family works very hard, it can be cumbersome for her to afford the cost of her daughter education. This loan of $ 1000 will allow Cristina to help her daughter studies and will be utilization in University. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Cristina hopes that in the future they will be happy in the family.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Aged 36 and a resident from Kampong Thom province, Chanthy is married and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. She struggles to make a living via rice growing as her main source of income. The main challenge that she faces this year, she can get lower yield than last year. Chanthy has involved her farming for years and she can earn income about 2.5 USD per day for her living condition. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles already and this is her fifth micro loan. She fully paid back her past loans completely and it helped her family’s living better than before. She leads a group of two to seeking a new loan. As the leader of group, she will spend her loan portion on buying a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can keep her family members living in hygienic environment.

loans.use: To buy a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 51 years old and married with five children.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercy has been farming vegetables for 31 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy new fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Ramli

texts.en:
Ramli lives in Oecusse and most of his daily income are from fixing machines. He is a welder. He is now applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00. He will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy other materials for him to do his activities such as motor’s inner tube, oil,angle steel, carbide welding, transformer, drilling machines, equipment for motorbike, Car and other materials to use.

He started to do this business in 2013 with his own working capital of $3000.00. He is happy with the loan that offered to him,because he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy motor’s inner tube, oil and other things to use.

loans.name: Olga Antonia

texts.es: Olga de 43 años de edad, habita en casa propia en la cual ha vivido toda su vida, ahí vive al lado de su hija de 18 años y de sus hijos mellizos de 15 años de edad. Es madre soltera por lo que lucha por mantener la economía del hogar y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos. Para lograr esta tarea, Olga se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyería. El negocio tiene diez años de administrarlo por lo que tiene bastantes clientes. De esta manera logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar. Ya que este es el medio que le permite tener sus ingresos económicos, Olga decide invertir en el negocio, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria para ello, es por eso que decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusa, pantalones, faldas, aretes, relojes, brazaletes y todo tipo y estilo de ropa y de joyería para aumentar sus ventas y de esta manera aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga, 43, lives in her own house which is where she grew up. She lives with her 18-year-old daughter and 15-year twin boys. She is a single mother who struggles to maintain the household economy and to cover her children's basic needs. To be able to do this Olga sells clothing and jewelry, having been in business for ten years with a good number of customers. This allows her to earn enough income to support the household.

Olga has decided to invest in her business but does not have the money to do so. Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, earrings, watches, bracelets and all kinds of clothing and jewelry to increase sales and earnings.

loans.use: To buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, earrings, watches, bracelets, clothing and jewelry to help increase sales.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda de 49 años de edad habita en casa propia en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida, al lado de dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad y de dos hijas de 15 y 17 años de edad. Erlinda es una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora que, en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida labora en un pequeño taller de corte y confección, también en los días libres en busca de un ingreso extra se dedica a vender productos lácteos, carnes y también prendas de vestir como lo son faldas, y así aportar a la economía del hogar y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida, su compañero de vida le ayuda con los gastos del hogar gracias a que se desempeña como albañil independiente. Erlinda desea mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: carnes, crema, queso y faldas para continuar y ampliar su negocio de venta de estos productos.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 49, lives in her own home with her life partner and two sons, ages 7 and 13, and two daughters, ages 15 and 17.

A very enthusiastic, hard-working person, Erlinda is seeking a better quality of life. She works at a small sewing shop and on her free days earns extra income selling dairy products, meat and clothing such as skirts. This way she contributes to the household economy and, little by little, can improve her lifestyle. Her partner helps with the household expenses by working as an independent bricklayer.

To improve her quality of life, Erlinda is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy meats, creams, cheese and skirts to continue expanding her sales activity.

loans.use: to buy meats, creams, cheese and skirts to continue and expand her sales activity.

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad I Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD I”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota, la socia continua dedicándose al  negocio de crianza y venta de pollos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua haciendo engordar y crecer a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar pollos entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "VIRGEN NATIVIDAD I" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Carlota who continues raising and selling chickens. She is a responsible, enterprising person who has been in the business successfully for several years thanks to the effort she puts into it, making her able to support her family this way.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and other items.

In general the members are grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

The photos were taken at two different times because of work commitments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other items.

loans.name: Liliana Michell

texts.es: El oficio de periodista es lo que apasiona a Liliana es por esta razón que estudia comunicación y relaciones públicas, su meta es ser una profesional exitosa su principal apoyo son sus padres que son el sustento de su hogar. Además de estar estudiando su carrera Liliana también está estudiando un posgrado ya que al terminar su carrera saldrá como licenciada y con un posgrado, estos estudios le abriran las puertas en el mundo laboral es por esta razón que Liliana solicita un crédito para pagar su posgrado y convertirse en una verdadera profesional.
texts.en:
A job as a journalist is what Liliana is passionate about, so she is studying communications and public relations. Her goal is to be a successful professional with the support of her parents, mainly, who are the household breadwinners.

Apart from her current undergraduate studies, Liliana also wants to do postgraduate work when she gets her degree to open the door to the labor market.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to pay for her postgraduate work to become a true professional.

loans.use: to pay for graduate studies.

loans.name: Dúo Superación De Villa Nueva Group

texts.es:
Dúo Superación de Villa Nueva
Doña Enma esperanza elizabeth de 20 años de edad es unida  tiene 1 hija de 2 años vive con su esposo y mamá  tiene un negocio de refacciones y licuados  quiere invertir en una refrigeradora para guardar su producto y comprar más variedad de productos y especies para las refacciones  inicio desde hace 4 años con una tienda, ahora vende refacciones y licuados  sus clientes son personas de su colonia y taxistas  del area  sus metas son: mejorar la calidad de vida mejorar los ingresos economicos fortalecer el negocio sueña con poder poner un local para poder ateneder mejor a sus clientes y poder darle lo necesario a su hija agradece a dios y a fape por la ayuda brindada hasta el momento .
texts.en:
Superación de Villa Nueva Duo

Enma Esperanza Elizabeth is 20 years old. She has a 2 year old daughter and she lives with her husband and mother, with whom she is close. She has a refreshments and smoothies business. She wants to invest in a refrigerator to keep her products and buy more of a variety of products and seasonings for her refreshments. She started four years ago with a store. Now she sells refreshments and smoothies to her customers, who are people from the neighborhood and taxi drivers from the area. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, improve her income, and fortify her business. She dreams of being able to open a locale to better serve her customers and be able to give her daughter everything she needs. She is thankful to God and Fape for the help they have given her so far.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesus está en su 8º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una situación de pobreza extrema, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marcelina, quien está en una situación de pobreza extrema, pero ella pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar cada día para poder ofrecer a sus familiares una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y a través de ello tiene los medios para poder procurarse una mejor vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y otras prendas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad.
texts.en:
The group "Niño Jesus" is in its eighth loan cycle in the women's committee program. All of the members are participating in the poverty elimination survey. Three of the nineteen women are below the poverty line, which is to say, in extreme poverty. They are striving to be able to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Marcelina, who is in extreme poverty, but who is putting all of her efforts into improving her situation so that she can offer her family a better quality of life. She makes a living selling clothing, and through this work, she has the means to create a better life.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, and other items. With this, she can continue with her sales and offer her customers a good variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, like shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Ines Haide

texts.es: Inés de 49 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, y al lado de sus hijas de 11 y 3 años y un hijo de 8 años de edad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y se gana la vida con la venta sopa de pata, además con las ventas que realiza gracias a su tienda de productos básicos, actividad que le ayuda a cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Inés tiene una visión, y es lograr tener una mejor vida y más tranquila, es por esto que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas, arroz, salsas, aceite, especias, plátano, verduras y demás productos para surtir la tienda.
texts.en: Inés, 49 years old, lives with her life partner and with her daughters, ages 11 and 3 and a son, age 8. She is a very hard-working person and earns her life selling sopa de pata [a hearty Salvadoran soup] in addition to the sales she makes thanks to her store with basic products, work that helps  her cover her basic needs and those of her family. Inés has a vision and it is to manage to have a better, more peaceful, life and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in drinks, rice, sauces, oil, spices, plantains, vegetables and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to invest in rice, salsa, oil, spices, plantains, vegetables and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen es habitante de Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en la acera de la carretera troncal; inició este negocio como una alternativa para generar ingresos para el sustento de su numerosa familia, ella es madre de seis hijos y los recursos que su cónyuge conseguía no daban abasto para cubrir todas las necesidades.  Hoy en día lleva dos años preparando frituras y pasteles que son muy apetecidos por conductores y transeúntes del sector y con la finalidad de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas y una estufa industrial que le permita agilizar la producción. Carmen desea crecer en su negocio y le gustaría tener otro punto de venta en cualquier sector del municipio. Su meta familiar es construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Carmen lives in Arjona, a municipality in the department of Bolívar and works selling fast food on the edge of a trunk highway. She began this business as an alternative to generate income to sustain her large family. She is the mother of six children and the resources that her spouse got were not enough to cover all the needs. Today she has been preparing fried dishes and cakes, which are very popular with driver and passersby in the sector, for two years. With the goal of improving her business conditions, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, which she is currently processing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase raw materials and an industrial stove which will allow her to make her production more efficient. Carmen wants to grow her business and would like to have another sales point in any sector of the municipality . Her family goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Indalesia

texts.es:
La Sra. Indalesia es de Ciudad del Este, tiene 1 hijo que le ayuda en su negocio, ambos son muy luchadores y trabajadores, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, en la cual todos los días trabajan desde muy temprano.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2012, es muy luchadora y trabajadora. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educo a su hijo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa con  , y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Indalesia is from Ciudad del Este and she has 1 child who helps her in her business. They are both very determined and hard-working. She has a well-stocked store in her house, in which they work every day from very early in the morning.

She is a very hard-working and responsible woman, she has worked with the Foundation since 2012 and is very determined and hard-working. Thanks to the work they do, she educated her child.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to be able to stock her store and, in this way, be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Guillermo Eliseo
