texts.es: Guillermo de 48 años de edad, tiene 30 años de residir en casa propia, en la cual vive al lado de su compañera de vida y al lado de sus hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad y dos hijos más los cuales son mayores de edad. Por quienes se esfuerza a diario para que no les falte nada en su hogar y de esta manera puedan vivir de una mejor manera. Guillermo presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda, gracias a este humilde empleo ha podido darles todo lo necesario a su familia. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Guillermo solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por el paso de los años y los días de lluvias se filtra el agua, y así de esta manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Guillermo is 48 years old. He has been living in his own home for 30 years. He lives there with his life's companion and their children, aged 15 and 18, and two other children who are grown. he works hard for them so they will lack for nothing at home and so they can have a better standard of living. Guillermo offers his services in a business close to his home. Thanks to this humble job, he has been able to give his family everything his family needs. Seeking to improve his life, Guillermo is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, nails, and to pay for labor to change the roof on his home. It has deteriorated over the years and on rainy days the water leaks in. This way, he can improve his and his family's quality of life a little.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, nails, and to pay for labor to change the roof on his house.

loans.name: Marta Irma

texts.es: Marta de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y vive al lado de su hijo de 5 años de edad en una humilde vivienda en la cual tiene 27 años de residir. Ella es madre soltera y en busca de poder darle todo lo necesario a su hijo, se dedica a la venta de pijamas las cuales ella misma confecciona y de esta manera logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para el gasto del hogar, además en busca de obtener más ingresos económicos, ayuda con el cuidado de un niño de su misma comunidad, de esta manera Marta, con esfuerzo y dedicación logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera, clavos y mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado y esto genera que haya una filtración de agua en los días de lluvia, y por ello surge la inseguridad y el miedo a posibles enfermedades para su hijo por la humedad y el frío.
texts.en: Marta, 48 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 5-year-old son in a humble house where she has lived for 27 years. She is a single mother and, seeking to be able to give her son everything he needs, she works selling pajamas which she makes herself and in this way she manages to get the income needed for the household expenses. In addition, in search of getting more income, she helps care for a boy in her same community. In this way Marta, with hard work and dedication, manages to get the income needed to cover the household expenses. Seeking to improve her quality of life and that of her son, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, and to pay labor costs to replace the roof on her house since, with the passing of time, it has deteriorated and this allows for leaks of water on rainy days, this spurs insecurity and fear of possibly illnesses for her son due to the dampness and cold.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, and pay labor costs to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS”; Este banco se ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al  negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando ara de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zanahorias, tomates entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale  en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Señor de los Milagros communal bank. This bank is located in Urubamba province and Cusco department.

The borrower is Benedicta. She alternates her daily tasks with working at her business selling vegetables. The borrower is a responsible and determined person. The borrower has been doing this business for years, which is going well thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. The borrower wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

The borrower asks for a loan to purchase carrots, tomatoes and more.

The borrowers, in general, are grateful for the granted loan and promise to make the established payments.

The borrower who is in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, tomatoes, and more.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen, a resident of Salama Munyonyo, is married and has children.

She is also a business lady dealing in rentals. She is apparently faced with the challenge of heavy rains that have affected her rentals, washing away the plaster. Yet she has no money to renovate the premises. She was worried her tenants might leave the rooms because of the current condition.

She was left with no option but to seek the services of UGAFODE Microfinance in order to buy materials to renovate her house. This will boost the quality of her rooms and give her a steady income.

She appreciates the generous support of the Kiva lenders and UGAFODE. Pictured is Allen with her husband at their home.

loans.use: with construction.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila de 46 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de sus dos hijos de 8 y 16 años, y una hija de 24 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida con varios negocios que maneja en su comunidad, entre estos están la venta de verduras y venta de tortillas. Negocios con los cuales con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia, gracias a esto Domitila puede sacar adelante a su familia. Por la necesidad de mejorar su estilo de vida que Domitila solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Domitila is 46 years old. She lives in her own home with her two sons, aged 8 and 16, and a 24 year old daughter. She earns a living with several businesses she manages in her community. Among these are selling vegetables and tortillas. With these businesses she has been able to pay for her family's basic needs. Thanks to this, Domitila can get her family ahead. Needing to improve her standard of living, Domitila is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, nails and to pay for labor to repair the roof on her home in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, nails and to pay for labor costs to repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Teofila Petrona

texts.es: Teófila de 64 años de edad, vive en casa propia en la cual tiene 21 años de residir, vive al lado de su hijo de 25 años quien le acompaña y apoya en el diario vivir. Teófila con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sostener la economía del hogar ella sola. Esto ha sido gracias a un pequeño negocio que mantiene de venta de tortillas en su comunidad, negocio que tiene ya varios años de administrar, y con lo poco que gana lo ha ido invirtiendo en gastos del hogar y en los estudios de su hijo que ahora ha crecido y que gracias a un humilde empleo que tiene le ayuda en la economía del hogar. Teófila desea mejorar su calidad de vida para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pila, ya que hasta el momento no cuenta con una y se le dificulta el poder almacenar agua para las labores del hogar y así también para su consumo.
texts.en:
Teófila is 64 years old and lives in her own house, where she has resided for 21 years. She lives with her 25-year-old son, who keeps her company and supports her in her everyday life.

With a great deal of effort, Teófila has managed to keep up with the household budget on her own. This has been possible thanks to a small business that she keeps selling tortillas in her community. She has been running this business for several years, and she invests the little bit she earns in the household expenses and in her son's education. He is now grown, and thanks to the modest employment he has, he helps her out with the household budget.

Teófila wants to improve her quality of life so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand and pay the labor to build a wash stand with water storage, because right now she doesn't have one and it is hard for her to store water for the household chores as well as for her own consumption.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand and pay for labor to build a washstand with water storage.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has two children, one of whom attends school. Fatuma owns a house that does not have either electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door, with passers-by and town dwellers being her potential customers. Her business faces the challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan, she wants to add to her savings and buy a new motorcycle. Fatuma joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Alegres De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres Alegres de Sumpango
Este dúo está integrado por Silvia, es madre de 7 niños todos están estudiando, es el segundo crédito que solicita y lo necesita para poder comprar hilo de diferentes colores, y así mismo comprar el hilo por mayor ya que su negocio ha ido creciendo y con el capital que tiene no le alcanza para poder comprar mercadería, por lo que con los 3000 que está solicitando piensa invertirlo muy bien en su negocio para multiplicarlo y seguir pagando el estudio de sus hijos. Esta agradecida con Dios por la ayuda que kiva le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres Alegres De Sumpango Group

Silvia is a member of this duo. She is a mother of 7 children, all of them are studying. This is her second loan request and she needs it to buy different colors of thread, buying the thread at wholesale. Her business has grown and she does not have enough capital to buy merchandise. She will use 3,000 GTQ to invest very wisely in her business in order to increase it and continue paying for her children to study.

She is grateful to God for the help that Kiva has given.

loans.use: to buy raw material in order to create typical weavings to sell

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is married and blessed with four children. The family lives in a four bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. They have faced many challenges such as accidents, poverty, death and sickness. Theresia was advised by her friends to join GHAPE; she has been a member for some time and has taken out and repaid three loans.

With this new loan, Theresia will pay for the clearing of her farm and will buy seedlings and a watering can. She is confident that this will enable her farm to produce a successful crop because she has been in this business for a long time and thus has a lot of experience, as well as a ready market for her produce. The community will benefit from her activity in that it will provide them with enough food and thus reduce the costs of travelling distances to buy food. With the profit she makes from this loan, she will be able to pay her children’s fees and improve the family's living standards.

Theresia prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the hospitality of members toward each other. In addition, members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to pay for the clearing of her farm and to buy seedlings and a watering can.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 51 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y junto a su hija de 8 años de edad. Reside en casa propia en la cual ha vivido durante ocho años. Maribel día con día se esfuerza por cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, lo cual lo logra con un pequeño negocio que tiene de venta de ropa de dama y niño. Negocio el cual lleva 10 años de administrarlo, y debido al  tiempo que ha tenido el negocio ya cuenta con un número bastante elevado de clientes los cuales la prefieren para la adquisición de sus prendas de vestir. Así también su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Maribel en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo del baño debido a que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y se filtra el agua los días de lluvia. Así de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mejor higiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Maribel is 51 years old, and lives with her life companion and 8-year-old daughter. She lives in her own home, where she has been residing for 8 years.

Day by day, Maribel struggles to cover the basic necessities for the household. She does so with a small business that she has, selling clothing for women and children. She has been running this business for 10 years, and because of the length of time she has had the business, she has quite a number of customers who prefer her as a buyer for their clothing items. Her life companion also helps her with the household expenses.

Maribel is requesting a loan from FUSAI to improve her quality of life by investing in corrugated sheet metal, nails and to pay for labor to repair the roof over her bathroom, which is currently in bad shape and leaks water on rainy days. She hopes to improve her quality of life and have better hygiene in her home.

loans.use: to in invest in corrugated sheet metal, nails and pay for labor to repair the roof over her bathroom.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Ziguinchor Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le vingt février 2001. Le groupe est composé de sept femmes qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante ans et mère d'une fille. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité deux sacs de pain de singe par mois, un rouleau de tissus de wax, des sachets plastiques pour la conservation. Elle a une bonne clientèle et arrive à écouler ses produits facilement. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on February 20, 2001. The group is made up of seven businesswomen.

Madam, who is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a married, 40-year-old woman and the mother of one daughter.

With this loan she intends to buy two bags of fruit of the Baobab tree (monkey bread) each month, a roll of wax fabric, plastic bags for preserving.

She has a good customer base and sells her products easily. The profits will help her take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of Baobab tree fruit (monkey bread), fabric, and bags.

loans.name: Nemreh

texts.en:
Nemreh is a 58-year-old single Palestinian refugee. Thirty-two years ago, she started tailoring clothes from her house to cover her living expenses and needs, without any help from her siblings due to their poor financial and social conditions. She is a hard worker and a talented tailoring professional, known among her customers for her quick service and good quality products.

Today, Nemreh is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary repairs to her home's roof before the winter season. This is her eighth experience as an Al Majmoua borrower and she has a good standing and pay back history. Her last loan was used to buy a better sewing machine, which helped her in providing customers with the best and fastest service.

In the future, Nemreh hopes to open her own tailoring shop in a location where she can reach more customers and provide them with fashionable clothes.

loans.use: to fix leaks in her roof before winter.

loans.name: Lamis

texts.en:
Lamis is a 22-year-old single woman who has been working as a tutor since 2009. She is very talented and ambitious and seeks to graduate and work in her field as soon as possible.

Lamis is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her university tuition fees to study English literature.

Lamis is in her first year, and is looking forward to graduate within three years.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees to study English literature.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as honest.

Everlyn operates a retail business where she sells plastic containers . She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as low inventory. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more plastic containers. This will enable her to have more stock to sell hence increase in profits.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will save the anticipated profits for future use.

loans.use: to buy more plastic containers.

loans.name: Claudia Yamileth

texts.es: Claudia de 27 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de cuatro años, también vive con sus padres y dos hermanas. Claudia es madre soltera y se esfuerza por que a su hijo no le falte nada. Es por eso que se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos y niños, negocio que ha administrado durante cinco años y gracias al tiempo que lleva con el negocio se ha hecho muy conocida por las personas del lugar, gracias a ello muchos clientes prefieren sus prendas de vestir. También en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, busca la manera de mejorar su vivienda para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su hogar, y de esta forma ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 27 years old. She lives alongside her son of four years and with her parents and two sisters. Claudia is a single mother exerting herself so her son does not lack anything. This is why she sells clothing for adults and children.

She has been managing the business for five years and thanks to the time she has in the business she has become well known by the local people. Thanks to that many customers prefer her garments.

She is also in search of a better quality of life. Looking for a way to improve her house she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in laminated sheeting and nails, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home so she can offer a better quality of life to her young son.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting and nails, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives with her two children and mother in Noyemberyan town. She is a teacher of dance, working at a local art school. Karine also teaches students in her house and provides individual lessons for them. The work she is doing is very important for Karine herself and also people living in the town.

The requested loan is necessary for Karine to purchase special costumes and clothing for children to wear in dancing classes and perform in concerts.

Karine hopes that her students will be professionals and will have success in the future.

loans.use: to pay for special costumes and clothing for children to wear in dancing classes and when performing in concerts.

loans.name: Mwajaa

texts.en:
Mwajaa is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. In addition she also operates a boutique selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Direct selling has been Angeline's business involvement. She has been doing this business for four months. She is married with three children.

Angeline would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000 to use in buying more stocks of Tupperware and cosmetic products such as hand and body lotion, perfumes, lipstick, make up and fabric conditioner to sell. She knows that having this loan amount will enable her to obtain better income and send her three children into higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Tupperware and cosmetic products such as hand and body lotion, perfumes, lipstick, make up and fabric conditioner to sell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman. She has 3 children.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells airtime scratch cards. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Daniel will use the KES 99,000 loan to buy more stock of airtime. His business goal is to have a great business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Daniel's previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of airtime scratch cards

loans.name: Elena Angelina

texts.es:
La necesidad de seguirse sintiendo útil a los cincuenta y tres años, Y mejorar la calidad de servicios que ofrece su ciber café, son las principales razones por las que Elena solicita un préstamo, sin embargo, su negocio no es su única fuente de ingresos, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, sus cinco hijos y de remesas. 
Con el préstamo, doña Elena Planea expandir su ciber café, comprar equipos nuevos y una fotocopiadora para ampliar los servicios y mejorar la calidad de los mismos.
texts.en:
The main reasons why Elena is requesting a loan are the necessity to feel useful at 53 years of age, and to improve the quality of the services at her internet cafe. Yet her business is not her only source of income. She also counts on the support of her husband and her five sons, as well as remittances.

With this loan, doña Elena plans to expand her internet cafe and to buy new equipment and a photocopying machine in order to amplify and improve the services.

loans.use: buy new equipment and a photocopying machine

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a grocery and vegetable stalls. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition she also operates a belt selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasani

texts.en:
Mwanasani is married with four children, two whom attend school . They live at rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is a married mother of one child, who is in school.

She has been running poultry business for one year now. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She will use this loan to improve her business by increasing number of chickens to meet her customers request.

This will be Glory's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to started her business and has paid back her loan very well. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profits to make loan repayments, open another pavilion of chickens and take care of her family.

She dreams of expanding her business. Glory will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying more chickens.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Quelloccocha Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES DE QUELLOCCOCHA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca, distrito de Lamay y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Aniceto tiene 33 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar como porteador en camino inca, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de vivieres como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank Los Angeles de Quelloccocha, located in the province of Calca, district of Lamay and department of Cusco.

Aniceto is 33 years old, single, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities, dedicating herself to work as a porter on the Inca Trail. Her business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to her business. She wants to be able to continue working in this way so she can continue supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy provisions such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

The members are grateful for the loan that has been provided and they promise to make their payments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as rice, sugar, milk, and more

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself as goal oriented.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married and blessed with eight children. They all live in a six-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many difficulties in life, such as ethe sickness and death of his sond, arm robbery and fire. He also faces the challenge of lack of finance to start up a business of his own and cater to his family's needs,

With this new loan, he will buy piglets, chicks, feed, water feeders and will construct a pig fence. He is confident that this business will succeed because he has been doing it for a long time and he has many steady customers. He has experience in rearing chicks and has many customers to whom he supplies. With this business activity, the community will benefit from his moderate prices and the distance to buy chicks from the market will be reduced.

With the profit made from this loan, he will pay his children's school fees, support his sisters and brothers, and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment and provide medication for his family.

He prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks, feed, water feeders and to construct a pig fence.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as determined.

Mercy operates a car wash. And has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another car washing machine. Her business goal is to have three car washing businesses within 5 years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to add more water tanks.

loans.use: to buy  another car washing machine.

loans.name: Mwazi

texts.en:
Mwazi is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be persistent.

Daniel operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles within five years.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mekat

texts.en:
Mekat is a 57-year-old, married mother of three children who opened in 2000 her current convenience store to support her husband, who works as a taxi driver with a low income, in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Mekat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will respond to her customers' needs. She will also use part of the loan to make slight modifications to her shop to keep it up to customers' expectations.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that will respond to her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a married mother of two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over seven years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Pro Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal “Pro Desarrollo” en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.
La socia Ruth Estelmina continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia también continua con su negocio de venta de artesanía, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, menestras, arroz entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Ruth Estelmina belongs to the Pro Desarrollo communal bank group in Pisaq district, in Calca province, in Cusco department. Ruth continues with her business of grocery store. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she continues to sell her products to her customers. She also continues with her craft business. With these means, she gets ahead with her family. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to buy oil, mixed vegetables, and rice, among others.  The other members in general are grateful for the offered opportunity and promise to make their respective payment on the established schedule. 

The person with the covered face does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy oil, mixed vegetables, rice, among others

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are regular.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have increased profits within five years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik is from Meghrashen, a village in the Shirak region. She is married and is a mother of two children. For many years, Qnarik has been involved in the farming business. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. She also milks cows to get cheese and cream, which she sells in her community. Since there are not many stores selling basic foodstuffs, Qnarik is able to successfully sell her goods to earn daily income.

In requesting this loan, Qnarik is asking lenders to help her purchase forage to feed her livestock. Additionally, she will use the loan to hire workers to help her cultivate her 3 hectares of land. With stable monthly profit earned from her business, Qnarik hopes to enlarge her farming and selling business and to earn more income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her livestock and to hire workers to help her cultivate her 3 hectares of land.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik, a teacher by profession, works and lives in Spandaryan village. Besides working in a village school, Hasmik has been running a farming business. She keeps a cow, two calves, and hens, and also cultivates potatoes, carrots, garlic and some greens.

Hasmik lives with her mother and her 3-year-old son, as her father and two brothers are migrant workers in a neighboring country.

Hasmik asks for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the cattle, and fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation to develop her farm and gather more income for her family.

For Hasmik, what is most important is to see her family healthy and without financial hardships. Thus, she works hard to gather good income from her farming business and cover daily costs.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cattle, and fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation to develop her farm and gather more income for her family.

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bello has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bello would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Bello can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bello will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Bello is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hassan is thankful that his days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Hassan now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Bertila, 54, lives in her own home with her daughter. She has a food stall that she's operated for twenty years near her place of residence. With the income from this work, she is able to meet household expenses.

This client wants to expand her stall by buying tables and chairs, as well as food supplies, including rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruits, vegetables and more, so that she can change the menu selections and earn a little more income. However, she does not have enough money for this investment and that's why she approached Integral for a loan. It will help her to improve her income and reach better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, as well as food supplies including rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is a 64-year-old carpenter at Mariakani, Kenya. He is a father of six adults and has been doing well in this business for the last twenty years.

This is Phillip's fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after successfully repaying the previous ones. He will use the loan to purchase timber for his workshop and the anticipated profits to repay his loan and pay for his children's education.

Phillip hopes to expand his business in future.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen es una joven muy trabajadora que labora en su puesto de venta de comidas y heladería. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de equipo mobiliario y mercadería para la elaboración de dichas comidas. De esta manera logrará ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes y aumentar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Karen is a very hard-working young woman who works at a food/ice cream stall. She is requesting a loan of a million Costa Rican Colones (₡ 1 000 000) to buy furnishing merchandise for food preparation. In this way, she can offer a better service to her customers and increase sales of her business.

loans.use: to buy furnishing equipment and merchandise for the food stall

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 29-year-old, married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives in Hoima, Uganda and is a very hardworking woman. Her dream is to have a business that generates stable income.

To achieve this dream, Caroline ventured into operating a bar, where she mostly sells beers and sodas. She supplements this with income earned from maize farming. Caroline complains about the high rental and license fees associated with her business, and she is seeking credit to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella  tiene 38 años de edad, es divorciada con un hijo varón de once años, trabaja como auxiliar de producción en una empresa de alimentos. Requiere una cirugía para implantar un injerto en su ojo izquierdo, esto por una pequeña lesión que le detectaron y que esta afectando gradualmente su visión por lo que le resulta  complicado realizar sus actividades laborales. Desafortunadamente sus ingresos no le permiten solventar la cirugía.
texts.en:
She is 38 years old, divorced, and has an 11 year old son. She works as a production assistant for a food business.

She needs surgery to implant a graft in her left eye. This is because of a small lesion that they found. It is gradually affecting her vision, which makes doing her daily work activities difficult for her.

Unfortunately, her earnings do not allow her to pay for the surgery.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is in his early 40s and is married with eight children. Seven are still in school and one is grown up. He has been selling stone from quarries since 1992. He works from 6am e to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hashim's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the store stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting him with the loan which has made him moving forward with his family. His kids are going to good schools and they do not luck anything.

He used the profit to pay school fees, built his house, bought a TV set, a radio, sofa sets, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on stones stock and make more stone quarries. He dreams of becoming an international business man.

Hashim will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase on stones  stock and make more stone quarries.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
A 21-year-old Palestinian Refugee. This is Ahmad a hardworking man, who has five years of experience in motorcycle repair.
Ahmad lives and works in Palestinian Refugees camp and is putting so much effort develop his living.
He is well known in his region, that he had to quit school in early stages and work hard to make his living. His business is going on just fine, but he is ambitious and is working hard to expand and develop it.
That's why, today, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH  loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to open another branch to expand his working zone and increase his income.
Ahmad hopes to open more branches in several nearby villages and develop his living.

loans.use: to open another motor cycle repair branch to expand his working zone and increase his income.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be self motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells stationery and also offers photocopy,printing services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 38,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to set up a cyber café.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery and office supplies, so that she may open a cyber cafe one day

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne’s previous loan application became a medium for her to step up on the business. Because of the amount granted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) she was able to buy raw materials needed in making different designs of rugs. Sincerest gratitude she wants to send to all lenders and CCT for the monetary provision they’ve provided. 

Roxanne is focused on how to grow her business. Since aside from the income earned by his husband, making and selling rugs also became their source of income. And it is also her dream as a parent to support her children’s educational expenses until they finish college.   

Revolving fund is what Roxanne lacks. She needs to buy bulk quantity of raw materials like fabric, threads and other materials needed for the business. For this reason, she applied for a new loan amounting to Php 30,000 and she has faith that this will be granted to her once more.

Roxanne has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy raw products she needs to make more rugs that she sells and additional broom reeds which she also trades.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused and disciplined.

Jonathan operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation.

He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards and educate his children.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a happily married man living in Kasese, Uganda.

Joram deals in selling clothes and agriculture for income generation. He also provides for his family without interfering with his business capital.

He is a focused hardworking man, determined to serve his customers with what they ask for. In spite of this, Joram is faced with competition and constant changes in fashions and designs. However, he has thought of a way of overcoming these challenges by purchasing clothes for women and children since these two groups buy clothes at a higher rate. The challenge is that the money at hand is not enough to so.

Joram is now requesting a loan to buy women's and children's clothes to sell, which will allow him to meet his goal and improve his business performance.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes for selling.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Selina has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that Selina is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and has been blessed with two children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has been blessed with one child  who is young to  attend school. Together with her husband, they live at a rental house that has electricity and  piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Nebahat

texts.en:
Nebahat is married and has three children.  One and a half year ago she started filling dried lavender into tiny tulle bags and selling them in order to make a contribution to the family budget.  She also works with her daughter-in-law who sells wedding ornaments and baby candies to several shops.  

Nebahat requested her third loan, which she will use to buy lavender and tulle fabric. When she buys in bulks the price becomes reasonable and she has no trouble fulfilling her orders. She hopes to make enough money to buy a house.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nebahat Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Bir buçuk yıl önce evine katkı sağlamak için başladığı tüllere lavanta doldurma işine devam ediyor.  Anlaştığı birkaç dükkan ile birlik de nikah ve bebek şekerleri yapan gelini ile de çalışıyor.  Amacı evine maddi destek sağlamak ve bir ev almak.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile lavanta ve tül alacak.  Toplu ürün aldığında fiyat olarak  uyguna geliyor ve elinde mal olduğu için siparişleri karşılamak da sıkıntı yaşamıyor.

loans.use: to purchase lavender and tulle fabric

loans.name: Syokau

texts.en:
Syokau is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the high cost of transportation. With the 30,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Syokau wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Christine operates a grocery stall at the market, where she sells vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a resident of Padampur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 37 years old. She has a small family with her husband and only one son. Her husband is a local contractor. Minati makes feaf plates and sells them in the nearest market.

No doubt she has everything required for the basic necessities of life like a small but permanent income, a two wheeler, and other allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not happy due to lack of a pucca (solid and permanent) house.

It doesn’t means that they are staying at an open place or thatched house, but they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent charged by house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos which creates a very critical situation during rainy season. It is also a very critical situation to stay there during the winter period. The most important thing is that the uncertain house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a RCC (reinforced cement concrete) house at a good standard. She has already started to construct the house, but the fund availability is not sufficient to complete it. So she decided to take a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment Minati came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within few months and she will be proud to be a house owner in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron rods, sand, and distemper .

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es casada tiene 60 de edad. Padece una enfermedad crónica lo que ha afectado sus dos ojos lo que ha bloqueado su visión, por lo que no distingue entre lo claro y oscuro. Cuando empezó a perder la vista recibió un tratamiento que pero no obtuvo resultados. Le urge una cirugía antes de que el daño sea reversible,lamentablemente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes.
texts.en:
She is 60 years old and married. She has a chronic disease that has affected both of her eyes. It has obstructed her vision. Therefore, she cannot distinguish between light and dark.

When she started to lose her vision she had a treatment, but she did not get results. It is urgent to have surgery before the damage becomes irreversible.

Sadly, she does not have enough resources.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Neh Julia Ngu

texts.en:
She has separated with five children. She lives in a two bed room house in Bamenda North West Region Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, which are the death of her father, mother and brother, sickness, and divorce. These have made life so difficult for her.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2003. She has successfully borrowed and repaid loan once already.
With this new loan she is going to buy chicks, feed, and medication for the chicks, mushroom spawns and rice husk. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for long, people know the importance of mushrooms and they are sold in all seasons.

With this business activity the community will benefit from moderate prices, they will not go long distances to buy in the market and they will have enough manure to use in their farms.
The profit from this loan helps her pay for her children's school fees and provide some basic food for the family, pay for family’s medication, plow back some of the profit and buy a plot to build a house for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rate and convenient terms of repayment.

loans.use: buy mushroom spawns, rice husk, chicks, feed and medication for the chicks .

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 36 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañera de vida y de sus dos hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual comercializa con el fin de mantener la economía del hogar y de esta manera cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, la venta de ropa la realiza por temporada, ya que hay tiempos en que la demanda de ropa aumenta y es en ese momento en el que aprovecha, además se desempeña como albañil independiente, siempre buscando la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Y es por lo que Víctor solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción del corredor de su vivienda, de esta manera tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor, age 36, lives by the side of his life partner and their two children, ages 8 and 14. He sells clothes in order to support his household. This way he covers his family's basic necessities. He sells clothes by the season. There are times when the demand for clothes increases, and he takes advantage of that. He also works as an independent bricklayer. He is always looking for the way to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

That is why Victor is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting, and iron and to pay for the labor to build a patio on his house. This way he will have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting, and iron and to pay for the labor to build a patio onto his house.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzuki is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells soda, bread, utensils, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 28,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda, utensils. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business and improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda, utensils.

loans.name: Chikando

texts.en: Chikando is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, rice, sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil, vegetables, fruits and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, vegetables and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Mirtha Ester

texts.es: Mirtha es una ama de casa que reside con su familia en Arjona un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y en la comodidad de su hogar elabora tortas, galletas y postres, negocio que inició para generar ingresos y aportar a la economía de su hogar.  Ella aprendió este oficio en el vecino país de Venezuela y adquirió toda la experiencia necesaria para crear microempresa, en cuanto se instaló en Cartagena de Indias no tuvo dudas de que iba a tener éxito en su proyecto.  Mirtha comercializa sus productos en las tiendas de diferentes barrios y colegios, la mayor parte de su producción la cancelan de contado y con lo recaudado vuelve a reinvertir para su nueva producción.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materias primas e invertir en una nueva idea de negocio: comercializar ropa en la temporada decembrina para maximizar sus ingresos. Su meta a futuro es tener un local propio y colocar un punto de venta.  Su meta familiar es tener su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a housewife who lives with her family in Arjona, a municipality in the department of Bolívar. In the comfort of her home she makes cakes, cookies, and desserts. She started her business in order to earn money to support the household finances.

She learned this trade in the neighboring country of Venezuela and acquired all the necessary experience needed to create a microenterprise. When she settled in Cartagena de Indias she had no doubt that she would succeed in her project.

Mirtha sells her products in the stores in different neighborhoods and schools. Most of her products are paid for in cash and she returns the proceeds for reinvestment in her new production.

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the process with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy raw materials to invest in a new business idea: to sell clothes during the holiday season to maximize her earnings.

Her future goal is to have her own facility to have a sales outlet. Her family goal is to have their own home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for investment in a new business idea: to sell clothing in the holiday season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Maria has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

Maria decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Bebi

texts.en:
Bebi  is a married woman with six children, all of whom attends school. She owns house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Planisha

texts.en: Planisha is 68 years old and she lives alone in Senaki district. She is a teacher and gets monthly salary. She decided to start additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5,000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell them at higher price. Planisha hopes that the business will be profitable and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Dahiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Dahiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Dahiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija (24) lives in Kilosa district, she lives with her mother. Hadija is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers working with children in secondary school, she teaches them on the importance of education and how they can help each other’s learning to improve their learning performance. Hadija has a shop, she is selling varieties of utensils products such as spoons, cups, thermos, and buckets. Hadija is requesting a kiva loan to increase the stock in her shop by buying in a bulk from a town where the price is low. Hadija plans to use the profit she will earn to support her family in daily needs and to be a big entrepreneur in her society.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her shop by buying in a bulk from a town where the price is low.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 23-year-old single mother of one child who lives in Kilolo district with her grandmother. She volunteers as a Camfed leaner guide. She is requesting a loan start a market stall business. Patricia plans to use the profit she will earn to help her grand mother and support her child. The “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Patricia's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to  launch her market stall business

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is father of 5 kids and he is married. The family house is made of adobe. Raul has two jobs he is a driver and also a mason.

Raul needs a loan to buy a concrete mixer for his mason business. He works hard and he has to send 4 of his kids to the school. Raul has big plans for his family, so he hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy a concrete mixer for his mason business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 31 year old tailor at Kilifi Kenya, she is a mother of three whose spouse provides for, and has been in this business for the last fifteen years doing well.

This is her  first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the loan to purchase threads and African print clothing and the anticipated profit to repay her loan, she hopes to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase threads and African print clothing

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She owns rental houses. She describes her challenge to be access to water. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa works hard to support her family. Leonisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonisa requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for 26 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha is a 29 – year - old entrepreneur, requesting a loan in order to  expand her business and to renovate her shop. She is married lives in Kilolo district with her husband,  she is a mother of three children. She volunteers as a Camfed learner guide. Furaha is requesting Kiva loan in to expand her market stall business by increasing commodities in her stall. She plans to use the profit she earns to help her family and support children. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Hamida 's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to  expand her business and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en: Ann is 56 years old and married with seven children. They are living in a rural village of the Battambang province. Nowadays, she needs to support on four dependent children. Her main sources of income are from pigs-raising and working as a labor for others. Her pigs got ill, so she did not get good income for her family. She has been with her family’s business for 10 years and she can save from her income about 6 USD per day. This is first time for Ann with VisionFund and she is the group leader with two members to seeking this loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed to support on her raising business in order to get more income than last year. She hopes that she can improve her living condition better in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed to support on her raising business in order to make more income than last year.

loans.name: Nersik

texts.en:
Nersik lives with his parents, and he mostly cares about providing appropriate and lighthearted living conditions for them. Using his own truck, he sells fruits and vegetables in the Karmir village and nearby communities. He has been engaged in this business for five years. In requesting this loan, Nersik asks lenders to help him purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk so that he can sell them to the nearby community and enlarge his business.

Additionlly, Nersik owns a warehouse, where he keeps the stock of fruits and vegetables before he sells them. He plans to build a refrigerator there so that his business will be less dependent on seasonality.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables in bulk to sell to the nearby community and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Las Flores De Yanaconas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Maria ella es soltera y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
Los socios que estan  pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.



Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank Las Flores de Yanaconas. This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The borrower named Rosa Maria is single, 44 years old, with two children. She has a grocery store business. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm. She has been in this business for five years and it is going well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments according to plan.

The borrowers attached to the group photo were taken after the meeting. They asked permission because of work motives. The other borrowers work in agriculture, livestock, grocery store business, and animal sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is a sari-sari store owner who lives in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has nine children, two adults and seven dependent children.  Her husband works hard as a fisherman to provide the needs of their children. While Marlyn sells assorted goods to her sari-sari store such as sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items mention earlier and plans to buy new fishing net to help her husband to enhance their catch. Aside from that, Marlyn wishes to buy solar charger. In the future, she is aiming of a business improvement for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks; fishing net, solar charger

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is 64 years old and married with seven children.  

Evangelista is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangelista requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangelista has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangelista would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Asomaliu

texts.en: Asomaliu is a 43 year old mother with 4 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Asomaliu requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, hand gloves, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Karama

texts.en: Karama is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are regular. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: buy more charcoal

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is in her early 40s and is married with three children.  One of them is grown up and the other two are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 06am to 10pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Janeth's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on mamalishe and has paid back all her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in  mamalishe store. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.  

Janeth will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in  mamalishe store.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is in her early 30's and married, with three children, two of whom are in school.

She has been running several businesses for four years. Agatha works as a food vendor, sells soft drinks, and sells ladies clothing. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Agatha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her inventory. She dreams of educating her children in good schools.

Agatha will be accountable for repaying her loan.

loans.use: to build her businesses.

loans.name: Agnes
