texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 9 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a posho mill. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be machine breakdown. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another posho mill machine. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another posho mill machine in order to grind maize in her area

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is an old man fifty three years old living with his wife and grand children. He is involved in agriculture, especially the piggery business. According to him; he has been in the above activity for over five years.

He is also involved in a coffee growing project which also majorly contributing to his sources of income. Through the above projects he has been able to buy land plus also taking care of his family and sisters.

He says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders. His biggest challenge is limited capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.
He is described as a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina works hard to support her family. Monina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Monina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Monina has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hewfo Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three ladies who have an average age of 35 years. Elizabeth is a member, a woman who appears to be the source of motivation to her counterparts. She is a mother of 4 and is married to a police officer, on the far right in the photo.

Elizabeth has been sewing 10 years now. Elizabeth who is helping her husband to feed the family, confessed that ID-Ghana has helped her a lot since many potential Micro finance institutions were just giving her false promises. Elizabeth hopes to have the biggest sewing shop in the area but has to have constant finance assistance, that is why she has come to join ID-Ghana. Elizabeth hopes her work will increase if she becomes a member of the association that take loan from micro finance.

Elizabeth wants a loan from ID-Ghana so that she will be able to buy more materials, sew and sell to customers, being a woman of such creativeness and venture in this kind of business speaks volumes her hardworking character.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has two sons. She lives with her mother in a private house. Svetlana has been working  as a baker for 13 years. She is hardworking and responsible person.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 8 000 UAH to build two extra rooms to her house. She needs to buy materials for building: sand, cement, gravel, and the wood for the roof. Due to the loan Svetlana's sons will get their own rooms.

loans.use: to buy enough materials to add two rooms to her house

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 20 years old, she runs and operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Ana requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, plastic bags, freezer, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Ana will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, plastic bags, freezer,

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is in good health, as is her family. Delia is still working making cheese and her boyfriend is still working as a mason, but Delia thinks he could help her with the business.

That is why she needs a loan to buy a milking cow that her boyfriend will take care of. Delia is sure that this is a good idea and so she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Madres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que se formó para poder trabajar de manera conjunta, y así ayudarse para poder mejorar.
La señora Alicia es una de las que integra este grupo, ella ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de chipas que realiza todos los días, la chipa es un alimento típico paraguayo que se vende durante todo el año. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer su chipa, como ser almidón, queso, huevos, manteca y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called Madres Trabajadoras are in their first loan cycle in the women’s committee program. It is a new group formed to work together and thus help one another improve.

Alicia is one of the members of this group. She helps to support her family by selling chipas everyday. Chipa is a typical Paraguayan food sold throughout the year.

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to make chipas, such as starch, cheese, eggs, butter, and more so she can continue her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make chipas, a typical food product of Paraguay, including: starch, cheese, eggs, butter, and more.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused and disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil

loans.name: Solidario Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
Solidario Buena Vista
La encargada de este grupo es doña Antonia de 32 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 hijos.  Ella tiene una tienda desde hace 4 años y está ubicada en la calle principal de su colonia.  Su sueño es que el negocio siga creciendo y seguir ayudando a su esposo en la educación de sus hijitos.  Ella necesita comprar varias cosas para la tienda como maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar, pastas, jabón, embutidos y quesos y cremas, también golosinas y galletas.  Ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para todo lo que le hace falta y por ello está pidiendo su segundo préstamo para surtir mas la tienda y no quedarle mal a sus clientes cada vez que llegan con ella a comprar.  Ella está muy agradecida con Dios por la oportunidad que se le brinda de poder salir adelante y  les desea bendiciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is the person in charge of the Solidario Buena Vista group. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children. For the last four years, Antonia has run a store located in the main street of her community. Her dream is to see her business continue to grow and to carry on helping her husband with the cost of educating their children.

Antonia needs a loan to buy various things for the store such as maize, beans, rice, sugar, pasta, soap, cold meats, cheeses, creams, as well as candy and cookies. She can't afford to buy all that she needs so she is seeking her second loan to add stock to her store and avoid upsetting her customers who buy their groceries from her.

Antonia is very grateful to God for the opportunity given to her to get ahead and she asks for His blessing.

loans.use: buy groceries as stock for her store

loans.name: Yonah

texts.en:
Yonah is a farmer growing bananas, tomatoes, and onions. He used his previous loan to buy herbicides for his plantation.

Yonah started this business with the hope of earning income, but he is faced with challenges: less capital, pests and diseases, and unfavorable weather conditions. These difficulties affect the expansion of his business to new areas.

He is a focused man, and determined to keep his tomato business running year round, by ensuring that he sprays to fight pests and diseases. Yonah has requested a loan to buy herbicides for his plantation.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, and to pay for labor for transplanting his tomato seedlings.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is every hard working man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 4 children and only one attends school in Hoima Uganda. He deals in agro input items as he also ventures in crop production mostly maize in order to supplement his incomes. He intends to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital to stock enough products which his customers demand for. He is thus seeking for credit to buy more agro inputs for sell.

loans.use: to buy more agro inputs for sell.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Amadu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amadu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Amadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Suubi Traders Kirinya Group

texts.en:
Tabisa is a new client in Ugafode microfinance ltd. She is a single mother with children.
She is a business woman owning a stall selling fruits vegetables and foods etc and she is a hard working lady,

In a bid to increase her working capital, she has applied for a loan of 500,000/= However she is faced with a challange of competition and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: To boost her food trade business, she will buy more foods for sell

loans.name: Herieth

texts.en: Herieth (25) lives with her parents in Kilombero district, she is not married. Herieth is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers working with youth in her village, she teaches entrepreneurship, health and life skills education to prepare youth into becoming responsible adults and active citizens. A part from volunteering to work with youth in her village also she runs a bicycle renting business. Herieth is requesting a Kiva loan to improve her business by increasing number of bicycles. She plans to use the profit she will earn to support her parents and her child with everyday needs such as food, clothing and health care.

loans.use: to improve her business by increasing number of bicycles.

loans.name: Noatia

texts.en:
Noatia is a 41-year-old woman with 7 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cakes in her village in order to earn a living.

Noatia has requested a loan to buy bags of ice, sacks of sugar, plastic bags, and containers, to assist her in running her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business, and provide for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bags of ice, sacks of sugar, plastic bags, and containers,.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene una serigrafía y cuenta con muchos trabajos por la poca competencia que hay en la zona y por la demanda que hay. Es un señor muy responsable que cumple siempre con los pedidos de sus clientes.
El se define a si mismo como una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un compresor, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder cumplir con sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sr. Celso is from the town of Santaní. He runs a printing business and has a lot of work because there is little competition and a lot of demand in the area. Celso is a very responsible person who always completes his customers' orders. He characterises himself as a hardworking person who wishes to get ahead. For that reason he always makes a great effort.

Celso is seeking this loan to buy a compressor which will be a great help to him in his work.

loans.use: buy a compressor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more bulk clothing

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is a married woman with three children all of whom  attend school. She owns a house that neither  has piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sukriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is married and has two children, one of them is disabled. For seven years she has been selling lingeries and trousseau. She mostly sells these to the people at the rehabilitation center to which she takes her son for treatment. With the help of the fourth loan she is planning to buy products in bulk before Bayram and sell them. She hopes that one day her son will fully recover and also to buy a house.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şükriye Hanım evli, biri spastik olmak üzere iki çocuk annesi. Yedi yıldır çamaşır, çeyizlik ürün satışı yapıyor. Genel de mallarını oğlunu tedavi için götürdüğü rehabilitasyon merkezlerinde oradaki çalışanlara ve gelen hasta yakınlarına satıyor. Aldığı dördüncü kredi ile bayramdan önce ürün alıp satmayı düşünüyor. Oğlunun tedavisini eksiksiz yaptırıp sağlığına kavuşmasını umut ediyor. Bir evi olsun istiyor.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes, polar blankets and muslin fabric, to help support her disabled son

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and his household income considerably.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a Camfed Learner Guide, Eva teaches life skills to students in her ward’s secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. To support her family, Eva continues to sell mobile phones and provides phone accessory services to her customers from her store. She managed to repay back her first loan.

She is now requesting second Kiva loan to buy more phones in her shop. The profit from the first loan help her to open a clothing business near her mobile shop. Eva will use her profit to support her family members who depend on her in paying fees and other needs such as food and school fees to her child.

loans.use: to order more stock, including more phones handsets and phone covers.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is a 50 year old mother with 5 children, she runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Fati requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags,

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru: Рита из городка Куляб. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Рита разведена мужем и детей выросла одна. Дети уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он зарабатывает и помогает маме обеспечить семью. Сама Рита образованная женщина. Она работает медсестрой в больнице. Рита хорошо ухаживает о пациенте. 15 лет назад она начала работать в больнице. У дочери Риты скора свадьба. Рита готовиться к свадьбе, и она купила свадебные принадлежности, но не все, потому что ей не хвата немного денег. Рита решила взять кредитом и за счет кредита приобрести остальное свадебные расходы.
texts.en:
Rita is from the town of Kulob. She is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. She and her husband are divorced and she raised her children on her own. They are already grown up and independent. Her son is working in Russia, earning money and helping his mother take care of the family. Rita herself is an educated woman who works as a nurse in a hospital and takes good care of her patients. She started working there 15 years ago.

Rita's daughter is getting married soon. Rita is preparing for the wedding and has bought some of the things they need but not everything, because she doesn't have enough money. She has decided to take out a loan to cover the remaining wedding costs.

loans.use: to pay for expenses for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Babban Gona farmer. Ali is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Ali can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ali has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ali is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia (23) a – tailoring- entrepreneur and is requesting a loan in order to construct a shop for her tailoring business. Asia lives with her parents and her siblings in the Kilosa district. Her work involves running her tailoring business, in order to pay school fees for her siblings and help her family too. Also she is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide. She plans to use the profit she will earn to expand her business of tailoring and open a fruit stall .

loans.use: to construct her own large frame for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Samalia

texts.en: Samalia is a 55 year old mother with 7 children. She owns and operates a small business of bingo in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Samalia requested for a loan to buy bingo machine, box of paper bingo, box of ink bottles, to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy bingo machine, box of paper bingo, box of ink bottles,

loans.name: Fodoli Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fodoli  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, están  haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y ofrecer a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, y que no pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Sofía, una de las integrantes de este grupo pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, acetonas, algodones, alicates y otros insumos que necesita para poder seguir dando su servicio de manicurista. Ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder procurarse una mejor vida, no solo para ella sino también para su familia
Sofía esta agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder capacitarse y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group called Fodoli is embarking on its first loan cycle in the Women's Committee Program. They are performing a study concerning the elimination of poverty in order to be able to improve their conditions of life, as well as offer their families a better quality of life, so they will no longer suffer a lack of necessities.

Mrs. Sofia, a member of the group, is requesting this loan so that she can buy nail polish, acetones, cotton balls, nail clippers, and other supplies she needs to be able to continue providing manicure services. She comments that by means of this work, she has a way of procuring a better life, not only for herself but also for her family.

Sofia is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving for training and self improvement.

loans.use: buy inputs for performing manicures, such as nail polish, acetones, cotton balls, nail clippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion works hard to support her family. Consolacion is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for 45 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gayatri Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Gayatri. It was formed in the year 2015 by ten like-minded women of Kokapadar village of Nuapada district of Odisha, India and belongs to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.

Indira, standing on the extreme right with a raised hand, is the featured member of the group. She hails from a Scheduled Caste with a poor background. She is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and one son of 6 years of age.

Indira has been running a dairy farm with two cows for the last four years. Presently, she is getting six liters of milk per day and supplying it to a tea stall in a nearby town. With this small income, she is hardly managing her household expenses as well as the farming expenses.

So, to enhance the income, Indira has planned to purchase a new milking cow of improved variety. Considering the demand of the market, she hopes that this investment will help her a lot. Indira dreams to purchase a bike to help in her milk business.

The other nine members of the group are also doing a milk business, running a general grocery shop, a fancy store, bangles business, goat rearing, and vegetable cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase a new milking cow of improved variety.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a divorced man, and he is retired. He lives alone, and he is happy living there. The place is quiet, and he likes to live peacefully and quietly.

Miguel needs another loan to fix the walls of his house. As you know, this will take time.

Miguel likes the community where he lives, and he hopes you can keep helping him to have a good house.

loans.use: to fix the walls of his house

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is working a lot, thanks to his clothing business. He is still single, but he helps his parents and lives with them.

Cesar needs a loan to buy fabric for his business.

Cesar is trying to get contracts with private companies to make uniforms. He hopes you can help him. Cesar is healthy, and he is working hard.

loans.use: to buy fabric for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas 2 está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, que se unió para poder trabajar de manera unida, y así poder ayudar a sus familias, trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por mejorar.
La Sra. Maria, una de las integrantes de este grupo, solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su peluquería y servicio de manicurista, como ser: tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, alicates, esmaltes y otros, comenta que por medio de su humilde negocio tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder dar a su familia lo que necesita una mejor vida.
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza para poder mejorar y es por ello que vio una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Activas 2" is taking their first loan. It is a new group that got together to be able to work in a unified manner and to be able to help their families. They are working within the Poverty Stoplight Program, fighting and striving to improve.

Maria one of the members of the group is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her hair salon and manicurist services such as dye, creams, shampoo, rinses, pincers, nail polish and others. She commented that through her humble business she has the income she needs to be able to give her family what they need for a better life.

Maria is a very hard-working person who strives to become better and for this reason she sees a great opportunity in this program from the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy supplies like dye, creams, shampoo, rinses, pincers, nail polish and others.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUCERO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
 La socia es la Sra. Boni ,la socia tiene 61 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche  entre otros. 
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank "Lucero" (little light); this bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco as well.  One member, Miss Boni, is 61 years old, has two children and is married.  She alternates her daily activities, working in her grocery store.  This member thanks those that form part of her dream through these means and she promises to make her payments under the established terms. She wants to continue working this way to continue supporting her family.  Boni is requesting this credit to buy rice, sugar, and milk, amongst other items. The members in general are grateful for the loans already granted and promise to make their established payments. The members that appear in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and milk, amongst other items.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Ma. Fe requested another loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 45 years old, married, and has three children, who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Neneth requested a loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa to sell

loans.name: Awah Peter

texts.en:
He is married to two wives with six children. They live in four bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced challenges in life such as the death of his parents, the lost of his job, the lost of his two children and inadequate finance to start up a business of his own. He was motivated by his friends to join GHAPE and he has been a member since 2009. He has successfully taken and repaid EC four times.

With this new loan he will buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide, herbicide, seeds hire labor to work on the farm and he will equally buy food stuffs to put in his store. He is very optimistic that the business will succeed because he has a good business site and the population is increasing every day as such the demand for food is also increasing. The community will benefit from this activity in that they will buy at a cheaper rate and he will also employ labor.

He intends to use the profit to pay his children’s education, provide medication for His children. He prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, cocoa yams, plantain, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vagana

texts.en: Vagana is a 50 year old mother with 2 children, she runs a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Vagana requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage and plastic bags,

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha who is in her early 30's is married with two kids,one of whom is in school and other is still small. She has been selling clothes and shoes for three years now.She works from 09am to 05pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per monthly.

This will Asha's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing on  the clothes stock and started selling shoes.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.She used the profit to pay school fees,loan repayments,take care of her family  renovated her house and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the latest fashion of clothes and shoes to meet her customers' requirement. She dreams of building her own house.

Asha will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy the latest   fashion  clothes and shoes to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is the mother of 2 kids and she is the owner of the family house. Damiana is in the cheese business, which she learned about when she was a child. She is helped by her kids in the business but the kids go to the school.

Damiana needs a loan to buy a milking cow so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fátima 1 está en su ciclo número 6º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, el  esfuerzo que están haciendo es continuo y permanente y así lograr un éxito total en sus vidas y en la de  sus  familias, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra.  Juana  es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos y materia prima para la elaboración de prendas de vestir tejidas, como ser telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, ya que ella se dedica a la confecciones de prendas.
Juana es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder cumplir con sus clientes, ya que es muy responsable.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima 1 group is in its sixth cycle in the women's committee program, where all of the members work and help each other to get ahead.  Their efforts are continuous and permanent and that's how they are able to succeed in their lives and with their families and improve their living conditions.  

Juana, one of the members, is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make tailored clothing such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies, since she makes a living sewing garments.  

Juana is a very hard-working person who always puts in the maximum effort to be able to fill the orders from her clients, since she is very responsible.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other supplies to make clothes.

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Pheang is 46 years old and has five children. She resides in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She grows cassava and rice to earn income for her family, which she has been doing for 28 years. She earns additional income from working for others for a fee. Because of the lack of water, her rice and cassava did not produce a good yield. 

Pheang requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer to get a good yield from her cassava farm. She will use a part of loan to purchase organic pesticide in get a good yield from her rice farm. She hopes that she can get good yield from her both farms to upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.In addition she also operates a retail shop business that earns her another source of income. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Isah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Isah can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Isah will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Isah is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Lupesina

texts.en: Lupesina is 34 years old with 3 children. She runs a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Lupesina requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Iusitina

texts.en: Iusitina is a 32 year old mother with 1 child. She runs and operates a small business of  selling pancake, buns, pork cake in her community to earn a living. Iusitina requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, vegetable oil, to help her run the business. Iusitina will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, vegetable oil,

loans.name: Sol De Luz 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Imacula is one of the members of Sol de Luz 1, 2 & 3. This group comprised of Haitian immigrants and they are located in the city of Santo Domingo, which is one the rural cities around the capital in the country and whose economy is dependent on different sales markets and working in the capital industry. These 15 entrepreneurs are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Imacula, a Haitian mother living in the north of Santo Domingo, makes her home in a simple structure with two of her three children. They live together in their small and simple home structure. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She sells shoes and she will increase her inventory by buying different shoes sizes and styles for kids, men and women. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help her partner with home expenses. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Agustin es de la ciudad de Santaní, continua con sus ventas en su mercería, comenta que mediante su préstamo anterior pudo poder mejorar para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agustin es una persona luchadora, es por ello que se sacrifica mucho.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados, remeras, camisas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Agustin is from the city of Santaní.  He continues selling his merchandise, and comments that his previous loan allowed him to continue along with his sales as he had been before.  Agustin has a fighting spirit, and he has sacrificed a lot for it.  

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy footwear, T-shirts, shirts, and other clothing so that he can continue along with his sales as he has been.

loans.use: to buy footwear, T-shirts, shirts, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania works hard to support her family. Melania is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a 55 year old, married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lanie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Lanie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sairam Group

texts.en:
Sairam Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in August 2015, consisting of ten rural poor women who belong below the poverty line. This group is located in a remotely rural village named Palsipani of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. As this village is surrounded by forest and situated in the bank of a minor irrigation project, vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the members of this group.

Santosini is one of them. The smiling lady sitting on the extreme right with raised hand in the photo is Santosini. She is a very active and forward lady of 27 years age living with her husband, one son of seven years, and one daughter of eighteen months. Her son has just started his studies in the local government. school.

Santosini works as a fourth grade employee in Integrated Child Development Scheme (ICDS) project of the government of Odisha. Apart from that, she has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare. Her husband manages the farm.

Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. He produces vegetables like brinjals, cauliflowers, carrots, cabbages, chiles, cucumbers, papayas, ladies' fingers, onions, etc., on the farm and sells the products to the traders of the nearby town who come to take vegetables from the farm.

She says that she earns a minimum amount of 4,000 INR per month from this business which is insufficient to meet the day to day expenses of her family, farm expenses, and business investment. Santosini wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Kiva through her SHG from Mahashakti Foundation. She has planned to utilize the present loan to buy a water pump, seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm.

She expects a good return from this investment. Santosini hopes to construct a house for her family and give better education to her children. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

Among the other nine group members, four members are doing the milk business, one member is running a general store, two members are doing vegetable cultivation, and fish selling and goat rearing are done by other two members.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump, seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija  is a married woman; she has two kids all of attend school. Hadija owns a house that  has electricity and  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is is food.
Hadija has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door where passersby and town dwellers are her potential neighbours. She faces a  challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to add on her savings and purchase a new motorcycle. Hadija joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 22 years old. She is not married and she doesn't t have a child. Neema is a Camfed learner guide teaching students life skills in her nearby secondary school.

Neema runs a a Mobile Money Transfer business in her ward and phone accessories. She request Kiva loan to expand her business by buying credit from Airtel, Vodacom and Tigo also to have cash to serve her customs. The profit obtained from the loan will help her to improve her money transaction business in her shop and have variety of network providers services

loans.use: to expand her business by buying credit from Airtel, Vodacom and Tigo

loans.name: El Divino Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Divino está en su ciclo número 3, están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y por medio de ello poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, y evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
La Sra. Gloria es una de las integrantes, es una persona que se esfuerza y se sacrifica para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus seres queridos, ella se dedica a la venta comidas que los prepara ella misma, todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, gracias a que son muy ricas sus comidas, ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella lo que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carnes, pollo, condimentos, panificados, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con los ricos productos que hace.
texts.en:
This group called "El Divino" is in their third loan cycle working in the Poverty Stoplight Program. They get to recognize the situation of each of their lives and doing this they can provide their families with a better quality of living and avoid suffering the hardships they went through.

Gloria is one of the members. She is a person who strives and sacrifices herself to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She works selling meals that she prepares herself, every day from a very early hour. Thanks to her meals being very delicious she has a good clientele who always buys what she is selling.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies to make her meals like meat, chicken, condiments, bread products and others. In this way she can continue to delight her customers with the tasty products she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, bread products and other ingredients to continue to make her meals.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino has been married for over 20 years. He is father of two kids who go to school. Paulino owns the family house, which is made of adobe.

Paulino used to be a school teacher, but he is retired. Now he is making money by making and selling cheese. When he was a child he learned how to manage a farm.

Paulino needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

Paulino is healthy, and he works hard because he likes the cheese business.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
El Sr. Roman tiene 45 años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijos, ambos ya mayores de edad, que pudo sacar adelante por medio de su trabajo y sacrificio. 
 Don Roman es de profesión zapatero, se dedica a la elaboración de calzados en forma independiente. Comenta que anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en la Argentina en una fábrica y como las cosas no iban tan bien decidió volver al país junto a su familia. 
El préstamo lo pide para la compra de una maquinaria que le será muy útil en la fabricación de los zapatos.
texts.en:
Roman is 45 years old and a single father of two adult children that he was able to move forwards through his work and sacrifice.  

Roman is a shoemaker.  He makes a living making footwear independently.  He comments that before he was working in Argentina in a factory and things weren't going so well, so he decided to return to his country and his family.  

The loan that he is asking for is to buy a machine that will be useful for making shoes.

loans.use: to buy machinery to make footwear.

loans.name: Maceline

texts.en:
Maceline is 41 years old. She is married with one child.

Maceine has had a grocery business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase vegetables and hopes this will help her expand the business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to help her expand the business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Mwanasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Renacer, lleva este nombre ya que ellas quieren renacer para poder mejorar sus vidas,  está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Felipa es una de las integrantes quien solicita este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer comidas que ella misma se encarga de hacer todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella quiere comprar insumos como verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder mejorar
Felipa es una persona muy sacrificada que desea capacitarse para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer, has this name as the members want to be reborn to be able to improve their lives. They are in their tenth loan cycle of the Woman's Committee Program and they are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey, fighting to improve each day

Felipa is one of the members who is requesting this loan. She wants to be able to buy supplies to make her meals that she takes care of making every day from a very early hour. She wants to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments, garden produce, bread products and others. Doing this she can improve.

Felipa is a very determined person who wants to enable herself to be able to help her loved ones through her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for meals like vegetables, meat, chicken, condiments, garden produce, bread products and others.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with four school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is single woman with no children. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Fridah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.In addition she also operates a cloth selling business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize and rice for resale

loans.name: Channat's Group

texts.en:
Channat is a 43-year-old married mother of two dependent children who are in school. She lives in Tbaung Khmum province where the cassava-growing business has been the main source of income for years. Sometimes, she collects rubber latex for others for a fee. Low cassava yields are the main challenge for her.

Channat decided to form a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. This is the second cycle for her. Her past loan helped her meet her family’s needs in a timely manner and renovate some parts of her house.

As the group leader, she will use her loan to renovate her house so it will be in good condition. She hopes that she can live in a decent house as others do and expand her cassava growing business.

loans.use: to renovate her house so it will be in good condition.

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es:
Omaira es una madre responsable y trabajadora de 52 años de edad, una persona humilde pero que lucha día a día por llevar el alimento a su mesa.
Vive con su pareja en unión libre, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad y vive en el  municipio Puerto Salgar.
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de arepas, también los fines de semana vende chorizos y bebidas afuera de su casa.
Los logros obtenidos en las ventas no son suficientes para esta mujer que quiere surgir a toda costa para estabilizarse, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para preparar arepas y principalmente en la compra de una parrilla grande.
Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familiar una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva lo logrará.
texts.en:
Omaira is a responsible and hardworking mother.  She is 52 years old and is a humble person, but she fights day by day to bring food to her table.  She lives with her common-law partner.  She has two adult children and lives in the town of Puerto Salgar.

She works preparing and selling arepas [a traditional food made with corn dough and fillings].  On weekends, she also sells sausages and drinks outside her house.

The successes she has had in her sales aren’t enough for this woman who wants to surge ahead, no matter the cost, to get settled.  It is because of this that she finds herself asking for a loan.  She will invest the loan mainly in the purchase of a grill, and also buy ingredients for making arepas.  

Her greatest desire is to be able to give her family greater financial stability.  She knows that with a hand from Interactuar and collaborators through Kiva’s portal, she will accomplish it.

loans.use: to buy a large grill and ingredients to make arepas

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 20-year-old entrepreneur, requesting a loan to start a cosmetics business. She is currently living with her husband in Kilombero district. She Volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide, She teaches life skill to secondary students in her ward.

She plans to use the profit she earns to supporting her parents with medical care, increasing her business. Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Sara's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to start a cosmetics business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old widow, a mother to 5. Her source of survival is palm oil processing and marketing. She has been into this trade for over 6 years now. She likes this business because it is one of the means of survival in the rural area and also it is sustainable. This trade gives her enough time to take care of her 5 children since her husband died two years ago.

The income she gets from this business is used for her daily expenses and also used to support her children's school fees.
A portion of this loan will help her buy storage drums and also part of it will be used to process palm product during the peak season. She thanks all Kiva lenders that support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil storage drums and store palm oil products

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is a divorced man. He is the father of one son. Johnny lives at his parents' house.

Johnny works in the sewing business. He learned about this business when he was very young.

Johnny needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine for his business.

Johnny has great plans. He would like to have a big workshop in the future. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for his business.

loans.name: Buluh Sari Group

texts.en:
Ida Ayu is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in rural area, far from the city. Her husband is a farmer. Ida Ayu has a small kiosk business. This business was chosen because her village is far from the city and the villagers will buy their daily needs at her kiosk. 

To increase her business, Ida Ayu and some women in her village established the Buluh Sari Group to borrow from MUK. The group consist of 10 women and they operate various kinds of businesses, such as retail, traveling salesperson, service, and farmer. 

After had several surveys and evaluation from MUK, the Buluh Sari Group received their loan for 1,500,000 IDR each. The group decided to make monthly payments for their repayment schedule.

Ida Ayu will use her portion of the loan to purchase more stock for her kiosk such as coconut oil, rice, kitchen needs, soap, and shampoo. She will also use her loan to enlarge her kiosk. She hopes her kiosk can handle all the needs of her customers and she will earn more profit. Ida Ayu hopes to renovate her kiosk and use the profit to support her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as coconut oil, rice, kitchen needs, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Ratnamala

texts.en:
Ratnamala is a resident of Padampur village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 41 years old. She has a small family with her husband and three sons. She and her husband are engaged in a dairy business.

She has everything required by the basic necessities of life: permanent monthly income from an established business, a two wheeler, and allied items to manage her family. Still her family members are not happy due to the lack of a good RCC (reinforced cement concrete) house of their own.

They are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent, without sufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during rainy season. It is also very critical to stay there during the summer and winter season. In this situation, she decided to construct a house with good standards. She has already started to construct the house, but she is not having sufficient funds to complete it. So she decided to take a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment Ratnamala came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Ratnamala for house construction.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within few months. It not only reduces the financial burden but also help Ratnamala to feel proud to own a house in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, metal, iron rods, and distemper (paint).

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and  works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Maribel requested a loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, soap, milk, eggs, canned goods, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, soap, milk, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is selling the cheese she makes at the Patacamaya fair she is still single and she lives with her parents and sisters. She helps her family with the expenses.

Rita wants to increase her cheese production that is why she wants to buy another milking cow for her farm. Rita wants to go to many places to offer her cheese and she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to provide milk for her cheese making

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga is a 23 year old mother with 1 child.  She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Tusiga requested for a loan to buy wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), and hand gloves,
